analyzed: lekhakaḥ samanuprāptaḥ dainyena mahatā anvitaḥ

analyzed: na kenacid paṭaḥ hi asya mārjitaḥ bhūt ca dharmiṇā

analyzed: yat na dṛṣṭam vā api tat iha eva pradṛśyate
translated: What has not been seen or heard is being shown here itself.

analyzed: evam uccaratām teṣām bhūtānām kṛta śāsanaḥ
translated: While they were speaking thus, the one who had carried out their orders,

analyzed: mūla chinnaḥ yathā śākhī trāhi trāhi iti saṃrudan

analyzed: paribhūtaḥ smi deveśa yat mārjita paṭaḥ kṛtaḥ

analyzed: tvayā nāthena vidhuram paśyāmi kamalāsana

analyzed: evam bruvan sa niśceṣṭaḥ babhūva dvijasaṃttamāḥ

analyzed: tatas halahalā śabdaḥ sabhāyām samavartata

analyzed: rodayate lokān sarvān sthāvara ja gamān

analyzed: saḥ yam roditi duḥkha ārtaḥ kasmāt vaivasvataḥ yamaḥ

analyzed: nahi duṣkṛta karmā hi naraḥ prāpnoti śobhanam
translated: For a man who has done evil does not attain what is good.

analyzed: tatas nivārayāmāsa vāyuḥ teṣām vacaḥ tadā

analyzed: lokānām sama cittānām matam jñātvā hi vedhasaḥ
translated: knowing the opinion of the creator of the people of equal minds.

analyzed: nivārya śaṅkām mārtaṇḍim śanais utthāpayan vibhuḥ
translated: Having stopped the suspicion, the lord slowly raised up the son of Martanda,

analyzed: bhujābhyām sādhu pīnābhyām loka mūrtiḥ udāra dhīḥ

analyzed: vihvalam tam palāyantam āsane saṃnyaveśayat

analyzed: sa kāyastham uvāca idam vyoma mūrtim raveḥ sutam

analyzed: kena tvam abhibhūtaḥ si kena sthānāt vivāsitaḥ

analyzed: kena apamārjitaḥ deva paṭaḥ loka paṭaḥ tava

analyzed: brūhi sarvam aśeṣeṇa kuśaketuḥ vadatu ayam

analyzed: yaḥ prabhuḥ tāta sarveṣām sa te kartā samunnatim

analyzed: apaneṣyati mārtaṇḍe duḥkham hṛdaya saṃsthitam

analyzed: saḥ evam uktaḥ tu prabhañjanena dineśa sūnuḥ tam atho babhāṣe

analyzed: vilokya vaktram kuśaketu sūnoḥ sa gadgadam mandam udīrayan vacaḥ

analyzed: yamaḥ uvāca
translated: Yama said:

analyzed: nispṛhaḥ nā ācaret yaḥ tu niyogam padmasaṃbhava

original: andhakūpe nipatati sa cāśu narake dhruvam // / / //

analyzed: niyogī na niyogam yaḥ karoti kamalāsana

analyzed: yaḥ śnāti lobhāt vittāni prajābhyaḥ vā mahīpateḥ

analyzed: niyogī narakam yāti yāvat kalpa śata trayam

analyzed: ātma kārya paraḥ yaḥ tu svāminam ca viluṃpati

analyzed: bhavet veśmani manda ātmā ākhuḥ kalpa śata trayam

analyzed: bhṛtyān vai karma karaṇe rājñaḥ mārjāra tām vrajet

translated: O Lord, I, ruling the subjects righteously by your command,

analyzed: samyak vicārya munibhiḥ gharma śāstra ādibhiḥ vibho

analyzed: saḥ u ham tvadīyena vibho niyogena eva śaknuyām

analyzed: kartum rukmāṅgadena adya parābhūtaḥ hi bhūbhujā

analyzed: bhayāt yasya jagannātha pṛthivī sāgarāṃbarā

analyzed: vihāya sarva dharmān tu vihāya pitṛ pūjanam

analyzed: teṣām api janetāraḥ janitṝṇām hi pūrvajāḥ

analyzed: etat duḥkham punar deva mama marma vibhedanam

analyzed: tatas nyasya kṛtam brahman bījam dhātrī samudbhavam

analyzed: acchidraiḥ gamya nānaiḥ ca naraiḥ tribhuvana arcita

analyzed: apramāṇam aham manye lokam viṣṇoḥ jagatpate

analyzed: svakarma sthāḥ vikarma sthāḥ śucayaḥ śucayaḥ pi vā

analyzed: upoṣya vāsaram viṣṇoḥ lokam yānti nṛpa ājñayā

analyzed: nigrāhyaḥ jagatām nātha bhavet na asti atra saṃśayaḥ

analyzed: tena varṣa sahasreṇa śāsitam kṣiti maṇḍalam

analyzed: āropayitvā garuḍe kṛtvā rūpam catur bhujam

analyzed: yadi sthāsyati deveśa mādhavyām mādhava priyaḥ
translated: if he will stay in Mādhava, dear to Mādhava, O Lord of gods,

analyzed: samastam neṣyate lokam viṣṇoḥ padam anāmayam

analyzed: eṣa daṇḍaḥ paṭaḥ hi eṣa tava padbhyām visarjitaḥ

analyzed: lokapāla tvam atulam tena bhūbhujā

analyzed: rukmāṅgadena deveśa dhanyā sā sa dhṛtaḥ yayā

analyzed: sarva duḥkha vināśāya mātrṛ jātaḥ guṇa adhikaḥ

analyzed: kim apatyena jātena mātuḥ kleśa kareṇa hi

analyzed: ekā hi vīrasūḥ eva virañce na atra saṃśayaḥ

analyzed: yayā rukmāṅgadaḥ jātaḥ vai

analyzed: nā idam vyavasthitam deva kṣitau kena api bhūbhujā

analyzed: pravāda mānam paṭaham su ghoram pralopa mānam

analyzed: rukmāṅgadaḥ tu rāja indraḥ bhuktvā bhogān tu mānuṣān  saṃpūjya bahuśas devam pīta aṃbara dharam haram
translated: King Rukmangada, having enjoyed human pleasures,🔽Having worshipped the god Hari, the wearer of yellow garments, many times,

original: datvā mūrdhni padaṃ viprāḥ śatrīṇāṃ raṇaśālinām /
analyzed: da tvā mūrdhni padam viprāḥ śatrīṇām raṇa śālinām
translated: Placing his foot on the heads of the enemies skilled in battle, O Brahmins,

analyzed: kṛtvā śūnyam yama patham jitvā vaivasvatam yamam
translated: Having emptied the path of Yama and having conquered Yama, the son of the sun,

analyzed: vaikuṇṭhasya tu panthānam saṃpūrṇam mānavaiḥ kṛtam
translated: The path to Vaikuntha has been completely made by humans.

analyzed: āhūya tanayam kāle dharmāṅgadam abhāṣata
translated: Having called his son Dharmagupta at the right time, he said:

analyzed: etām vasumatīm putra vasu pūrṇām samantataḥ
translated: O son, this earth, full of wealth everywhere,

analyzed: paripālaya vīryeṇa svadharme kṛta niścayaḥ
translated: Protect it with your valor, being firm in your own duty.

original: putra samarthe jāte yo rājyaṃ na pratipādayet /
analyzed: putra samarthe jāte yaḥ rājyam na pratipādayet
translated: O son! If a father, after the birth of a capable son, does not hand over the kingdom to him,

analyzed: tasya dharmaḥ tathā kīrtiḥ vinasyati na saṃśayaḥ
translated: his dharma and fame will undoubtedly be destroyed.

original: samarthena ca putreṇa yo na yāti pitā sukham /
analyzed: samarthena ca putreṇa yaḥ na yāti pitā sukham
translated: If a father does not enjoy happiness due to a capable son,

analyzed: pātakī saḥ pi vijñeyaḥ bhuvanatraye
translated: he should be known as a sinner in the three worlds.

original: piturbhārakṣamaḥ putro bhāraṃ nodvahate tu yaḥ /
analyzed: pituḥ bhāra kṣamaḥ putraḥ bhāram na udvahate tu yaḥ
translated: A son who is capable of bearing his father's burden but does not bear it,

analyzed: mātuḥ uccāra vat jātaḥ dvijihvaḥ viṣa varjitaḥ
translated: is born like a two-tongued snake devoid of poison.

analyzed: sa putraḥ yaḥ dhika khyātaḥ pituḥ bhavati bhū tale
translated: That son who becomes more famous than his father on earth,

analyzed: prakāśayati sarvatra sva karaiḥ iva bhāskaraḥ
translated: illuminates everywhere like the sun with his own rays.

analyzed: putra apanaya jaiḥ duḥkhaiḥ rātrau jāgartim yat pitā
translated: The father who keeps awake at night due to the sorrows caused by the son,

analyzed: sa putraḥ narakam yāti yāvat ābhūtasaṃplavam
translated: that son goes to hell until the dissolution of all beings.

analyzed: pituḥ vacanam ādṛtya sarvam yaḥ kurute gṛhe
translated: He who, after listening to his father's words, does everything in the house,

original: sa yāti deva sāyujyaṃ stūyamāno divi sthitaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa yāti deva sāyujyam stūyamānaḥ divi sthitaiḥ
translated: he attains union with the god, being praised by those who are in heaven.

original: so 'haṃ prajākṛte putra āsaktaḥ karmabhiḥ kṣitau /
analyzed: saḥ ham prajā kṛte putraḥ āsaktaḥ karmabhiḥ kṣitau
translated: O son! I am engaged in the welfare of the subjects and in worldly activities on the earth.

original: na bhuktaṃ naiva suptaṃ tu svecchayā pālane sthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na bhuktam na eva suptam tu sva icchayā pālane sthitaḥ
translated: I have not eaten nor slept as I wish, being engaged in protection.

original: asamarthe tvayi suta na prāptaṃ hi mayā sukham /
analyzed: asamarthe tvayi suta na prāptam hi mayā sukham
translated: O son, I have not obtained happiness from you who are incapable.

analyzed: viṣṇu vāsara bhoktṝṇām nigrahe kṛtabuddhinā
translated: For those who observe the day of Vishnu, I have made up my mind to punish them.

analyzed: kecid śaive sthitāḥ mārge saure kecid vyavasthitāḥ
translated: Some are established in the Shaiva path, some in the solar path,

analyzed: viriñci mārga gāḥ ca anye pārvatyāḥ ca sthitāḥ pare
translated: Others follow the path of Brahma, others are established in the path of Parvati.

analyzed: sāyam ca prātar āsīnāḥ agnihotre vyavasthitāḥ
translated: Some sit in the evening and morning, established in the Agnihotra ritual.

original: bālo yuvā vā vṛddho vā gurviṇī vā kumārikā // / / //
analyzed: bālaḥ yuvā vā vṛddhaḥ vā gurviṇī vā kumārikā
translated: Whether a child, a youth, an old man, a pregnant woman, or a young girl,

original: sarogo vikalo vāpi na śaknoti hyupoṣitum /🔽ityevaṃ jalpitaṃ yaistu tānnirasya samantataḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa rogaḥ vikalaḥ vā api na śaknoti hi upoṣitum  iti evam jalpitam yaiḥ tu tān nirasya samantataḥ
translated: One who is sick or disabled is not able to fast.🔽Those who speak thus, I drive them away from all directions.

analyzed: vacobhiḥ tu purāṇa uktaiḥ vāsaraiḥ bahubhiḥ tu aham
translated: With many words spoken in the Puranas, I instruct them about the days of fasting.

analyzed: saṃbodhayitvā bahuśas prajānām sukha hetave
translated: Having instructed them many times for the sake of the happiness of the people,

analyzed: nigṛhya tān hari dine nirāhārān karomi ca
translated: I restrain them on the day of Hari and make them fast.

analyzed: śāstra dṛṣṭyā tu viduṣaḥ mūrkhān daṇḍana pūrvakam
translated: By the view of the scriptures, I punish the wise and the foolish,

analyzed: śāsayitvā kṛtāḥ sarve nirāhārāḥ hareḥ dine
translated: And having instructed them all, I make them fast on the day of Hari.

original: tena me na sukhaṃ kiñcidavalīḍhaṃ dharātale // / / //
analyzed: tena me na sukham kiñcid avalīḍham dharā tale
translated: Therefore, I have not obtained any happiness on the earth.

analyzed: kaccit na duḥkhena janān yojayet kila putraka
translated: O son, does the king employ the people in his service without causing them pain?

original: svebhyo vāpi parebhyo vā yā rakṣecca prajā nṛpaḥ // / / //
analyzed: svebhyaḥ vā api parebhyaḥ vā yāḥ rakṣet ca prajāḥ nṛpaḥ
translated: Does the king protect his subjects from their own people as well as from others?

analyzed: tasya amī hi akṣayāḥ lokāḥ purāṇeṣu prakīrtitāḥ
translated: The eternal worlds of such a king are declared in the Puranas.

original: so 'haṃ prajākṛte saumya saṃsthito nātmanaḥ kvacit // / / //
analyzed: saḥ ham prajā kṛte saumya saṃsthitaḥ na ātmanaḥ kvacid
translated: O amiable one, I am engaged in the welfare of my subjects, not for my own sake.

analyzed: saukhyam icchāmi aham bhoktum mṛgayā ādi samudbhavam
translated: I desire to enjoy pleasures arising from hunting and such activities.

analyzed: na pāna dyūta jam putra kāmaye ham kadācana
translated: O son, I never desire pleasures arising from drinking and gambling.

analyzed: eṣu sakto cirāt putra vināśam yāti pārthivaḥ
translated: A king addicted to these soon meets with destruction.

analyzed: tvad prasādāt aham putra mṛgayā vyājataḥ dhunā
translated: O son, through your grace, I now wish to go out for hunting under the pretext of hunting.

analyzed: girīn vanāni saritaḥ sarāṃsi vividhāni ca
translated: I desire to enjoy various mountains, forests, rivers, lakes and other things.

analyzed: bhoktu kāmaḥ priyān kāmān tvayi bhāram niveśya ca
translated: Desiring to enjoy pleasing objects, I place the burden on you.

analyzed: etat sarvam samākhyātam yat sthitam hṛdaye mama
translated: I have thus told you everything that is in my heart.

analyzed: kṛte tava mahā kīrtiḥ akṛte naraka sthitiḥ
translated: If you do this, you will have great fame; if not, you will remain in hell.

analyzed: dharmāṅgadaḥ uvāca
translated: Dharmagupta said:

analyzed: sarvam etat kariṣyāmi bhuṅkṣva bhogān manaḥ nugān
translated: I will do all this. Enjoy pleasures as you wish.

analyzed: gurvīm rājya dhuram tāta tvadīyām uddharāmi aham
translated: I shall remove the heavy burden of the kingdom from you, dear child.

analyzed: nahi me nyaḥ smṛtaḥ dharmaḥ tvad vākya karaṇam vinā
translated: For me, there is no other duty than to carry out your words.

analyzed: pituḥ vākyam akurvāṇaḥ kurvan dharmān adhas vrajet
translated: One who does not carry out the words of his father, even if he performs other righteous acts, will go to hell.

analyzed: tasmāt kariṣye vacanam tvadīyam prāñjaliḥ sthitaḥ
translated: Therefore, with folded hands, I shall carry out your words.

original: evamukte tu vacane rājā hṛṣṭo babhūva ha // / / //
analyzed: evam ukte tu vacane rājā hṛṣṭaḥ babhūva ha
translated: When these words were spoken, the king became delighted.

analyzed: gantu kāmaḥ mṛgān bhūyas labdhvā jñātvā vanam tatas
translated: Desiring to go again to the forest to hunt deer, he left.

analyzed: dharmāṅgadaḥ pi dṛṣṭa ātmā prajāḥ āhūya ca abravīt
translated: Dharmagupta, having attained spiritual insight, summoned the people and said:

original: pitrā niyukto bhavatāṃ pālanāya hitāya ca /
analyzed: pitrā niyuktaḥ bhavatām pālanāya hitāya ca
translated: I have been appointed by my father for the protection and welfare of you all.

analyzed: pituḥ vākyam mayā kāryam sarvathā dharmam icchatā
translated: By me, who desires righteousness in every way, the words of my father must be carried out.

original: nānyo hi dharmaḥ putrasya piturvākyaṃ vinā prajāḥ /
analyzed: na anyaḥ hi dharmaḥ putrasya pituḥ vākyam vinā prajāḥ

original: mayi daṇḍadhare śāstā na yamo bhavati kvacit // / / //
analyzed: mayi daṇḍa dhare śāstā na yamaḥ bhavati kvacid
translated: When I am the punisher, Yama, the chastiser, is nowhere to be found.

original: evaṃ jñātvā tu yuṣmābhiḥ smartavyo garuḍadhvajaḥ /
analyzed: evam jñātvā tu yuṣmābhiḥ smartavyaḥ garuḍadhvajaḥ

analyzed: brahma arpaṇa prayogeṇa yajanīyaḥ janārdanaḥ
translated: Janardana should be worshipped through the practice of Brahma-arpana.

analyzed: mamatvam hi parityajya sva jāti vihitena ca
translated: Having renounced possessiveness and following the duties of one's own caste,

original: yena vo hyakṣayā lokā bhaveyurnātra saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yena vaḥ hi akṣayāḥ lokāḥ bhaveyuḥ na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: By which your worlds would become imperishable, there is no doubt about this.

analyzed: pitṛ mārga adhikaḥ hi eṣa bhavatām darśitaḥ prajāḥ
translated: This path of the ancestors is indeed superior to yours, O people.

analyzed: brahma arpaṇa kriyā yuktāḥ bhavantu jñāna kovidāḥ
translated: May they be endowed with the act of offering to Brahman and be knowledgeable in wisdom.

original: na bhoktavyaṃ haridine paitro mārgastu śāśvataḥ /
analyzed: na bhoktavyam haridine paitraḥ mārgaḥ tu śāśvataḥ
translated: One should not eat on the day of Hari. The path of the ancestors is eternal.

analyzed: viśeṣaḥ hi mayā ākhyātaḥ bhavatām brahma saṃsthitiḥ

analyzed: prayoktavyā ca tattva jñaiḥ punarāvṛtti durlabhā

analyzed: yat upoṣyam hari dinam tat avaśyam iti sthitiḥ
translated: It is the rule that the day of Hari should be fasted.

original: anunīya prajāḥ sarvāḥ samāśvātyata punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: anunīya prajāḥ sarvāḥ samāśvātyata punar punar
translated: Having appeased all the people and reassured them again and again,

original: na divā na ca śarvaryāṃ śete dharmāṃ gadaḥ sadā // / / //🔽sarvatra bhramate śauryātkurvanniṣkaṇṭakāṃ kṣitim /
analyzed: na divā na ca śarvaryām śete gadaḥ sadā  sarvatra bhramate śauryāt kurvan niṣkaṇṭakām kṣitim
translated: The righteous king never sleeps during the day or at night.🔽He roams everywhere out of valor, making the earth free from thorns.

analyzed: paṭahaḥ raṭate nityam mṛgāri ripu mastake
translated: The kettle-drum always sounds on the head of the enemy of the enemy of the deer.

original: abhuktvā dvādaśīṃ lokā mamatvena vivarjitāḥ /🔽trividheṣu ca kāryeṣu deveśaścintyatāṃ hariḥ // / / //
analyzed: a bhuktvā dvādaśīm lokāḥ mamatvena vivarjitāḥ  trividheṣu ca kāryeṣu deveśaḥ cintyatām hariḥ
translated: The people, having fasted on the twelfth day, are free from the sense of possession.🔽In all three kinds of actions, Hari, the Lord of gods, should be thought of.

analyzed: havya kavya vahaḥ devaḥ saḥ eva puruṣottamaḥ
translated: That very Lord Purushottama is the carrier of oblations to gods and ancestors.

original: sūrye yo hi kṛśākāśe visarge jagatāṃ patiḥ // / / //
analyzed: sūrye yaḥ hi kṛśa ākāśe visarge jagatām patiḥ
translated: The Lord of the worlds, in the sky of the sun, at the time of dissolution.

analyzed: smarttavyaḥ manujaiḥ sarvaiḥ dharma kāma artha kāmukaiḥ
translated: He should be remembered by all men who desire Dharma, wealth and love.

analyzed: sva jāti vihitaḥ pi evam sat mārge ca eva mādhavaḥ
translated: Even so, Madhava is on the right path, as prescribed by one's own caste.

original: sa eva bhoktā bhoktavyaḥ sa eva puruṣottamaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva bhoktā bhoktavyaḥ saḥ eva puruṣa uttamaḥ
translated: He alone is the enjoyer, the one to be enjoyed, he alone is the Supreme Being.

analyzed: viniyogaḥ tu tasya eva sarva karmasu yujyate
translated: His application is proper in all rituals.

analyzed: evam raṭanti vipra indrāḥ paṭahe megha niḥsvane
translated: Thus the best of Brahmins chant on the drum with the sound of clouds.

analyzed: evam dharmam avāpya atha pitām dharmāṅgadasya hi
translated: Thus having attained Dharma, the father of Dharmagupta,

analyzed: jñātvā putram kriyā upetam ātmanaḥ hi adhikam dvijāḥ
translated: Knowing the son endowed with action, superior to himself, O Brahmins.

analyzed: uvāca bhāryām saṃhṛṣṭaḥ sthitām lakṣmīm iva aparām
translated: He joyfully spoke to his wife, standing like another Lakshmi.

analyzed: saṃdhyāvali hi aham dhanyaḥ tvam ca api varavarṇinī
translated: O Sandhyavali, I am blessed, and you are also the best of women.

analyzed: ubhayoḥ janitaḥ putraḥ śaśāṅka dhavalaḥ kṣitau
translated: A son born to both of us, white like the moon, on earth.

original: karṇābhyāṃ śrūyate mokṣo na dṛṣṭaḥ kenacitkvacit /
analyzed: karṇābhyām śrūyate mokṣaḥ na dṛṣṭaḥ kenacid kvacid
translated: Moksha is heard by the ears, but not seen by anyone anywhere.

analyzed: saḥ smābhiḥ adhikam prāptaḥ mokṣaḥ sat putra saṃbhavaḥ
translated: That Moksha, born from a good son, has been attained by us in excess.

analyzed: putre vinaya saṃpanne vṛtta aśaurya samanvite
translated: When the son is endowed with humility, good conduct, and valor,

analyzed: pratāpini varārohe pituḥ mokṣaḥ gṛhe dhruvam
translated: O beautiful lady, the father's liberation is certain in the house, O beautiful lady.

original: ānandaṃ brahmaṇo rūpaṃ śatānandaḥ sutena yaḥ /
analyzed: ānandam brahmaṇaḥ rūpam śatānandaḥ sutena yaḥ
translated: The one who has a hundred delights through his son, who is the form of Brahman's bliss,

analyzed: pitā bhavati cārvaṅgi sat karma karaṇaiḥ śubhaiḥ
translated: becomes the father, O beautiful lady, through auspicious and virtuous deeds.

analyzed: na etat sāmyam bhavet devi loke sthāvara jaṅgame
translated: O Goddess, this is not equal in the world of the moving and unmoving,

original: satputraḥ piturādāya bhāramudvahate tu yaḥ // / / //🔽so 'haṃ gamiṣyāmi vanāya hṛṣṭo vihāraśīlo mṛgahiṃsanāya /
analyzed: sat putraḥ pituḥ ādāya bhāram udvahate tu yaḥ  saḥ ham gamiṣyāmi vanāya hṛṣṭaḥ vihāra śīlaḥ mṛga hiṃsanāya
translated: when a good son takes up the burden and bears it for the father.🔽I shall go to the forest with joy, with a disposition for sport, to kill deer.

analyzed: svecchā caraḥ ca atha viśāla netre vimukta pāpaḥ jana rakṣaṇāya
translated: And, O large-eyed one, I shall roam as I please, free from sin, for the protection of the people.

analyzed: iti śrī bṛhat nāradīya purāṇa uttare bhāge rukmāṅgadadharmāṅgadasaṃvādaḥ nāma navamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the ninth chapter in the Uttara-khanda of the Brhat-Purana narrated by the great sage Narada, on the dialogue between Rukma-Angada and Dharma-Angada.

analyzed: vasiṣṭhaḥ uvāca
translated: Vasishtha said:

original: tataḥ prāha viśālākṣī bharturvākyaṃ niśamya sā /
analyzed: tatas prāha viśāla akṣī bhartuḥ vākyam niśamya sā
translated: Then the large-eyed lady, having heard the words of her husband, said:

analyzed: satyam uktam tvayā rājan putra saukhyāt param sukham
translated: O king, you have spoken the truth. There is no happiness greater than the happiness of a son.

original: na bhavediha rājendra munīnāṃ bhāṣitaṃ yathā /
analyzed: na bhavet iha rāja indra munīnām bhāṣitam yathā
translated: O lord of kings, it cannot be, as stated by the sages.

original: tulyaṃ bhavati loke 'smin viṣṇvākhyasya parasya hi // / / //
analyzed: tulyam bhavati loke smin viṣṇu ākhyasya parasya hi
translated: becomes equal to the Supreme Lord called Vishnu in this world.

analyzed: putre bhāraḥ tvayā nyastaḥ sapta dvīpa samudbhavaḥ
translated: You have placed the burden of the seven islands on your son.

analyzed: mārgī hiṃsām parityajya yajñaiḥ iṣṭvā janārdanam
translated: Abandoning violence on the path, having worshipped Janardana through sacrifices,

analyzed: bhoga spṛhām parityajya sevasya sura nimnagām
translated: Abandoning desire for enjoyment, serve the celestial river.

original: etannyāyyaṃ bhavati bho na nyāyyo mṛganigrahaḥ // / / //
analyzed: etat nyāyyam bhavati bho na nyāyyaḥ mṛga nigrahaḥ
translated: This is proper, O lord, not proper to kill deer.

original: hṛdaye nakhapāto hi vṛddhāyā bhūpate yathā /
analyzed: hṛdaye nakha pātaḥ hi vṛddhāyāḥ bhūpate yathā
translated: Just as a scratch on the heart of an old woman,

original: tathā viṣayasevā hi pitṝṇāṃ putriṇāṃ viduḥ // / / //
analyzed: tathā viṣaya sevāḥ hi pitṝṇām putriṇām viduḥ
translated: So the wise know the service of objects to be for fathers with sons.

analyzed: gṛhe vā api hṛṣīkeśam pūjayasva mahīpate
translated: O lord of the earth, worship Hrishikesha in your own house.

original: nirdeṣamṛgayūthānāṃ na yuktaṃ sūdanaṃ tava // / / //🔽ahiṃsā paramo dharmaḥ purāṇe parikīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: nirdeṣa mṛga yūthānām na yuktam sūdanam tava  ahiṃsā paramaḥ dharmaḥ purāṇe parikīrtitaḥ
translated: It is not proper for you to destroy the faultless herds of deer.🔽Non-violence is declared to be the highest dharma in the Puranas.

analyzed: hiṃsayā vartamānasya vyarthaḥ dharmmaḥ bhavet iti
translated: For one who engages in violence, dharma would be useless.

analyzed: kurvan api vṛthā dharmān yaḥ hiṃsām anuvartate
translated: Even while performing useless dharma, one who engages in violence,

analyzed: paraiḥ upahatām bhūpa na upabhuñjanti sādhavaḥ
translated: The virtuous do not enjoy what is harmed by others, O king.

analyzed: ṣaḍvidham nṛpa te proktam vidvadbhiḥ jīva ghātanam
translated: O king, the learned ones have declared the killing of living beings to be of six kinds.

analyzed: anumodayitā pūrvam dvitīyaḥ ghātakaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The first is the one who approves, the second is remembered as the killer,

analyzed: viśvāsakaḥ tṛtīyaḥ caturthaḥ bhakṣakaḥ tathā
translated: The third is the one who inspires confidence, and the fourth is the one who eats,

original: pañcamaḥ pācakaḥ proktaḥ ṣaṣṭho bhūpātra vigrahī /
analyzed: pañcamaḥ pācakaḥ proktaḥ ṣaṣṭhaḥ bhūpātra vigrahī
translated: The fifth is said to be the one who cooks, and the sixth is the one who holds the vessel.

original: hiṃ sayā saṃyutaṃ dharmamadharmaṃ ca vidurbudhāḥ // / / //
analyzed: hiṃ sayā saṃyutam dharmam adharmam ca viduḥ budhāḥ
translated: The wise know that dharma is associated with non-violence, and adharma is associated with violence.

original: na pāpaṃ kurute bhūpa putre bhāraṃ niveśya vai /
analyzed: na pāpam kurute bhūpa putre bhāram niveśya vai
translated: O King, one does not commit sin by placing the burden on the son.

analyzed: dharmam samāśrayaman samyak saṃjāta palitaḥ pitā
translated: The father, having become fully grey-haired, resorts to dharma properly.

analyzed: parityajye imam bhāvam mṛga hiṃsā samudbhavam

translated: The king reached the city of Vaidiśa and brought it under his control.🔽Hearing that the king was coming, his son Dharmāṅgada,

analyzed: pitaram harṣa saṃyuktaḥ bhūpālān vākyam abravīt
translated: with joy, spoke these words to the kings:

analyzed: eṣā udīcī diś nṛpa uttamāḥ
translated: O best of kings, this northern direction is coming under the control of the king.

analyzed: mad pituḥ vājinā ākrāntā tat tejaḥ parirañjitā
translated: It is being colored by the splendor of my father's horses.

analyzed: tasmāt gacchāmahe sarve saṃmukham hi avanīpateḥ
translated: Therefore, we all should go face to face with the lord of the earth.

analyzed: pituḥ āgata mātrasya saṃmukham na sutaḥ vrajet
translated: A son should not go face to face with his father as soon as he arrives.

analyzed: sa yāti narakam ghoram yāvat indrāḥ caturddaśā
translated: He goes to a terrible hell for as long as the fourteen Indras rule.

original: saṃmukhaṃ vrajamānasya putrasya pitaraṃ prati /🔽pade pade yajñaphalaṃ procuḥ paurāṇikā dvijāḥ // / / //
analyzed: saṃmukham vrajamānasya putrasya pitaram prati  pade pade yajña phalam procuḥ paurāṇikāḥ dvijāḥ
translated: For a son who goes face to face towards his father,🔽the ancient twice-born ones have said that he gets the fruits of a sacrifice at every step.

analyzed: uttiṣṭhadhvam vrajāmi eṣa bhavadbhiḥ parivāritaḥ
translated: Rise up! I am going surrounded by you all.

analyzed: abhivādayitum premṇā eṣa me deva devatā
translated: To greet with love this god of gods, this lord of the earth, my father.

analyzed: tathā utyuktaiḥ tutaiḥ sarvaiḥ bhūmipālaiḥ nṛpa ātmajaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by the prince, all the kings of the earth,

analyzed: jagāma saṃmukham padbhyām krośa mātram pituḥ tadā
translated: went on foot for a distance of a krosa towards their king.

analyzed: tatas rāja sahasreṇa mūrtimān iva manmathaḥ
translated: Then, with a thousand kings, like embodied Manmatha,

analyzed: sa gatvā dūram adhvānam āsasāda nṛpam pathi
translated: Then, like the embodied god of love, he went far on the path, accompanied by a thousand kings.

original: saṃprāpya pitaraṃ strehājjagāma dharaṇīṃ tadā /🔽śirasā rājabhiḥ sārddhaṃ praṇāmamakarottadā // / / //
analyzed: saṃprāpya pitaram strehāt jagāma dharaṇīm tadā  śirasā rājabhiḥ sārddham praṇāmam akarot tadā
translated: Having reached his father, he fell down on the ground out of affection.🔽Along with the kings, he bowed his head in salutation.

original: premṇā samāgataṃ prakṣya taṃ patantaṃ nṛpaiḥ saha /🔽avaruhya hayādrājā samutthāpya sutaṃ vibho // / / //
analyzed: premṇā samāgatam prakṣya tam patantam nṛpaiḥ saha  avaruhya hayāt rājā samutthāpya sutam vibho
translated: Out of love, the king, along with the kings, raised him up as he fell down.

analyzed: bhujābhyām sādhu pīnābhyām paryaṣvañjata bhūpatiḥ
translated: The king, having descended from his horse, raised up his son with his own two strong arms and embraced him.

analyzed: mūrdhni ca evam upāghrāya uvāca tanayam tadā
translated: Having kissed his son on the head, he said to him:

analyzed: kaccit pāsi prajāḥ sarvāḥ kaccit daṇḍayase ripūn
translated: Do you protect all your subjects? Do you punish your enemies?

original: nyāyāgatena vittena kośaṃ putra bibharṣi ca // / / //🔽kaccidvipreṣvatyadhikā vṛttirdattā napāyinī /
analyzed: nyāya āgatena vittena kośam putra bibharṣi ca  kaccit vipreṣu atyadhikā vṛttiḥ dattā napāyinī
translated: O son, do you maintain your treasury with wealth obtained through just means?🔽Do you give abundant and unfailing sustenance to the Brahmins?

analyzed: kaccit te kānta śīla tvam kaccit vaktāḥ na niṣṭhuram
translated: Do you have a pleasing character? Do you not speak harshly?

analyzed: kaccit gāvaḥ na duhyante putra cāṇḍalaveśmānam
translated: O son, are the cows not milked in the houses of the Candalas?

analyzed: kaccit vacana kartāraḥ tanayāḥ ca pituḥ sadā
translated: Are your sons always obedient to their father?

analyzed: kaccit vadhūḥ śvaśrū vākye vartate bhartari kvacid
translated: Do the daughters-in-law follow the words of their mothers-in-law and their husbands?

analyzed: kaccit vivādān vipreḥ tu samam na īkṣase ātmaja
translated: O son, do you see that the Brahmanas are not quarrelling with one another?

analyzed: kaccit gāvaḥ na rudhyante viṣaye vividhaiḥ tṛṇaiḥ
translated: Are the cows not obstructed in your kingdom by various kinds of grass?

analyzed: tulā mānāni sarvāṇi hi annādīnām sadā īkṣase
translated: Do you see that all the weights and measures of grains and other things are correct?

analyzed: kuṭuṃbinam karaiḥ putra na atyartham abhidūyase
translated: O son, do you not oppress the householders too much with taxes?

original: kaccinna dyūtapānādi vartate viṣaye tava // / / //🔽kaccidbhinnarasairlokā bhinnavākyaiḥ pure tava /
analyzed: kaccit na dyūta pāna ādi vartate viṣaye tava  kaccit bhinna rasaiḥ lokāḥ bhinna vākyaiḥ pure tava
translated: Do gambling, drinking and other vices prevail in your kingdom?

analyzed: na dānaiḥ jīrṇa vastraiḥ ca na upajīvanti mānavāḥ
translated: O son, do the people in your city live by gifts of torn clothes and by speaking incoherent words?

analyzed: kaccit ṛṣṭvā svayam putra hasti aśvam parirakṣasi
translated: Do you yourself, O son, look after the elephants and horses?

analyzed: kaccit ca mātaraḥ sarvāḥ hi aviśeṣeṇa paśyasi
translated: Do you look after all the mothers without any distinction?

analyzed: kaccit na vāsare viṣṇoḥ narāḥ bhuñjanti putraka
translated: O son, do the men not eat on the day of Vishnu?

analyzed: śaśini kṣīṇa tām prāpte kaccit śrāddha paraḥ naraḥ
translated: When the moon has waned, does a man perform the Shraddha ceremony?

analyzed: kaccit ca apararātreṣu sadā nidrām vimuñcasi
translated: Do you always give up sleep in the latter part of the night?

analyzed: nidrā mūlam adharmasya nidrā pāpa vivarddhinī
translated: Sleep is the root of sin; sleep increases sin.

analyzed: nidrā dāridya jananī nidrā śreyaḥ vināśinī
translated: Sleep is the mother of poverty and the destroyer of prosperity.

original: nahi nidrānvito rājā ciraṃ śāsti vasuṃdharām // / / //
analyzed: nahi nidrā anvitaḥ rājā ciram śāsti vasuṃdharām
translated: A king who is overcome by sleep does not rule the earth for a long time.

analyzed: puṃścalī iva sadā bhartuḥ loka dvaya vināśinī
translated: Like a wanton woman, it destroys both this world and the next.

analyzed: evam uccaramāṇam tam tanayaḥ vākyam abravīt
translated: To him who was speaking thus, his son spoke these words.

original: dharmāṅgado mahīpālaṃ praṇamya ca punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: dharmāṅgadaḥ mahīpālam praṇamya ca punar punar
translated: Dharmagupta, having bowed again and again to the king, said:

original: sarvametatkṛtaṃ tāta punaḥ kartāsmi te vacaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sarvam etat kṛtam tāta punar kartāsmi te vacaḥ
translated: All this has been done, O father. I shall again do your bidding.

analyzed: pituḥ vacana kartāraḥ putrāḥ dhanyāḥ jagattraye
translated: Sons who carry out their father's words are blessed in the three worlds.

original: kiṃ tataḥ pātakaṃ rājanyo na kuryātpiturvacaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kim tatas pātakam rājanyaḥ na kuryāt pituḥ vacaḥ
translated: What sin is there, O king, that one should not do his father's bidding?

analyzed: pitṛ vākyam an ādṛtya vrajet snātum tri mārga gām
translated: One who disregards his father's words and goes to bathe in the three-streamed river,

original: na tattīrthaphalaṃ bhuṅkte yo na kuryātpiturvacaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na tat tīrtha phalam bhuṅkte yaḥ na kuryāt pituḥ vacaḥ
translated: does not enjoy the fruits of that pilgrimage, who does not do his father's bidding.

original: tvadadhīnaṃ śarīraṃ me tvadadhīnaṃ hi jīvitam /
analyzed: tvad adhīnam śarīram me tvad adhīnam hi jīvitam
translated: My body is dependent on you, my life is dependent on you.

original: tvadadhīno hi me dharmastvaṃ ca me daivataṃ param // / / //
analyzed: tvad adhīnaḥ hi me dharmaḥ tvam ca me daivatam param
translated: My dharma is dependent on you, you are my supreme deity.

analyzed: trailokyasya api dānena na śuddhyā itas ṛṇāt sutaḥ
translated: A son is not freed from his debt even by giving the three worlds,

analyzed: kim punar deha vittābhyām keśa dāna ādibhiḥ vibho
translated: what to speak of body and wealth, O lord, by giving hair and other things?

analyzed: evam bruvāṇam tanayam bahu bhūpāla saṃvṛtam
translated: Having said this, the son, surrounded by many kings,

analyzed: rukmāṅgadaḥ pariṣvajya punar āha sutam vacaḥ
translated: Rukmangada embraced his son and again spoke these words:

analyzed: satyam etat tvayā putra vyāhṛtam dharma vedinā
translated: Son, what you have said is true, spoken by one who knows dharma.

analyzed: pituḥ abhyadhikam kiñcid daivatam na sutasya hi
translated: There is no deity greater than the father for a son.

analyzed: devāḥ parāṅmukhāḥ tasya pitaram yaḥ vamanyate
translated: The gods turn away from him who disrespects his father.

analyzed: saḥ ham mūrdhnā tvayā putra dhṛtaḥ tad kṣiti rakṣaṇāt
translated: O son, I was held on your head by you for the protection of the earth.

analyzed: jitvā dvīpavatīm pṛthvīm bahu bhūpāla saṃvṛtām
translated: Having conquered the earth with its islands, surrounded by many kings,

analyzed: etat saukhyam param loke etat svarga padam dhruvam
translated: This is the highest happiness in the world, this is certainly the abode of heaven,

analyzed: pituḥ abhyadhikaḥ putraḥ yat bhavet kṣiti maṇḍale
translated: When a son becomes greater than the father on the face of the earth.

analyzed: saḥ ham putra kṛtārthaḥ tu kṛtaḥ sat guṇa vartmanā
translated: O son, I have been made successful by you, following the path of good qualities,

analyzed: tvayā sādhayatā bhūpān yathā hari dinam śubham
translated: Having accomplished the kings, as if it were an auspicious day of Hari.

original: tatpiturvacanaṃ śrutvā putro dharmāṅgado 'bravīt /🔽kka gatastu bhavāṃstāta niveśya mayi saṃpadaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tat pituḥ vacanam śrutvā putraḥ dharmāṅgadaḥ bravīt  kka gataḥ tu bhavān tāta niveśya mayi saṃpadaḥ
translated: Having heard those words of his father, the son Dharmagupta said:🔽Where did you go, father, having entrusted your wealth to me?

analyzed: kasmin sthāne tu iyam prāptā sūrya ayuta sama prabhā
translated: In which place was this obtained, having the radiance of ten thousand suns?

analyzed: manye nirvedam āpannaḥ imām sṛṣṭvā prajāpatiḥ
translated: I think that Prajapati, having created her, became filled with despair.

analyzed: na etad rūpā mahīpāla nārī trailokya madhyataḥ  manye bhūdhara jātā iyam athavā sāgara udbhavā
translated: O lord of the earth, I do not see a woman like this in the three worlds.🔽I think she is born from a mountain or from the ocean.

analyzed: māyā vā maya daityasya pramadā rūpa saṃsthitā
translated: Or she may be the illusion of the demon Maya, assuming the form of a woman.

original: aho sunupuṇo dhātā yeneyaṃ nirmitā vibho /
analyzed: aho su nupuṇaḥ dhātā yena iyam nirmitā vibho
translated: O lord, the creator is indeed very skillful, by whom she has been created.

analyzed: bāla agra śata bhāgaḥ hi vyalīkaḥ na upapadyate
translated: Even a hundredth part of her beauty cannot be found in a young girl.

original: iyaṃ hi yogyā kanakāvadātā gṛhāya tubhyaṃ jagatīpatīśa /
analyzed: iyam hi yogyā kanaka avadātā gṛhāya tubhyam jagatīpati īśa
translated: O lord of the lords of the world, this golden-hued one is suitable for your home.

original: evaṃ vidhā me jananī yadi syātko 'nyo 'sti mattaḥ sukṛtī manuṣyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: evaṃ vidhā me jananī yadi syāt kaḥ sti mattaḥ su kṛtī manuṣyaḥ
translated: If my mother were like this, what other man is more fortunate than me?

original: iti śrībṛhannāradīyapurāṇottarabhāge mohinīcarite pitāputrasaṃvādo nāma pañcadaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī bṛhat nāradīya purāṇa uttara bhāge mohinīcarite pitāputrasaṃvādaḥ nāma pañcadaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fifteenth chapter in the Uttaratapa of the Srimad-Bṛhat-Nārāyaṇa-Purāṇa, composed by Śrī Parāśara, the son of Śakti, in which is described the conversation between the father and son.

analyzed: vasiṣṭhaḥ uvāca
translated: Vasishtha said:

original: dharmāṅgavadacaḥ śrutvā hṛṣṭo rukmāṅgado 'bravīt /🔽satya te jananī putra saṃprāptā mandare mayā // / / //
analyzed: dharmāṅga vat acaḥ śrutvā hṛṣṭaḥ rukmāṅgadaḥ bravīt  satya te jananī putra saṃprāptā mandare mayā
translated: Having heard the words of Dharma's son, Rukmangada was delighted and said:🔽O son, your mother has been found by me on Mandara.

analyzed: veda āśraya sutā bālā mad artham kṛta niścayā
translated: The young daughter of Vedāśravas, determined for my sake,

original: kurvantī dāruṇaṃ putra tapo devagirau purā // / / //
analyzed: kurvantī dāruṇam putra tapaḥ devagirau purā
translated: O son, she was formerly performing severe austerities on the Devagiri mountain.

analyzed: itas pañcadaśāt ahnaḥ haya gāmī gataḥ hi aham
translated: From here, fifteen days ago, I went on a horse.

original: mandare parvataśreṣṭhe bahudhātusamanvite // / / //🔽tasya mūrddhani bāleyaṃ toṣayantī maheśvaram /
analyzed: mandare parvata śreṣṭhe bahu dhātu samanvite  tasya mūrddhani bālā iyam toṣayantī maheśvaram
translated: On the Mandara mountain, the best of mountains, endowed with many minerals,🔽On its peak, this young woman was seen by me, delighting Mahesvara.

original: sthitā gānaparā dṛṣṭā mayā tatra sudarśanā // / / //
analyzed: sthitā gāna parā dṛṣṭā mayā tatra sudarśanā
translated: Standing there, engrossed in singing, of beautiful appearance.

analyzed: tatas ham mūrcchayā yuktaḥ patitaḥ dharaṇī tale
translated: Then I, struck by a swoon, fell down on the ground,

analyzed: anaṅga bāṇa saṃviddhaḥ vyādha viddhaḥ yathā mṛgaḥ
translated: Pierced by the arrows of Kama, like a deer struck by a hunter.

analyzed: tatas hamanayā devyā cālitaḥ cāru netrayā
translated: Then I was moved by this goddess with beautiful eyes,

analyzed: vṛtaḥ ca evā api bhartṛ tve kiñcid prārthanayā saha
translated: And also accepted as her husband, with a slight request.

analyzed: mayā ca api pratijñātam sva dakṣiṇa kara anvitam
translated: And by me, it was promised with my right hand,

analyzed: sā iyam bhāryā viśāla akṣī kṛtā bhūdhara mastake
translated: This wide-eyed one was made my wife on the peak of the mountain.

analyzed: avaruhya dharā pṛṣṭe samāruhya turaṅgamam
translated: Descending to the surface of the earth and mounting the horse,

analyzed: dina trayeṇa tvaritaḥ saṃprāptaḥ tava sannidhau
translated: In three days, I quickly arrived in your presence.

analyzed: paśyamānaḥ girīn deśān sarāṃsi saritaḥ tathā
translated: Seeing the mountains, regions, lakes, and rivers,

original: iyaṃ hi jananī putra tava prītivivarddhinī // / / //
analyzed: iyam hi jananī putra tava prīti vivarddhinī
translated: This is your mother, O son, who increases your joy.

analyzed: abhivādaya cāru aṅgīm tvam nijām iva mātaram
translated: Salute this beautiful-bodied one as if she were your own mother.

analyzed: tat pituḥ vacanam śrutvā haya saṃsthām arindamaḥ
translated: Hearing the words of his father, the enemy-taming one,

analyzed: śirasā dharaṇīm gatvā idam vacanam abravīt
translated: bowing his head to the ground while seated on the horse, spoke these words:

original: prasīda devi mātastvaṃ bhṛtyo dāsaḥ sutastava // / / //
analyzed: prasīda devi mātar tvam bhṛtyaḥ dāsaḥ sutaḥ tava
translated: Be gracious, O goddess, mother, I am your servant, slave, son.

analyzed: namaskaromi jananīm bahu bhūpāla saṃyutaḥ
translated: I pay homage to the mother, accompanied by many kings.

original: taṃ putramavanīṃ prāptaṃ mohinī prekṣya bhūpate // / / //🔽bharturdākṣiṇyayogācca avatīrya turaṅgamāt /
analyzed: tam putram avanīm prāptam mohinī prekṣya bhūpate  bhartuḥ dākṣiṇya yogāt ca avatīrya turaṅgamāt
translated: Seeing that son who had come to the earth, O king, Mohini,🔽due to the generosity of her husband, descended from the horse.

analyzed: avāgūhata bāhubhyām utthāpya patitam sutam
translated: She embraced her fallen son with her arms and raised him up.

analyzed: pariṣvaktaḥ tadā mātrā punar eva abhyanandayat
translated: Then he was embraced by his mother and again rejoiced.

analyzed: tatas tām su manojñaiḥ tu cāru vastraiḥ ca bhūṣaṇaiḥ
translated: Then, adorning her with very pleasant and beautiful garments and ornaments,

analyzed: bhūṣayitvā samāropya punar eva haya uttamam  sva pṛṣṭhe caraṇam kṛtvā tasyāḥ rājīva locanaḥ
translated: having placed her again on that excellent horse,🔽and placing his foot on her back, that lotus-eyed one,

analyzed: tena eva vidhinā bhūpa pitaram ca anvarohayat
translated: in the same manner, O king, made his father descend.

analyzed: bhūpālaiḥ saṃvṛtaḥ gacchan pabhdyām dharmāṅgadaḥ sutaḥ
translated: Surrounded by kings, the son Dharmagupta was going on foot.

analyzed: praharṣa pulakaḥ hi āsīt jananīm prekṣya mohinīm
translated: Seeing his mother Mohini, he was filled with joy and horripilation.

analyzed: stūyamānaḥ svayam ca api megha gaṃbhīrayā girā
translated: He was himself being praised with a voice deep like that of clouds.

original: dhanyaḥ sa tanayo loke mātaro yasya bhūriśaḥ /
analyzed: dhanyaḥ sa tanayaḥ loke mātaraḥ yasya bhūriśas
translated: Blessed is that son in the world whose mothers are many.

analyzed: navāḥ navatarāḥ bhāryāḥ pituḥ iṣṭāḥ manoharāḥ
translated: His father's new and newer wives are pleasing to the mind.

original: yasyaikā jananī loke pitā tasyaiva duḥkhabhāk /
analyzed: yasya ekā jananī loke pitā tasya eva duḥkha bhāj
translated: He who has only one mother in the world, his father shares his sorrow.

original: piturduḥkhena kiṃ saukhyaṃ putrasya hṛdi vartate // / / //
analyzed: pituḥ duḥkhena kim saukhyam putrasya hṛdi vartate
translated: What happiness can be in the son's heart due to the father's sorrow?

analyzed: ekasyāḥ vandane mātuḥ pṛthivī phalam aśnute
translated: By worshipping one mother, one obtains the fruits of worshipping the entire earth.

analyzed: mātṝṇām vandane mahyam gahat puṇyam bhaviṣyati
translated: By worshipping all the mothers, great merit will accrue to me.

analyzed: tasmāt abhyadhikam puṇyam bhaviṣyati dine dine
translated: Therefore, merit will increase day by day.

analyzed: ekam uccaramāṇaḥ sau rājabhiḥ parivāritaḥ
translated: Reciting this alone, surrounded by kings,

analyzed: praviṣṭaḥ nagaram ramyam vaidiśam ṛddhi saṃyutam
translated: he entered the beautiful city of Vaidiśa, endowed with prosperity.

original: hayasthaḥ prayayau rājā mohinyā saha tatkṣaṇāt // / / //
analyzed: haya sthaḥ prayayau rājā mohinyā saha tad kṣaṇāt
translated: The king immediately went out on horseback with Mohinī.

analyzed: tatas gṛha varam prāpya pūjyamānaḥ janaiḥ nṛpaḥ
translated: Then, having reached the best house, the king, being worshipped by the people,

analyzed: avaruhya vākyam abravīt
translated: Alighting from the horse, he spoke these words to Mohini:

analyzed: dharmāṅgadasya putrasya gṛhe gaccha manohare
translated: O Manohara, go to the house of Dharmagupta's son.

original: eṣa te guruśuśrūṣāṃ kariṣyati yathā guṇam // / / //
analyzed: eṣa te guru śuśrūṣām kariṣyati yathā guṇam
translated: He will serve you as a preceptor, according to his qualities.

original: na sakhī naiva dāsī te śuśrūṣāmācarediti /
analyzed: na sakhī nā eva dāsī te śuśrūṣām ācaret iti
translated: She is neither your friend nor your servant, nor should she serve you.

original: sā caivamuktā patyā tu prasthitā sutamandiram // / / //
analyzed: sā ca evam uktā patyā tu prasthitā suta mandiram
translated: Thus addressed by her husband, she set out for her son's house.

original: dharmāṅgadena sā dṛṣṭā gacchantī mandirāya vai /🔽ātmano bhartṛvākyena parityajya mahīpatīn // / / //
analyzed: dharmāṅgadena sā dṛṣṭā gacchantī mandirāya vai  ātmanaḥ bhartṛ vākyena parityajya mahīpatīn

analyzed: mūrghni kīlam kaniṣṭha ākhyam yaḥ hi rājan nikhānayet
translated: O king, he who would plant a peg named the younger brother on their heads,

original: na sadgatirbhavettasya na ta sā vindate param /
analyzed: na sat gatiḥ bhavet tasya na sā vindate param
translated: He will not attain a good state, nor will he find the highest.

analyzed: pativratā aśru dagdhāyāḥ kā śāntiḥ me bhaviṣyati
translated: What peace can there be for me, burnt by the tears of a chaste woman?

original: janitāraṃ hi me bhasma kuryyurdevyaḥ pativratāḥ /
analyzed: janitāram hi me bhasma kuryyuḥ devyaḥ pativratāḥ
translated: The chaste goddesses would reduce my father to ashes.

original: kiṃ punaḥ prākṛtaṃ bhūpa tvādṛśīṃ tathā // / / //
analyzed: kim punar prākṛtam bhūpa tvādṛśīm tathā
translated: What to speak of an ordinary king like you?

analyzed: saṃdhyā āvalī samā nārī trailokye nā asti bhūmipa
translated: O king, there is no woman equal to Sandhyavali in the three worlds.

analyzed: tava sneha nibaddha aṅgī saṃbhojayati ṣaṣ rasaiḥ
translated: She, whose body is bound by affection for you, feeds you with the six tastes.

analyzed: priyāṇi cāṭu vākyāni vadatī tava gauvavāt
translated: She speaks pleasing flattering words out of love for you.

original: evaṃvidhā hi śataśo nāryaḥ saṃti gṛhe tava // / / //
analyzed: evaṃvidhāḥ hi śataśas nāryaḥ saṃti gṛhe tava
translated: There are hundreds of such women in your house.

original: yāsāṃ na pādarajasā tulyāhaṃ bhūpate kvacit /
analyzed: yāsām na pāda rajasā tulyā aham bhūpate kvacid
translated: I am not equal to them in even the dust of their feet, O king.

analyzed: mohinī vacanam śrutvā vrīḍitaḥ hi abhavat nṛpaḥ
translated: Hearing Mohini's words, the king became ashamed.

analyzed: sa putrāyāḥ samīpe tu jyeṣṭhāyāḥ nṛpatiḥ tadā
translated: Then the king, near the eldest one along with her son,

analyzed: iṅgita jñaḥ sutaḥ jñātvā daśa avasthā gatām nṛpam
translated: The son, knowing the gestures, knowing the king to be in ten states,

analyzed: pitaram kāma saṃtaptam mohinī arthe vimohitam
translated: The father, tormented by passion, deluded for Mohini's sake,

analyzed: mātṛḥ sarvāḥ samāhūya saṃdhyā āvali purogamāḥ
translated: Having called all the mothers, headed by Sandhyavali,

analyzed: kṛta añjali puṭaḥ bhūtvā evam āha priya vacaḥ
translated: With folded hands, he spoke these pleasing words:

original: vimohinī me jananī navoḍhā brāhmaṇaḥ sutā // / / //
analyzed: vimohinī me jananī na voḍhā brāhmaṇaḥ sutā
translated: My mother is a newly married young woman, and I am a Brahmana's son.

original: sā ca prārthayate devyo rājānaṃ rahasisthitam /
analyzed: sā ca prārthayate devyaḥ rājānam rahasi sthitam
translated: And she, O goddesses, solicits the king, who is in private,

analyzed: ātmanā saha khelā artham tat modadhvam su harṣitāḥ
translated: For the purpose of sporting with herself. Rejoice in that, being greatly delighted.

analyzed: mātaraḥ ūcuḥ  kaḥ nu modayate putra sarpa bhakṣaṇam ātmanaḥ
translated: The mothers said:🔽O son, who approves of his own being eaten by a snake?

original: ko hi dīpayate vahniṃ svadehe dehināṃ vara // / / //
analyzed: kaḥ hi dīpayate vahnim sva dehe dehinām vara
translated: Who, O best of embodied beings, kindles a fire on his own body?

original: ko bhakṣayedviṣaṃ ghoraṃ kaśchindyādātmanaḥ śiraḥ /🔽kastaretsāgaraṃ baddhvā grīvāyāṃ dāruṇāṃ śilām // / / //🔽ko gaccheddvīpivadanaṃ kaḥ keśānsuharerharet /🔽ko niṣīdati dhārāyāṃ khaṅgasyā kāśabhāsinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kaḥ bhakṣayet viṣam ghoram kaḥ chindyāt ātmanaḥ śiraḥ  kaḥ taret sāgaram baddhvā grīvāyām dāruṇām śilām  kaḥ gacchet dvīpi vadanam kaḥ keśān suhareḥ haret  kaḥ niṣīdati dhārāyām khaṅgasya ā kāśa bhāsinaḥ
translated: Who would eat terrible poison, who would cut off his own head?🔽Who would cross the ocean, binding a terrible stone to his neck?🔽Who would go into the mouth of a crocodile, who would pull out the hair of a dear friend?🔽Who would sit on the stream of a sword shining like a flash of lightning?

analyzed: kā anumodayate bhartrā sapatnyāḥ krīḍanam kila
translated: Who, indeed, approves of her husband's sport with a co-wife?

analyzed: sarvasya api pradānena na etat manasi vartate
translated: This does not occur to him even by the gift of everything.

analyzed: varam hi chedanam mūrdhnaḥ tad kṣaṇāt tu vara asinā
translated: Better to cut off one's head with an excellent sword at that moment.

analyzed: kā dṛṣṭyā dayitam kāntam nirīkṣet anyayā āhṛtam
translated: Who, with another's eyes, would look at a beloved lover carried away?

original: kā sā sīmantinī loke bhavedetādṛśī kvacit /
analyzed: kā sā sīmantinī loke bhavet etādṛśī kvacid
translated: What woman in the world could be like this anywhere?

analyzed: ātma prāṇa samam kāntam anya strī kuca pīḍanam
translated: The beloved, equal to one's own life, being oppressed by the breasts of another woman,

original: saṃśrutya sahate yā tu kiṃ punaḥ svena cakṣuṣā /
analyzed: saṃśrutya sahate yā tu kim punar svena cakṣuṣā
translated: Having heard about it, she endures it, what to speak of seeing it with her own eyes.

analyzed: sarveṣām eva duḥkhānām duḥkham etat anantakam
translated: Of all sorrows, this sorrow is endless,

analyzed: yat bhartā anya aṅganā saṃktaḥ dṛśi aṭate svena cakṣuṣā
translated: That the husband, attached to another woman, is seen with one's own eyes.

analyzed: varam sarvāḥ mṛtāḥ putra yugapad mātaraḥ tava
translated: Better that all your mothers should die simultaneously, O son,

original: na tu mohinisaṃyukto dṛśyo 'yaṃ nṛpatiḥ patiḥ /
analyzed: na tu mohini saṃyuktaḥ dṛśyaḥ yam nṛpatiḥ patiḥ
translated: Than that this king, the husband, should be seen united with Mohini.

analyzed: dharmāṅgadaḥ uvāca
translated: Dharmagupta said:

original: yadi me na pituḥ saukhyaṃ kariṣyatha śubhānanāḥ // / / //
analyzed: yadi me na pituḥ saukhyam kariṣyatha śubha ānanāḥ
translated: If you will not bring happiness to my father, O fair-faced ones,

analyzed: viṣam āloḍya pāsyāmi yuṣmad saukhyam mṛte mayi
translated: Having mixed poison, I will drink it, and you will be happy when I am dead.

analyzed: karmaṇā manasā vācā yā pituḥ duḥkham ācaret
translated: She who would cause sorrow to my father by deed, thought, or word,

original: sā me śatrurvadhārhāsti yadi saṃdhyāvalī bhavet /
analyzed: sā me śatruḥ vadha arhā asti yadi saṃdhyā āvalī bhavet
translated: Is my enemy, worthy of being killed, even if she were Sandhyavali.

analyzed: sarvāsām sādhikā devī mohinī janakapriyā
translated: That goddess Mohini, dear to the father, is superior to all of you,

analyzed: krīḍā artham āgatāḥ bālāḥ mandara acala mandirāt
translated: The young girl has come here to play from the palace of Mount Mandara.

analyzed: tat putra vacanam śrutvā vepamānāḥ hi mātaraḥ
translated: Having heard the words of his son, the trembling mothers,

original: ūcuḥ sagadgadāṃ vācaṃ hitārthaṃ tanayasya hi /
analyzed: ūcuḥ sa gadgadām vācam hita artham tanayasya hi
translated: Spoke with a faltering voice for the welfare of their son.

original: avaśyaṃ tava vākyaṃ hi kartavyaṃ nyāyasaṃyutam // / / //
analyzed: avaśyam tava vākyam hi kartavyam nyāya saṃyutam
translated: Your words are certainly to be carried out, as they are based on justice.

original: kiṃ tu dānaprado bhūtvā mohinīṃ yātu te pitā /🔽yo bhāryāmudvahedbhartā dvitīyāmaparāmapi // / / //🔽jyeṣṭhāyai dviguṇaṃ tasyā dadyaccaivānyathā ṛṇī /
analyzed: kim tu dāna pradaḥ bhūtvā mohinīm yātu te pitā  yaḥ bhāryām udvahet bhartā dvitīyām aparām api  jyeṣṭhāyai dviguṇam tasyāḥ dadyat ca eva anyathā ṛṇī
translated: But let your father go to Mohini after becoming a giver of gifts.🔽A husband who marries a second wife,🔽should give twice as much to the first wife, otherwise he becomes a debtor.

analyzed: anujñāpya yadā bhārtā jyeṣṭhām anyām samudvahetak
translated: When the husband, with the consent of the first wife, marries another,

analyzed: tadā jyeṣṭha abhilaṣitam deyam āhuḥ
translated: then the knowers of ancient times say that the first wife's desired share should be given.

analyzed: jyeṣṭhayā sahitaḥ kuryāt iṣṭāpūrtam nara uttamaḥ
translated: The best of men should perform his desired rites together with the first wife.

analyzed: eṣa dharmaḥ nyathā nyāyaḥ jāyate dharma saṃkṣayaḥ
translated: This is the dharma, otherwise it becomes adharma, a decline in dharma.

analyzed: śrutvā tu mātṛ vacanam prahaṣṭena antarātmanaḥ
translated: Having heard the words of his mother, with a delighted mind,

analyzed: ekaikasyai dadau sāgrām koṭim koṭim sutaḥ tadā
translated: his son then gave each of them more than a crore.

analyzed: sahasram nagarāṇām ca grāmāṇām pradadau tathā  catur aśvatarībhiḥ ca pṛthak yuktāḥ nṛpa ātmajaḥ
translated: And he also gave a thousand cities and villages.🔽The prince also gave each of them eight chariots adorned with four horses,

analyzed: ekaikasya dadau aṣṭau rathān kāñcana mālinaḥ
translated: each with a golden garland.

analyzed: vāsasām ayutam prādāt yeṣām mūlyam śata adhikam
translated: He gave them ten thousand garments, the price of which was more than a hundred.

analyzed: śuddhasya meru jātasya akṣayasya nupa ātmajaḥ
translated: To the pure, mountain-born, inexhaustible son of Nupa.

analyzed: kāñcanasya dadau lakṣam ekaikam pratimātaram
translated: He gave one lakh of gold coins to each of the mothers.

original: dāsānāṃ ca śataṃ sāgraṃ dāsīnāṃ ca nṛpātmajaḥ // / / //🔽dhenūnāṃ ghaṭadogdhrīṇāmekaikasyai tathāyutam /
analyzed: dāsānām ca śatam sāgram dāsīnām ca nṛpa ātmajaḥ  dhenūnām ghaṭa dogdhrīṇām ekaikasyai tathā ayutam
translated: The prince gave more than a hundred male and female servants.🔽To each of them, he gave ten thousand milch cows.

original: yugandharāṇāṃ bhadrāṇāṃ śatāni daśa vai pṛthak // / / //
analyzed: yugandharāṇām bhadrāṇām śatāni daśa vai pṛthak
translated: He gave separately one hundred and ten pairs of auspicious yugandhara cows.

analyzed: daśa prakāram nṛpate dhānyam ca pradadau sutaḥ  vāṭīnām tu sahasrāṇām śatam prādāt hasan iva

analyzed: kuṃbha āyutam sarpiṣaḥ tu tailasya ca pṛthak dadau
translated: He gave ten thousand pots of ghee and oil separately.

analyzed: ajāvikam asaṃkhyātam ekaikasyai nyavedayat
translated: He offered innumerable goats and sheep to each of them.

analyzed: sahasreṇa sahasreṇa suvarṇasya vyabhūṣayat
translated: He adorned each of them with one thousand suvarnas.

analyzed: ākhaṇḍala astra yukta ratha bhūṣaṇasya su bhaktimān  dhātrī pramāṇaiḥ hariḥ ca mauktikaiḥ dīpti saṃyutaiḥ
translated: The son of Aakhandila, skilled in the use of weapons, was devoted to ornaments.

analyzed: pradadau saṃhatān kṛtvā valayān pañca sapta ca
translated: Hari gave five and seven bracelets made of pearls equal to the size of the nurse, combined together.

original: pañcāśacca śate dve tu bhauktikāni mahīpate /
analyzed: pañcāśat ca śate dve tu bhauktikāni mahīpate
translated: O king, he gave fifty-two sets of utensils.

analyzed: saṃdhyā valyām sthitāni iha śītāṃśu pratimāni ca
translated: And on the forehead of each, a pearl necklace, like the moon.

analyzed: ekaikasyai dadau hāra yugmam manoharam
translated: To each of them, the son gave a pair of charming pearl necklaces.

original: kuṅkumaṃ candanaṃ bhūri karpūraṃ prasthasaṃkhyayā // / / //🔽kastūrikāṃ tathā tābhyo bhūyasīṃ pradadau sutaḥ /
analyzed: kuṅkumam candanam bhūri karpūram prastha saṃkhyayā  kastūrikām tathā tābhyaḥ bhūyasīm pradadau sutaḥ
translated: And much saffron, sandalwood, and camphor weighing a prastha each.🔽And to them, the son gave more musk.

translated: Desiring the happiness of his father, without distinction among the mothers.🔽Various vessels, many water pots,

analyzed: ghṛta kṣīrasya pātrāṇi peyasya vividhasya ca
translated: Vessels of ghee and milk, and various drinks.

analyzed: caturddaśa śatam prādāt sahasreṇa samanvitam
translated: He gave fourteen hundred, along with a thousand.

analyzed: sthālīnām kāñcanīnām hi sa kuṃbhānām nṛpa ātmajaḥ
translated: The king's son gave golden pots with water jars,

original: ekaikasyai dadau bhūpa śatāni trīṇi pañca ca /
analyzed: ekaikasyai dadau bhūpa śatāni trīṇi pañca ca
translated: To each of them, the king gave three hundred and fifty.

analyzed: kareṇūnām sa vegānām māṃsa vikrānta kandharām
translated: Of she-elephants with speed, with flesh, and with necks raised.

original: viṃśatiṃ viṃśatiṃ prādāduṣṭrīṇāṃ ca śataṃ śatam /
analyzed: viṃśatim viṃśatim prādāt uṣṭrīṇām ca śatam śatam
translated: He gave twenty, and a hundred of each, of camels.

analyzed: śibikānām sa veṣāṇām puṃsām pīvara gāminām
translated: Of palanquins with coverings, and of men with stout limbs,

analyzed: pradadau daśa sapta aśvān mātṝṇām sukha yāyinaḥ
translated: He gave ten, and seven horses for the mothers to ride comfortably.

analyzed: evam da tvā bahu dhanam bahvībhyaḥ nṛpa nandanaḥ
translated: Having thus given much wealth to many, the prince

analyzed: dhanyaḥ dhanapati prakhyaḥ cakre tāsām pradakṣiṇāḥ
translated: was blessed and like the lord of wealth, and circumambulated them.

original: kṛtāñjalipuṭo bhūtvā idaṃ vacanamabravīt // / / //🔽mamoparodhātpraṇatasya mūrdhnāpatiṃ samuddiśya yathā bhavatyaḥ /
analyzed: kṛta añjali puṭaḥ bhūtvā idam vacanam abravīt  mama uparodhāt praṇatasya mūrdhnā apatim samuddiśya yathā bhavatyaḥ
translated: With palms joined in reverence, he spoke these words:🔽On account of my bowing down with my head, may you all

original: bruvantu sarvāḥ pitaraṃ mamādya svaireṇa saṃbhuṅkṣva nareśaṃ mohinīm // / / //
analyzed: bruvantu sarvāḥ pitaram mama adya svaireṇa saṃbhuṅkṣva nareśam mohinīm
translated: speak to my father today, saying, 'Enjoy the enchanting queen at your leisure.'

original: na cāsmadīyā bhavatā kilerṣyā svalpāpi kāryā manasi pratītā /
analyzed: na ca asmadīyā bhavatā kila īrṣyā su alpā api kāryā manasi pratītā
translated: And no jealousy, even the slightest, should be entertained by you in your mind towards us.

original: vimohinīṃ brahmasutāṃ suśīlāṃ ramasva saukhyena rahaḥ śatāni // / / //
analyzed: vimohinīm brahma sutām suśīlām ramasva saukhyena rahaḥ śatāni
translated: Enjoy with happiness for hundreds of years the well-behaved daughter of Brahma, Mohini.

original: tatputravākyaṃ hi niśamya sarvāḥ saṃhṛṣṭalomnyo nṛpanāthamūcuḥ /
analyzed: tad putra vākyam hi niśamya sarvāḥ saṃhṛṣṭa lomnyaḥ nṛpa nātham ūcuḥ
translated: Hearing those words of his son, all of them, with their body hair thrilled, spoke to the lord of men:

analyzed: sva bhū duhitrā su ciram ramasva videha putryā iva raghu pravīraḥ
translated: Enjoy for a long time with your own daughter, like the best of the Raghus with the daughter of Videha.

original: na śalyabhūtā kuśaketuputrī tvatsaṃgamādvidvi na saṃśayo 'tra /
analyzed: na śalya bhūtā kuśa ketu putrī tvad saṃgamāt vidvi na
translated: The daughter of Kushaketu is not a thorn, there is no doubt in this, due to your union with her.

analyzed: putra ojasā duḥkha vimukta bhāvāt samīritam vākyam idam pratīhi
translated: Understand these words spoken by the son, who is free from sorrow due to his son's prowess.

analyzed: iti śrī bṛhat nāradīyapurāṇa uttara bhāge mātṛsanmānam nāma aṣṭādaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the eighteenth chapter in the Uttara-khanda of the great Narada-Purana, describing the honouring of the mothers.

analyzed: vasiṣṭhaḥ uvāca
translated: Vasishtha said:

analyzed: saḥ nujñātaḥ mahīpālaḥ priyābhiḥ priya kāmukaḥ
translated: That king, the lover of his beloveds, thus permitted,

analyzed: praharṣam atulam lebhe dharmāṅgadam uvāca ha
translated: obtained incomparable joy and spoke to Dharmagupta:

analyzed: etām dvīpavatīm pṛthvīm paripālaya putraka
translated: O son, rule this earth full of islands,

analyzed: kṛtvā duṣṭa vadham tu ādau apramattaḥ sadā udyataḥ
translated: having first killed the wicked, being ever vigilant and energetic.🔽Always engaged in opportune acts, always observing good conduct,

original: sadā cetanasaṃyuktaḥ sadā vāṇijyavallabhaḥ // / / //🔽sadā bhramaṇaśīlaśca sadā dānaratirbhava /
analyzed: sadā cetana saṃyuktaḥ sadā vāṇijya vallabhaḥ  sadā bhramaṇa śīlaḥ ca sadā dāna ratiḥ bhava
translated: always endowed with consciousness, always fond of trade,🔽always inclined to wander, always delighting in charity,

analyzed: sadā kauṭilya hīnaḥ ca sat ācāra rataḥ sadā
translated: always free from crookedness, always devoted to good conduct.

original: aparaṃ śṛṇu me putra yatkarttavyaṃ tvayādhunā /
analyzed: aparam śṛṇu me putra yat karttavyam tvayā adhunā
translated: Listen further, O son, to what you should do now.

analyzed: aviśvāsaḥ tu sarvatra bhūmipānām praśasyate
translated: Lack of trust in all kings is praised.

analyzed: koṣasya ca parijñānam janānām jana vallabha
translated: And the knowledge of the treasury, O people's beloved,

analyzed: rasavat dravyam ākarṣeḥ puṣpebhyaḥ iva ṣaṭpadaḥ
translated: you should attract like a bee attracts nectar from flowers.

analyzed: tvayā putreṇa saṃprāptam punar evā iha yauvanam
translated: And you, my son, have regained youth once again.

analyzed: imām apūrvām vara rūpa mohinīm saṃprāpya bhāryām dvijarāja vaktrām
translated: Having obtained this unprecedented wife, who enchants with her supreme beauty, and who has the face of the king of birds,

original: sukhena saṃyojya ca te 'dya bhāraṃ saptodadhidvīpabhavaṃ praraṃsye // / / //🔽vrīḍākarastāta manuṣyaloke samarthaputre suratābhikāmī /
analyzed: sukhena saṃyojya ca te bhāram sapta udadhi dvīpa bhavam praraṃsye  vrīḍā karaḥ tāta manuṣya loke samartha putre surata abhikāmī
translated: I will happily entrust this burden to you today, which consists of the seven oceans and continents, and will enjoy myself.🔽O father, in the world of men, it would be embarrassing for a capable son to be passionately desirous of his own wife,

analyzed: bhavet pitā ced bralibhiḥ ca yuktaḥ jīrṇa dvijaḥ śveta śiroruhaḥ ca
translated: if the father were old, with gray hair on his head, and attached to young women.

original: jīrṇo 'pyajīrṇastava saukhyavṛddho vāñche imāṃ lokavarāṃ varārhām /🔽saṃtyajya devānmama hetumāgatāmanaṅgabāṇābhihatāṃ sunetrām // / / //
analyzed: jīrṇaḥ pi ajīrṇaḥ tava saukhya vṛddhaḥ vāñche imām loka varām vara arhām  saṃtyajya devān mama hetum āgatām anaṅga bāṇa abhihatām su netrām
translated: Even though old, I am not old, as my happiness increases. I desire this best of women, who deserves the best,🔽who has come to me for my sake, abandoning the gods, with beautiful eyes, struck by the arrows of Cupid.

original: kāmaṃ ramiṣye drutakāṃ canābhāṃ hyekāntaśīlaḥ paripūrṇacetāḥ /
analyzed: kāmam ramiṣye drutakām cana ābhām hi ekānta śīlaḥ paripūrṇa cetāḥ
translated: I will enjoy her, whose navel resembles a swift-moving river, with a mind full of single-pointed concentration,

original: bhūtvā tu gupto vananirjhareṣu ramyeṣu divyeṣu nadītaṭeṣu // / / //
analyzed: bhūtvā tu guptaḥ vana nirjhareṣu ramyeṣu divyeṣu nadī taṭeṣu
translated: having become hidden in the beautiful and divine riverbanks and mountain streams.

original: iyaṃ purandhrī mama jīvitādhikā sukhena dhāryā tridivaikanārī /
analyzed: iyam purandhrī mama jīvita adhikā sukhena dhāryā tridiva eka nārī
translated: This woman, more precious to me than life, should be happily supported by you, the only woman in heaven,

original: asyāstu hetorvibudhā vimūḍhā yathā ramāyai dharaṇīśasaṃghāḥ // / / //
analyzed: asyāḥ tu hetoḥ vibudhāḥ vimūḍhāḥ yathā ramāyai dharaṇīśa saṃghāḥ
translated: But the gods are confused about this cause, like the multitude of earth lords for Ramā.

original: tadvākyamākarṇya pituḥ subuddhiḥ praṇamya bhaktyā jananīsametam /
analyzed: tat vākyam ākarṇya pituḥ subuddhiḥ praṇamya bhaktyā jananī sametam
translated: Having heard those words, the son of the king, Subuddhi, with devotion bowed to his father along with his mother,

analyzed: nṛpa uttamam tam nṛpa nandanaḥ sau dideśa bhoga artham aneka vittam
translated: and that son of the king gave him much wealth for enjoyment.

analyzed: ājñā vidheyān tu pituḥ niyojya dāsān ca dāsīḥ ca hiraṇya kaṇṭhīḥ
translated: Appointing servants and maids who were obedient to his father's command and had golden necklaces,

analyzed: matsya dhvaja ārttasya sukhāya putraḥ tatas mahī rakṣaṇam ācacāra
translated: for the happiness of the one afflicted by the fish banner, the son then engaged in protecting the earth.

analyzed: nṛpaiḥ tutaḥ dharma vibhūṣaṇaḥ sau samāvṛtaḥ dvīpavatīm samagrām
translated: Praised by kings, he, the ornament of dharma, surrounded the entire earth with islands.

original: tasyetthamurvīṃ carataśca bhūpa na pāpabuddhiṃ kurute janaighaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasya ittham urvīm carataḥ ca bhūpa na pāpa buddhim kurute jana eghaḥ
translated: While he roamed the earth in this way, the multitude of people did not have a sinful thought.

original: na cāpi vṛkṣaḥ phalapuṣpahīno na kṣetramāsīdyavaśālihīnam /
analyzed: na ca api vṛkṣaḥ phala puṣpa hīnaḥ na kṣetram āsīt yava śāli hīnam
translated: No tree was without fruits and flowers, no field was without barley and rice.

analyzed: sravanti gāvaḥ ghaṭapūra dugdham ghṛta adhikam śarkara vat su miṣṭam
translated: Cows flowed with milk filling pots, with ghee in excess, and very sweet like sugar.

original: kṣīraṃ supeyaṃ sakalārtināśanaṃ pāpāpahaṃ puṣṭivivardhanaṃ ca /
analyzed: kṣīram su peyam sakala ārti nāśanam pāpa apaham puṣṭi vivardhanam ca
translated: Milk to be drunk well, destroying all afflictions, removing sins, and increasing nourishment,

original: jano na kaścidvibhavasya goptā bhartuhiṃ bhāryā na kaṭūktivādinī // / / //
analyzed: janaḥ na kaścid vibhavasya goptā bhartu him bhāryā na kaṭu ukti vādinī
translated: No one is the guardian of wealth. A wife does not speak harsh words to her husband.

original: putro vinītaḥ pitṛśāsane rato vadhūḥ sthitā hastapuṭe ca śvaśroḥ /
analyzed: putraḥ vinītaḥ pitṛ śāsane rataḥ vadhūḥ sthitā hasta puṭe ca śvaśroḥ
translated: A son is obedient and delights in his father's instructions. A daughter-in-law stands with folded hands before her mother-in-law.

original: dvijopadeśe hi jano vyavasthito vedoktadharmācaraṇāddvijottamāḥ // / / //🔽na bhuñjate mādhavavāsare janā na yānti śoṣaṃ bhuviḥ nimnagāstu /
analyzed: dvija upadeśe hi janaḥ vyavasthitaḥ veda ukta dharma ācaraṇāt dvijottamāḥ  na bhuñjate mādhava vāsare janāḥ na yānti śoṣam bhuviḥ nimnagāḥ tu
translated: The people are established in the teachings of the Brahmins, O best of Brahmins, by following the duties enjoined by the Vedas.🔽People do not eat on the day of Madhava (i.e. the eleventh lunar day), and the rivers on the earth do not dry up.

original: saṃbhujya mānā nahi yānti saṃpadaḥ saṃbhogayuktairapi mānavaiḥ kṣayam // / / //
analyzed: saṃbhujya mānāḥ nahi yānti saṃpadaḥ saṃbhoga yuktaiḥ api mānavaiḥ kṣayam
translated: Wealth, when enjoyed, does not diminish even for men who enjoy it.

analyzed: vivṛddhim āyānti jalaiḥ iva ūrddhvam dūrvā tṛṇam śādvala tām upaiti
translated: Grass and shrubs grow upwards like water, and attain the state of green grass.

original: kṛtī ca loko hyabhavatsamasto dharmāṅgade pālanasaṃpravṛtte // / / //
analyzed: kṛtī ca lokaḥ hi abhavat samastaḥ dharma aṅgade pālana saṃpravṛtte
translated: And the entire world became prosperous when Dharmagupta was engaged in ruling.

original: bhuktvā tu saukhyāni ca yānti mānavā hareḥ padaṃ taddinasevanena /
analyzed: bhuktvā tu saukhyāni ca yānti mānavāḥ hareḥ padam tad dina sevanena
translated: Having enjoyed pleasures, men go to that abode of Hari by serving him on that day.

original: dvārāṇi sadhvāntaniśāsu bhūpa guptāni kurvanti na dasyu bhītāḥ // / / //
analyzed: dvārāṇi sa dhvānta niśāsu bhūpa guptāni kurvanti na dasyu bhītāḥ
translated: O king, the doors are guarded at night by thieves, not out of fear.

original: na cāpi gopeṣu dadanti vṛttiṃ svecchācarā mandiramāvrajanti /
analyzed: na ca api gopeṣu dadanti vṛttim sva icchā carāḥ mandiram āvrajanti
translated: And they do not give wages to the cowherds, they move as they please and enter their houses.

original: kṣīraṃ kṣarantyo ghaṭavatsubhūriśo vatsapriyāḥ śāntikarāśca gāvaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kṣīram kṣarantyaḥ ghaṭa vat su bhūriśas vatsa priyāḥ śānti karāḥ ca gāvaḥ
translated: The cows, dear to the calves, producing milk like water from pots, and bringing peace, in great numbers.

original: akṛṣṭapacyā dharaṇī samastā prarūḍhasasyā kila lāṅgalaṃ vinā /
analyzed: a kṛṣṭa pacyā dharaṇī samastā prarūḍha sasyā kila lāṅgalam vinā
translated: The entire earth, without plowing, was full of ripe crops.

original: mātuḥ payobhiḥ śiśavaḥ supuṣṭā bhartuḥ prayogaiḥ pramadāḥ supuṣṭāḥ // / / //
analyzed: mātuḥ payobhiḥ śiśavaḥ su puṣṭāḥ bhartuḥ prayogaiḥ pramadāḥ su puṣṭāḥ
translated: The children were well-nourished by their mother's milk, and the women were well-nourished by their husband's enjoyment.

original: nṛpaiḥ suguptāstu janāḥ supuṣṭāḥ satyābhiyukto hi vṛṣaḥ supuṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: nṛpaiḥ su guptāḥ tu janāḥ su puṣṭāḥ satya abhiyuktaḥ hi vṛṣaḥ su puṣṭaḥ
translated: The people were well-nourished, well-protected by the kings, and the bull was well-nourished, engaged in truth.

original: evaṃ vidhe dharmaratipradhāne jane pravṛtte haribhaktiyukte /🔽saṃrakṣyamāṇe hi nṛpātmajena jagāma kālaḥ sukhahe tubhūtaḥ // / / //🔽nirāmayo bhūtisamanvitaśca sabhūrivarṣotsavakārakaśca /
analyzed: evaṃvidhe dharma rati pradhāne jane pravṛtte hari bhakti yukte  saṃrakṣyamāṇe hi nṛpa ātmajena jagāma kālaḥ sukha he tu bhūtaḥ  nirāmayaḥ bhūti samanvitaḥ ca sa bhūri varṣotsava kārakaḥ ca
translated: When the people were thus engaged in righteousness and love, devoted to Hari,🔽and protected by the prince, time passed, bringing happiness.🔽Free from disease, endowed with prosperity, causing rain and festivals like the earth,

analyzed: pṛthvīpatiḥ ca ati vimohitaḥ ca vimohinī ceṣṭita saukhya yuktaḥ
translated: the lord of the earth, greatly infatuated, endowed with the happiness of Mohini's actions.

original: dinaṃ na jānāti na cāpi rātriṃ māsaṃ ca pakṣaṃ ca sa vatsaraṃ ca /
analyzed: dinam na jānāti na ca api rātrim māsam ca pakṣam ca sa vatsaram ca
translated: He did not know day or night, month or fortnight or year,

original: atīva mugdhaḥ suratena tasyā virañciputryāḥ śubhaceṣṭitāyāḥ // / / //
analyzed: atīva mugdhaḥ suratena tasyāḥ virañci putryāḥ śubha ceṣṭitāyāḥ
translated: extremely infatuated by her, the daughter of Viranchi, of auspicious conduct, in love-making.

analyzed: vimohinī saṃgamane nṛpasya babhūva śaktiḥ tu adhikā manoje
translated: The king's power of virility in the union with Vimohini became greatly enhanced.

original: yathā yathā sevata eva bhūpastathā tathā vṛddhimiyarti vīryam /🔽pakṣeṣu śukleṣviva śītabhānurna kṣīyate saṃtatasevanena // / / //
analyzed: yathā yathā sevate eva bhūpaḥ tathā tathā vṛddhim iyarti vīryam  pakṣeṣu śukleṣu iva śītabhānuḥ na kṣīyate saṃtata sevanena
translated: The more the king indulged in it, the more his virility increased.🔽Like the moon in the bright fortnights, it did not diminish by constant use.

original: vṛndārakaḥ pītasudhāraso yathā saṃspṛśya saṃspṛśya punarnavo 'sau /
analyzed: vṛndārakaḥ pīta sudhā rasaḥ yathā saṃspṛśya saṃspṛśya
translated: Like a young boy repeatedly touching the nectar of drinking,

original: pibaṃstu pānaṃ sumanoharaṃ hi śṛṇvaṃstu gītaṃ supadaprayuktam // / / //
analyzed: piban tu pānam su manoharam hi śṛṇvan tu gītam su pada prayuktam
translated: drinking the most delightful drink, listening to songs with well-formed words,

original: paśyaṃśca rūpaṃ sa nitaṃbinīnāṃ spṛśanspṛśanmohinivaktracandram /🔽vimarddamānastu kareṇa tuṅgau sukhena pīnau piśitoparūḍhau // / / //
analyzed: paśyan ca rūpam sa nitaṃbinīnām spṛśan spṛśan mohini vaktra candram  vimarddamānaḥ tu kareṇa tuṅgau sukhena pīnau piśita uparūḍhau
translated: seeing the forms of those with hips, touching the moon-like face of the enchantress again and again,🔽massaging with his hands the high and plump breasts covered with flesh,

analyzed: ghana stanau kāñcana kuṃbha tulyau pracchāditau hāra vibhūṣaṇena
translated: the two breasts, full and round like golden pots, covered with a necklace ornament,

analyzed: vali trayam na ati vivarddhamānam manoharam lomaśa rāji śobham
translated: the three folds not very prominent, charming and beautiful like a row of hair,

original: stanasya rūpaṃ parito vilokya dadhre varāṅgyāḥ śubhalocanāyāḥ /
analyzed: stanasya rūpam paritas vilokya dadhre vara aṅgyāḥ śubha locanāyāḥ
translated: seeing all around the form of the breast of the excellent lady with auspicious eyes,

analyzed: nahi īdṛśam cārutaram nitāntam nitaṃbinīnām manasaḥ bhirāmam
translated: For nothing is more charming and delightful to the minds of women than this.

original: yādṛgvidhaṃ mohinamohanārthaṃ vinirmitaṃ yadvidhinā svarūpam /🔽mṛgendraśatroḥkarasannikāśe jaṅghe vilome drutakāñcanābhe // / / //
analyzed: yādṛgvidham mohina mohana artham vinirmitam yat vidhinā sva rūpam  mṛgendra śatroḥ kara sannikāśe jaṅghe vilome druta kāñcana ābhe
translated: The form that was created by the Creator in such a way as to captivate Mohini,🔽The thighs of the enemy of the lord of beasts, resembling the trunk of an elephant, inverted, and swift like molten gold,

analyzed: śaśāṅka kāntiḥ daśanasya paṅktiḥ nigūḍha gulphe jana mohana artham
translated: The row of teeth of the moon-faced one, hidden at the ankles, for the purpose of enchanting people,

translated: From head to foot, one should behold that form of the one with beautiful and large eyes.

original: mene surāṇāmadhikaṃ hi rājā kṛtārthamātmānamatīva harṣāt /
analyzed: mene surāṇām adhikam hi rājā kṛtārtham ātmānam atīva harṣāt
translated: The king considered it to be superior to the gods, and himself to be extremely fortunate and delighted.

original: aho sutanvī vipulekṣaṇeyaṃ yāciṣyate yacca tadeva deyam // / / //🔽asyāstu ramye surate śubhāyā dāsyāmi cānte nijavittajātam /
analyzed: aho su tanvī vipula īkṣaṇā iyam yāciṣyate yat ca tat eva deyam  asyāḥ tu ramye surate śubhāyāḥ dāsyāmi ca ante nija vitta jātam
translated: Oh, this slender-bodied one with large eyes! Whatever she asks for, that alone should be given.🔽In this beautiful and auspicious love-making, I will give her all my wealth in the end.

analyzed: su durlabham deyam adeyam anyaiḥ dāsyāmi ca asyāḥ yadi vā api adeyam
translated: Even if it is difficult to obtain and cannot be given by others, I will give it to her, even if it cannot be given.

original: yadyapyadeyaṃ mama jīvitaṃ hi yāciṣyate cedyadi hemavarṇā /
analyzed: yadi api adeyam mama jīvitam hi yāciṣyate ced yadi hemavarṇā
translated: If my life itself, which is difficult to give up, is asked for by the golden-complexioned one,

analyzed: dāsyāmi ca idam na vicārayiṣye putram vinā nā asti na deyam asyāḥ
translated: I will give it without hesitation. Except for my son, there is nothing that cannot be given to her.

analyzed: iti śrī bṛhat nāradīyapurāṇa uttara bhāge mohinīpraṇayavarṇanam nāma ekonaviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the nineteenth chapter in the Uttara-khanda of the Srimad-Bhagavata-Mahatmya, in which the love of Mohini is described.

analyzed: vasiṣṭhaḥ uvāca
translated: Vasishtha said:

analyzed: evam surata mūḍhasya rājñaḥ rukmāṅgadasya ca
translated: Thus, the king Rukmangada, deluded by love,

original: trīṇi pañca ca varṣāṇi vyatītāni sukhena vai // / / //
analyzed: trīṇi pañca ca varṣāṇi vyatītāni sukhena vai
translated: spent three and five years happily.

original: saṃprāpte navame varṣe putro dharmāṅgado balī /
analyzed: saṃprāpte navame varṣe putraḥ dharmāṅgadaḥ balī
translated: In the ninth year, his son Dharmagupta, the powerful one,

analyzed: jitvā vidyādharān pañca malaye parvata uttame
translated: having conquered five Vidyadharas on the excellent Malaya mountain,

analyzed: ājahāra maṇīn pañca sarva kāma pradān śubhān
translated: obtained five auspicious gems that grant all desires.

analyzed: ekam kāñcana dātāram koṭi koṭi guṇam śubham
translated: One gem that gives gold is auspicious and has a crore times more value.

analyzed: dvitīyam vastra bhūṣā ādi lakṣa koṭi pradam tathā
translated: The second one gives a lakh and crore of garments, ornaments, etc.

analyzed: tṛtīyam amṛta srāvi punar yauvana kārakam
translated: The third one oozes nectar and restores youth.

analyzed: sabhāgṛha prakartāram caturtham ca anna sādhakam
translated: The fourth one, which accomplishes food, builds assembly halls and houses.

analyzed: pañcamam trailokya parisarpaṇam  tān maṇīn gṛhya manasā vidyādhara samanvitaḥ
translated: The fifth one grants the ability to travel in the sky and roam the three worlds.🔽Taking those gems in his mind, accompanied by the Vidyadharas,

analyzed: strībhiḥ vidyādharāṇām ca sa aśru netrābhiḥ āvṛtaḥ
translated: surrounded by the wives of the Vidyadharas with tearful eyes,

original: vavande caraṇau mātuḥ pitū rukmāṅgadasya ca /
analyzed: vavande caraṇau mātuḥ pituḥ rukmāṅgadasya ca
translated: And he bowed at the feet of his mother and father, Rukmangada.

analyzed: maṇīn pañca samarpya atha pādayoḥ prāha saṃnataḥ
translated: Then, offering five gems at their feet, he said, bowing down:

original: ime jitā mayā tāta pañca vidyādharā raṇe /
analyzed: ime jitāḥ mayā tāta pañca vidyādharāḥ raṇe
translated: O father, these five Vidyadharas have been conquered by me in battle.

analyzed: malaye bhūdhara śreṣṭhe vaiṣṇava astreṇa bhūpate
translated: On the best of mountains, Malaya, with the Vaishnava weapon, O king.

original: ime te bhṛtyatāṃ prāptāḥ sastrīkā nṛpasattama /
analyzed: ime te bhṛtya tām prāptāḥ sa strīkāḥ nṛpa sattama
translated: O best of kings, they have become your servants along with their women.

analyzed: maṇīn prayaccha mohinyai bhuja bhūṣaṇa hetave
translated: Give these gems to Mohini for the adornment of her arms.

analyzed: sarva kāma pradāḥ hi ete punar yauvana kāriṇaḥ
translated: These gems grant all desires and restore youth.

original: jīrṇadantāḥ punarbālā bhavanti maṇidhāraṇāt // / / //🔽vastraharmyasuvarṇānāṃ svargateramṛtasya ca /
analyzed: jīrṇa dantāḥ punar bālāḥ bhavanti maṇi dhāraṇāt  vastra harmya suvarṇānām svar gateḥ amṛtasya ca
translated: By wearing these gems, even those with worn-out teeth become young again.

analyzed: dātāraḥ māsa yuddhena sādhitāḥ tava tejasā
translated: By your valor, they have been conquered in a month's battle, the givers of garments, palaces, gold, heaven, and nectar.

analyzed: sādhitāni mayā kṛcchrāt sapta dvīpāni bhūpate
translated: O king, I have conquered the seven islands with difficulty.

analyzed: kara dāni samastāni kṛtāni tava tejasā
translated: All of them have been made to pay tribute by your valor.

original: samudre ca praviṣṭasya gataḥ saṃvatsaro mama /🔽jitā bhogavatī tāta mayā nāgasamāvṛtā // / / //
analyzed: samudre ca praviṣṭasya gataḥ saṃvatsaraḥ mama  jitā bhogavatī tāta mayā nāga samāvṛtā
translated: And a year has passed since I entered the ocean.🔽O father, I have conquered Bhogavati, surrounded by nagas.

analyzed: āhṛtāḥ nāga kanyāḥ ca mayā ca ayuta saṃkhyakāḥ
translated: And I have brought ten thousand Naga maidens.

analyzed: tatra api hāra ratnāni su bahūni āhṛtāni ca
translated: And there also, I brought many precious jewels.

analyzed: punar ca aham gataḥ tāta dānavānām puram mahat
translated: And again, O father, I went to the great city of the demons.

analyzed: tān nirjityam ca kanyānām surūpāṇām su varcasām
translated: And having defeated them, I brought five thousand beautiful and radiant maidens.

original: āhṛtāni mayā trīṇi sahasrāṇi ca pañca ca /
analyzed: āhṛtāni mayā trīṇi sahasrāṇi ca pañca ca
translated: And I brought three thousand and five thousand.

analyzed: daśa koṭyaḥ tu ratnānām dīpa karma niśā āgame
translated: And ten million jewels for the night-time lamp-work.

analyzed: kurvatām te mahīpālaḥ ānītāḥ tava mandire
translated: O king, they were brought to your palace by me.

analyzed: tatas ham vāruṇam lokam rasātala tala sthitam
translated: Then I went to the world of Varuna, situated at the bottom of the nether regions,

analyzed: gataḥ vīrya bala utsiktaḥ tvad aṅghri yuga sevakaḥ
translated: arrogant with valour and strength, serving your two feet.

analyzed: tatra uktaḥ varuṇaḥ devaḥ sthīyatām mad pintuḥ vaśe
translated: There the god Varuna was told, Stay under the control of my father,

analyzed: rukmāṅgadasya nṛpateḥ yadi jīvitum icchasi
translated: if you wish to live, O king Rukmin.
