analyzed: kupitaḥ mama vākyena varuṇaḥ yoddhum āgataḥ  tena saṃvatsaram yuddham ghoram jātam rasātale
translated: Angry at my words, Varuna came to fight.🔽For a year, a terrible battle took place between us in the nether regions.

analyzed: jitaḥ nārāyaṇa astreṇa mayā sa jalanāyakaḥ
translated: That lord of waters was defeated by me with the Narayana weapon.

analyzed: na hataḥ pramadā vākyaiḥ tasya jīvita rakṣaṇe
translated: He was not killed, for the sake of preserving his life by the words of a woman.

analyzed: nirjitena ayutam dattam vājinām vāta raṃhasām
translated: When defeated, he gave me ten thousand horses swift as the wind.

analyzed: ekatas śyāma karṇānām śubhrāṇām candra varcasām
translated: On one side were horses with black ears, white and radiant like the moon,

analyzed: tṛṇa toya vihīnāḥ ye jīvanti bahuśas samāḥ
translated: who lived for many years on grass and water alone.

original: ekāṃ kanyāṃ surūpāṃ me puraskṛtya svalaṅkṛtām /
analyzed: ekām kanyām surūpām me puraskṛtya su alaṅkṛtām
translated: I placed before me a beautiful and well-adorned maiden,

analyzed: bhāryā arthe varuṇaḥ prādāt sā api ānītā mayā śubhā
translated: and Varuna gave her to me as a wife. That auspicious one was brought by me.

analyzed: kumārī tu samānītāḥ bahu vitta samanvitā
translated: Many maidens were brought, endowed with great wealth.

original: tannisti triṣu lokeṣu sthānaṃ tāta sudurgamam // / / //
analyzed: tat nisti triṣu lokeṣu sthānam tāta su durgamam
translated: That is difficult to attain in the three worlds, O father.

analyzed: yat mayā na jitam hi asti tava aṅghri parisevanāt
translated: What has not been conquered by me through serving your feet?

analyzed: tat uttiṣṭha parīkṣasva tvad prasāda arjitām śriyam

original: na bhūmyā sadṛśaṃ dānaṃ na sukhaṃ bhāryayā samam // / / //🔽na kṛṣyā tu samaṃ vittaṃ na lābhaḥ surabhīsamaḥ /

analyzed: na tapaḥ naśanāt anyat na damena samam śivam

original: tṛptirna rasanātulyā na samo 'nyo dvijena ca /
analyzed: tṛptiḥ na rasanā tulyā na samaḥ nyaḥ dvijena ca
translated: There is no satisfaction equal to that of the tongue, and no one equal to a Brahmin.

analyzed: na dharmeṇa samam mitram na satyena samam yaśaḥ
translated: There is no friend equal to Dharma, and no fame equal to truth.

analyzed: na ārogya samam aiśvaryam na devaḥ keśavāt paraḥ
translated: There is no prosperity equal to good health, and no god greater than Keshava.

original: na kārtikasamaṃ loke pāvanaṃ kavayo viduḥ // / / //
analyzed: na kārtika samam loke pāvanam kavayaḥ viduḥ

analyzed: kārtikaḥ pravaraḥ māsaḥ viṣṇoḥ ca api priyaḥ sadā
translated: The month of Kartika is always the best and dear to Vishnu.

analyzed: avrataḥ hi kṣipet yaḥ tu māsam dāmodara priyam
translated: One who wastes the month dear to Damodara without observing vows,

analyzed: tiryagyonim avāpnoti sarva dharma bahiṣkṛtaḥ
translated: is excluded from all duties and attains birth as an animal.

analyzed: māndhātā uvāca
translated: Mandhata said:

analyzed: saṃprāpya kārtike māse rājā rukmāṅgadaḥ mune
translated: Having attained the month of Kartika, O sage, King Rukmangada,

analyzed: tasmin puṇyatame māse kim cakāra nṛpa uttamaḥ

analyzed: vasiṣṭhaḥ uvāca

translated: Seeing that Kartika had arrived, which awakens Hari,

analyzed: ati pramugdhaḥ rāja indraḥ mohinīm vākyam abravīt
translated: The king, the lord of kings, was greatly delighted and spoke to Mohini:

analyzed: ratam devi tvayā sārddham mayā saṃvatsarān bahūn

analyzed: tava apamāna bhītena nā uktam kiñcid api kvacid
translated: Fearing to offend you, I have not said anything anywhere.

analyzed: sāṃpratam vaktu kāmaḥ ham tat nibodha śubha ānane
translated: Now I wish to speak, O you of beautiful face, understand that.

translated: O Goddess, many Kartikas have passed for me who is attached to you.🔽I have not observed any vow in Kartika except for one day of Hari.

analyzed: saḥ ham kārtikam icchāmi vrate na paryyupāsitum
translated: I now wish to observe a vow in Kartika.

analyzed: avratena gataḥ yeṣām kārtikaḥ martya dharmiṇām
translated: For those mortals who have let Kartika pass without a vow,

translated: Their dharma in Ishta and Pūrta is in vain, O you born from the sacrificial altar.

translated: Even kings who eat meat and are greatly fond of hunting,

translated: For those who have started eating, if they observe the rules in Kartika,

analyzed: tiṣṭhantu bahu vittāni dānāni varavarṇini
translated: Let alone the many expensive gifts, O best of women,

analyzed: hṛdaya āyāsa kartṝṇi dīpa dānāt divam vrajet

analyzed: tasya api abhāvāt subhage para dīpa prabodhanam

analyzed: kārtikena samam proktam dīpa dānāt prabodhanam
translated: Lighting lamps is said to be equal to Kartika.

analyzed: kartavyam bhakti bhāvena sarva dāna adhikam smṛtam
translated: It should be done with devotion, and is remembered as superior to all gifts.

analyzed: kārtikīm ca tithim kṛtvā viṣṇoḥ nābhi saroruhe
translated: Having made the Kartika full moon day, in the lotus navel of Vishnu,

analyzed: ājanma kṛta pāpāt tu mucyate na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: One is freed from the sins committed since birth, there is no doubt about it.

analyzed: vrata upavāsa niyamaiḥ kārtikaḥ yasya gacchati
translated: For whom Kartika passes by with vows, fasting and restraints,

analyzed: tava vakṣoja pūjāyāḥ virataḥ nīraja īkṣame

analyzed: aham vrata dharaḥ ca eva bhaviṣye hari pūjane

analyzed: mohinī uvāca

analyzed: viśeṣāt kutra kathitaḥ tat ādiśa mahāmate

analyzed: śrutvā kārttikamāhātmyam kariṣye haṃ yathā īpsitam

analyzed: rukmāṅgadaḥ uvāca
translated: Rukmangada said:

analyzed: yena bhaktiḥ bhavitrī te prakartum hari pūjanam

analyzed: kārttike kṛcchra sevī yaḥ vā

analyzed: eka antara upavāsī vā tri rātra upoṣitaḥ vā

analyzed: viśeṣāt puṣkare tīrthe dvārāvatyām ca śaukare
translated: In particular, at the Pushkara tirtha, in Dwaravati, and in Shaukara,

analyzed: tasmin dine varārohe maṇḍalam yaḥ tu paśyati

analyzed: kārtike śaukara māṃsam yaḥ tu bhuñjīta durmatiḥ
translated: The evil-minded one who eats pork in the month of Kartika,

analyzed: ṣaṣṭi varṣa sahasrāṇi raurave paripacyate

analyzed: tad muktaḥ jāyate pāpī viṣṭhā āśī grāmya sūkaraḥ

analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena dīkṣām kurvīta kārtike

analyzed: paśu yonim avāpnoti dīkṣayā rahitaḥ naraḥ

analyzed: kārtike śukla pakṣasya hi ekādaśīm naraḥ

analyzed: prātar datvā śubhān kuṃbhān prayāti hari mandiram

analyzed: saṃvatsara vratānām hi samāptiḥ kārtikam smṛtā
translated: The completion of all annual vows is remembered to be in Kartika.

analyzed: vivāhāḥ yatra dṛśyante viṣṇoḥ nābhi saroruhe
translated: Where marriages are seen in the lotus navel of Vishnu,

analyzed: dināni tatra catvāri yathā ekam varāvarṇini

analyzed: vinā uttarāyaṇe kālam lagna śuddhim vinā api ca

analyzed: dṛśyante yatra sambandhāḥ putra pautra vivarddhanāḥ
translated: where relationships are seen that increase sons and grandsons,

analyzed: tasmāt mohini kartāsmi kārtike vrata sevanam
translated: therefore, O Mohini, I will observe the Kartika vow,

analyzed: aśeṣa pāpa nāśāya tava prīti vivṛddhaye
translated: for the destruction of all sins and for the increase of your joy.

analyzed: mohinī uvāca  aho māhātmyam atulam kārtikasya tvayoḥ itam

analyzed: cāturmāsya vratānām hi vidhim udyāpanam vada
translated: Please tell the procedure and completion of the four-month vows,

analyzed: pūrṇa tā yena bhavatagi vratānām pṛthivīpate
translated: by which, O lord of the earth, the vows become complete,

analyzed: avaikalyam bhavet ca eva vratam puṇya phalasya tu

analyzed: rājā uvāca
translated: The king said:

analyzed: nakta vratī ṣaṣ rasena brāhmaṇam bhojayet priye
translated: O Beloved, one observing the Naktavrata should feed a Brahmin with the six tastes.

original: ayācite tvanaṅkāhaṃ sahiraṇyaṃ pradāpayet /🔽amāṃsāśībhavedyasttu gāṃ pradadyātsadakṣiṇām // / / //
analyzed: a yācite tu anaṅka aham sa hiraṇyam pradāpayet  a māṃsa āśībhavet yaḥ tu gām pradadyāt sa dakṣiṇām
translated: In the Ayachita, one should give a cow with gold.🔽One who abstains from meat should give a cow with dakshina.

analyzed: dhātrī snāne naraḥ dadyāt dadhi pāyasam eva ca

translated: O beautiful-browed one, in the vow of fruits, one should give fruits.🔽In the renunciation of oil, one should give ghee, and in the renunciation of ghee, milk.

translated: In the vow of wearing nails and hair, one should give a mirror.

analyzed: āmiṣasya parityāge sa vatsām kapilām dadet

analyzed: nityam dīpa pradaḥ yaḥ tu vrate bhīṣṭe surālaye
translated: One who always offers lamps in the desired vow in the abode of the gods,

translated: One who fasts every other day should give a silken garment.🔽In the three-night vow, one should give a well-adorned bed with gold.

analyzed: ṣaṣ rarātra ādi upavāseṣu śibikām chatra saṃyutām
translated: In the six-night and other fasts, one should give a palanquin along with an umbrella.

analyzed: sa vāha puruṣam pīnam anaṅ vāham atha arpayet  ajāvikam tu eka bhakte phala āhāre suvarṇakam
translated: One should offer a well-fed bull with a man to drive it.🔽In the one-meal vow, one should give a goat and a sheep, and in the fruit-eating vow, gold.

analyzed: śāka āhāre phalam dadyāt sauvarṇam ghṛta saṃyutam
translated: In the vegetable-eating vow, one should give a fruit with gold and ghee.

analyzed: rasānām ca eva sarveṣām tyāge nuktasya vā api ca
translated: For the abandonment of all juices or anything not mentioned,

analyzed: dātavyam rājatam pātram sauvarṇa vā api śaktitaḥ
translated: a silver or golden vessel should be given according to one's ability.

analyzed: yathā uktasya apradāne tu yathā ukta akaraṇe vā
translated: If one does not give as stated or does not do as stated,

analyzed: vipra vākyam caret subhru viṣṇu smaraṇa pūrvakam

original: vṛthā vipravaco yastu manyate manujaḥ śubhe // / / //

translated: The gods, the hosts of holy places, and the sacrifices are established in the words of the earth and the gods.

analyzed: kaḥ laṅghayet subhru vacaḥ hi teṣām śreyobhi kāmaḥ manujaḥ tu vidvān

analyzed: prakāśitam tubhyam ananya vācyam phala pradam mādhava tuṣṭi hetum 🔽iti śrī bṛhat nāradīyapurāṇa uttara bhāge kārtikamāhātmyam nāma dvāviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ 🔽mohinī uvāca 🔽vākyam uktam tvayā sādhu kārtike yat upoṣaṇam 🔽vrata ādi karaṇam rājñām na uktam kvāpi nidarśane

analyzed: muktvā ekam brāhmaṇam loke na uktam śūdra viśoḥ api

translated: If you desire me as your beloved, you should not observe this vow.

analyzed: muhūrtam api rāja indra na śaknomi tvayā vinā  sthātum kamala garbha ābha kim punar māsa saṃkhyayā
translated: O Indra among kings, I cannot bear to stay even for a moment without you,🔽how much more for a period of months, O you who are fair as the interior of a lotus!

analyzed: yatra upavāsa karaṇam manyase vasādha adhipa
translated: O lord of the earth, wherever you think of observing a fast,

analyzed: tatra vai bhojanam deyam viprāṇām ca mahātmanām
translated: there food should be given to the great-souled Brahmanas.

analyzed: athavā jyeṣṭha patnī yā sā karotu vrata ādikam
translated: Or let the eldest wife observe the vows and other rites.

translated: When these words were spoken by Mohini, the one adorned with gold,

analyzed: ājuhāva priyām bhāryām nāmnā saṃdhyāvalim śubhām
translated: he summoned his beloved wife, the auspicious Sandhyavali by name.

analyzed: āhūtā tad kṣaṇāt prāptā rājānam bhūri dakṣiṇam
translated: Summoned, she instantly arrived before the king who gave abundant gifts,

analyzed: āśīnam śayane divye mohinī bāhu saṃvṛtam
translated: who was seated on a divine bed, embraced by Mohini,

analyzed: saṃghṛṣṭam hi kuca agreṇa svarṇa kuṃbha nibhena hi
translated: and was pressed by her breasts resembling golden pots,

analyzed: śayane vāmanetrāyāḥ sa kāmāyāḥ mahīpate
translated: on the bed of the passionate one with beautiful eyes, O king.

analyzed: kṛtām jali puṭā bhūtvā bhartuḥ namita kandharā
translated: and with folded palms, bowed her neck to her husband.

analyzed: saṃdhyāvalī prāha nṛpam kim āhūtā karomi aham
translated: Sandhyavali said to the king, Why have I been called?

analyzed: tava vākye sthitā kānta duḥsāpatnya vivarjitā
translated: I am devoted to your words, O beloved, free from the misery of co-wife rivalry.

original: yathā yathā hi ramase mohinyā sahaha bhūpate /
analyzed: yathā yathā hi ramase mohinyā saha ha bhūpate
translated: O king, as you enjoy with Mohini,

analyzed: tathā tathā mama prītiḥ varddhate na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: so my joy increases, there is no doubt about it.

analyzed: bhartuḥ saukhyena yā nārī duḥkha yuktā prajāyate
translated: The woman who becomes miserable due to the happiness of her husband,

analyzed: sā tu śyenī bhavet rājan trīṇi varṣāṇi pañca ca
translated: she becomes a hawk, O king, for three years and five months.

original: ājñāṃ me dehi rājendra mā vrīhāṃ kāmikāṃ kuru // / / //
analyzed: ājñām me dehi rāja indra mā vrīhām kāmikām kuru
translated: Give me your command, O lord of kings, do not delay, do what you desire.

analyzed: rukmāṅgadaḥ uvāca
translated: Rukmangada said

analyzed: jānāmi tava śīlam tu kulam jānāmi bhāmini
translated: I know your character, O beautiful lady, I know your family.

original: tava vākyena hi ciraṃ mohinī ramitā mayā // / / //
analyzed: tava vākyena hi ciram mohinī ramitā mayā

analyzed: ramamāṇasya su ciram bahavaḥ kārtikāḥ gatāḥ

original: priyā saukhyena mugdhasya na gato harivāsaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: priyā saukhyena mugdhasya na gataḥ hari vāsaraḥ
translated: The day of Hari has not passed for the innocent one, who is delighted by the happiness of his beloved.

analyzed: saḥ ham tṛptim anuprāptaḥ kāma bhogāt punar punar
translated: I have again and again attained satisfaction from the enjoyment of desires.

analyzed: jñātaḥ yam kārtikaḥ māsaḥ sarva pāpa kṣayaṅkaraḥ
translated: This month of Kartika is known to be the destroyer of all sins.

analyzed: kartu kāmaḥ vratam devi kārtika ākhyam su puṇya dam

original: iyaṃ vārayate māṃ ca vratādbrahmasutā śubhe // / / //
analyzed: iyam vārayate mām ca vratāt brahma sutā śubhe

analyzed: asyāḥ na vipriyam kāryam sarvathā varavarṇini
translated: O woman of the best complexion! Her displeasure should not be caused in any way.

analyzed: māmakam vratam ādhatsva kṛcchra ākhyam kāya śoṣakam
translated: Take up my vow called Krichchhra, which dries up the body.

original: sā caivamuktā navahemavarṇā bhartrā tadā pīnapayodharaṅgī /
analyzed: sā ca evam uktā nava hema varṇā bhartrā tadā pīna payodhar aṅgī
translated: She, who was spoken to like this by her husband, who had a complexion like fresh gold, and whose breasts were full,

original: uvāca vākyaṃ dvijarājakaktrāvrataṃ cariṣye tava tuṣṭihetoḥ // / / //
analyzed: uvāca vākyam dvijarāja kaktrā vratam cariṣye tava tuṣṭi hetoḥ
translated: Spoke these words: I will perform the vow for the sake of pleasing you, O lord of the king of Brahmins.

original: yenaiva kīrtistu yaśo bhavecca tathaiva saukhyaṃ tava kīrtiyuktam /
analyzed: yena eva kīrtiḥ tu yaśaḥ bhavet ca tathā eva saukhyam tava kīrti yuktam

analyzed: karomi saumyam naradeva nātha kṣipāmi deham
translated: I will do what is pleasing, O lord of the king of men. For your sake, I will cast my body into the fire.

original: akāryametannahi bhūmipāla vākyena te hanmi sutaṃ svakīyam /
analyzed: akāryam etat na hi bhūmipāla vākyena te hanmi sutam svakīyam

analyzed: kintu evam etat vrata karma bhūyas karomi saumyam naradeva nātha

analyzed: iti evam uktvā ravi putra śatrum praṇamya tam cāru viśāla netrā
translated: Having spoken thus to the enemy of the son of the sun, the one with beautiful and large eyes,

original: vrataṃ cakārātha tadā hi devī hyaśeṣapāpaughavināśanāya // / / //
analyzed: vratam cakāra atha tadā hi devī hi aśeṣa pāpa ogha vināśanāya

analyzed: vrate pravṛtte varakṛcchra saṃjñe priyā kṛte harṣam avāpa rājā
translated: When the vow called Kṛcchra was undertaken for the sake of his beloved, the king attained joy.

analyzed: uvāca vākyam kuśaketu putrīm kṛtam vacaḥ subhru samīhitam te

analyzed: ramasva kāmam maya sanniviṣṭa saṃpūrṇa vāñchā karabha ūru hṛṣṭā
translated: O you with thighs like an elephant's trunk, be happy as you please, dwelling with me, delighted, with all your desires fulfilled.

analyzed: tyaktvā amarān daitya gaṇān ca sarvān gandharva yakṣa uraga rākṣasān ca
translated: Having seen all the gods, the hosts of demons, the Gandharvas, Yakshas, serpents and Rakshasas,

analyzed: saṃdṛśyamānāt mama nātha hetoḥ sneha anvitā aham tava mandara adrau
translated: I, full of affection, am on Mandara mountain for your sake, O lord.

analyzed: etat kāma phalam loke yat dvayoḥ eka citta tā

analyzed: anya cetaḥ kṛtaḥ kāmaḥ śavayoḥ iva saṃgamaḥ
translated: Love made by another mind is like the union of two corpses.

original: saphalaṃ hi vapurme 'dya saphalaṃ rūpameva hi /
analyzed: sa phalam hi vapuḥ me dya sa phalam rūpam eva hi
translated: Today my body is fruitful, my form is indeed fruitful.

analyzed: tvayā kāmavatā kānta durllabham yat jagattraye
translated: O beloved, endowed with desire, what is difficult to obtain in the three worlds...

original: pronnatābhyāṃ kucābhyāṃ hi kāmino hṛdayaṃ yadi /
analyzed: pronnatābhyām kucābhyām hi kāminaḥ hṛdayam yadi
translated: If the heart of lovers is indeed united with the raised breasts,

analyzed: tat eva ca amṛtam loke yat purandhrī adhara āsavam

analyzed: kucābhyām hṛdi līnābhyām mukhena paripīyate

analyzed: evam uktvā pariṣvajya rājānam rahasi sthitam
translated: Having said this, the slender-bodied one embraced the king who was standing in private,

analyzed: ramayāmāsa tanvaṅgī vātsyāyana vidhānataḥ

analyzed: tasya evam ramamāṇasya mohinyā sahitasya hi
translated: While he was thus enjoying with Mohini,

translated: the sound of a drum reached Rukmin's ears.🔽It was placed on the forehead of an intoxicated elephant, by the order of Dharmaraja,

translated: sleeping on the bare ground, devoid of the company of their beloved ones.

translated: Remember the ancient Purusha, the Lord of the gods, the Supreme Being.🔽You will observe fasts, abstaining from food for a day.

analyzed: a kṛta śrāddha nicayāḥ aprāptāḥ piṇḍam eva ca
translated: You have not performed ancestral rites, have not obtained the funeral cakes,

analyzed: gayām a gata putrāḥ ca gacchadhvam śrī hareḥ padam

analyzed: eṣā kārtika śuklā vai hareḥ nidrā vyapohinī

translated: The sins of brahminicide and others committed out of desire,

analyzed: tāni yāsyanti sarvāṇi upoṣya imām prabodhinīm

analyzed: prabodhayet dharmma parān nyāya ācāra samanvitān

analyzed: hareḥ prabodham ādhatte tena eṣā bodhinī smṛtā
translated: It is said to be Prabodhinī because it brings about the awakening of Hari.

analyzed: sakṛt ca upoṣitām ca imām nidrā cheda karīm hareḥ
translated: If one observes this fast that removes Hari's sleep even once,

analyzed: suhṛdyaiḥ ca phalaiḥ gandhaiḥ yajadhvam śrī hareḥ padam

translated: He who does not do my words today, which are righteous and lead to Vishnu's abode,

analyzed: mohinī kucayoḥ lagnam hṛdayam sa vikṛṣya vai

analyzed: udattiṣṭhat mahīpālaḥ śayyāyām rati varddhanaḥ

analyzed: mohinīm moha kāma ārttām ślakṣṇayā girā
translated: To Mohini, who was afflicted by the passion of love, he spoke with gentle words,

analyzed: devi prātar hari dinam bhaviṣyati adhana aśanam

analyzed: saṃyataḥ ham bhaviṣyāmi kṣamyatām kṣamyatām iti

translated: By your order, I have observed the Krichchhra vow with Sandhyavali.

analyzed: iyam ekādaśī kāryā prabodha karaṇī mayā

analyzed: aśeṣa pāpa bandhasya chedanī gati dāyinī

analyzed: trayāṇām api lokānām mahā utsava vidhāyinī
translated: Which brings about great festivals for all the three worlds,

analyzed: tasmāt haviṣyam bhokṣye ham niyataḥ matta gāminī

analyzed: yena yāsyasi nirvāṇam dāha pralaya varjitam

analyzed: mohinī uvāca
translated: Mohini said:

analyzed: janma mṛtyu jarā chedi kariṣye ham tava ājñayā
translated: I will do it at your command, which destroys birth, death and old age.

analyzed: pratijñā yā tvayā pūrvam kṛtā mandara mastake

analyzed: kara pradāna sahitā bhavatā sukṛta aṅkitā

analyzed: tasyāḥ tu samayaḥ prāptaḥ dīyatām sa hi me tvayā
translated: The time for that has come, give it to me by you.

analyzed: janma prabhṛti yat puṇyam tvayā yatnena saṃcitam
translated: All the merit that you have carefully accumulated since birth,

original: tatsarvaṃ naśyati kṣipraṃ na dadāsi varaṃ yadi /
analyzed: tat sarvam naśyati kṣipram na dadāsi varam yadi
translated: All that will quickly perish if you do not give me the boon.

analyzed: rukmāṅgadaḥ uvāca
translated: Rukmangada said:

analyzed: ehi cāru aṅgi karttāsmi yat te manasi vartate
translated: Come, O you of beautiful limbs, I will do what is in your mind.

analyzed: na ādeyam vidyate kiñcid tubhyam me jīvita avadhi

analyzed: muktāphala mayīm dolām kariṣye tvad kṛte priye

analyzed: vedāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ sarve purāṇeṣu eva sarvadā

analyzed: iti hāsa purāṇaiḥ tu niścayaḥ yam kṛtaḥ purā

analyzed: prāyaścittam tu hatyāyām āturasya auṣadham priye

analyzed: yat vedaiḥ gīyate subhru upāṅgaiḥ yat pragīyate

analyzed: purāṇaiḥ smṛtibhiḥ ca eva vedaḥ eva nigadyate

analyzed: raṭanti iha purāṇāni bhūyas bhūyas varānane

original: ko hi dūṣayate vedaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ ko nipātayet // / / //
analyzed: kaḥ hi dūṣayate vedam brāhmaṇam kaḥ nipātayet
translated: Who would corrupt the Vedas? Who would bring down a Brahmin?

original: ko gacchetparadārān hi ko bhuṅkte harivāsare // / / //
analyzed: kaḥ gacchet para dārān hi kaḥ bhuṅkte harivāsare
translated: Who would go to another's wife? Who eats on Hari's day?

original: nahīdṛśaṃ pāpamihāsti jantorvimūḍhacittasya dine hareḥ priye /
analyzed: nahi īdṛśam pāpam iha asti jantoḥ vimūḍha cittasya dine hareḥ priye
translated: For a person with a deluded mind, there is no sin like this on the day dear to Hari,

analyzed: yad bhojanena ātmanipāta kāriṇā yamasya ciram su locane
translated: By eating which, O beautiful-eyed one, he would fall into Yama's hell for a long time, O Mohini.

analyzed: mohinī uvāca
translated: Mohini said:

analyzed: śīghram ānaya viprān tvam ghūrṇike vedapāragān
translated: O Ghurnika, quickly bring the Brahmins who are masters of the Vedas.

original: yeṣāṃ vākyena yukto 'yaṃ rājā kuryāddhi bhojanam // / / //
analyzed: yeṣām vākyena yuktaḥ yam rājā kuryāt hi bhojanam
translated: By whose words, this king should properly perform the eating.

analyzed: sā tad vākyam upākarṇya brāhmaṇān veda śālinaḥ
translated: Having heard those words, she invited the Brahmins who were well-versed in the Vedas,

analyzed: gautama ādīn samāhūya mohinī pārśvam ānayata
translated: And brought them to Mohini's side.

analyzed: tān viprān āgatān dṛṣṭvā veda vedāṅga pāragān
translated: Seeing those Brahmins who had come, who were masters of the Vedas and Vedangas,

analyzed: mohinī sahitā rājñā vavande kārya tatparā
translated: Mohini, along with the king, worshipped them, being intent on the task.

analyzed: upaviṣṭāḥ tu te sarve śātakaiṃbha mayeṣu ca
translated: All of them sat on golden seats,

analyzed: āsaneṣu mahīpāla jvalat agni sama prabhāḥ
translated: O king, on the seats, shining with the brilliance of blazing fire.

analyzed: teṣām madhye vayaḥ vṛddhaḥ gautamaḥ vākyam abravīt
translated: Among them, Gautama, the oldest in age, spoke these words:

analyzed: vayam samāgatāḥ devi nānā śāstra viśāradāḥ
translated: O Goddess, we have assembled here, skilled in various scriptures.

analyzed: sarva saṃdeha hartāraḥ yad artham te samāhutāḥ
translated: For the sake of which you have invited us, we are the removers of all doubts.

original: tacchatvā vacanaṃ teṣāṃ mohinī brahmaṇaḥ sutā // / / //
analyzed: tat śatvā vacanam teṣām mohinī brahmaṇaḥ sutā
translated: Having heard their words, Mohini, the daughter of Brahma,

analyzed: sarva asādhya kṛtam kartum pravṛttān tān uvāca ha
translated: Addressed them, engaged in doing what was to be done by all.

analyzed: mohinī uvāca
translated: Mohini said:

original: saṃdehastu jaḍau hyeṣa svalpo vā svamatiryathā // / / //
analyzed: saṃdehaḥ tu jaḍau hi eṣa su alpaḥ vā sva matiḥ yathā
translated: This doubt is indeed dull, or my mind is small,

original: so 'yaṃ vadati rājā vai nāhaṃ bhokṣye harerdine /
analyzed: saḥ yam vadati rājā vai na aham bhokṣye hareḥ dine
translated: That this king speaks thus: 'I will not eat on the day of Hari.'

original: annādhāramidaṃ sarvaṃ jagatsthāvarajaṅgamam // / / //🔽mṛtā hyapi tathānnena prīyante pitaro divi /
analyzed: anna ādhāram idam sarvam jagat sthāvara jaṅgamam  mṛtāḥ hi api tathā annena prīyante pitaraḥ divi
translated: This entire world, with its moving and unmoving beings, is supported by food.🔽Even the dead ancestors in heaven are pleased by food.

analyzed: karkandhu mātram prahutam puroḍāśam hi devatāḥ
translated: The gods desire even a sacrificial cake the size of a jujube fruit,

analyzed: kāmayanti dvijaśreṣṭhāḥ tatas nnam hi amṛtam param
translated: Offered by the best of Brahmins. Therefore, food is the supreme nectar.

analyzed: pipīlikā api kṣudhitā mukhena ādāya taṇḍulam
translated: Even an ant, when hungry, takes a grain in its mouth

original: bilaṃ vrajati duḥkhena kasyānnaṃ nahi rocate /
analyzed: bilam vrajati duḥkhena kasya annam nahi rocate
translated: And goes to its hole with difficulty. Whose food is not liked?

analyzed: ayam khādati na annādyam saṃprāpte harivāsare
translated: He who eats food on the day of Hari (i.e. eleventh day of a lunar fortnight) is a sinner.

analyzed: nija dharmam parityajya para dharme vyavasthitaḥ
translated: He who abandons his own duty and is established in the duty of others,

analyzed: vidhāvānām yatīnām ca yujyate vrata sevanam
translated: For ascetics and renunciates, it is proper to observe vows.

analyzed: para dharma rataḥ yaḥ syāt svadharma vimukhaḥ naraḥ
translated: One who delights in the duty of others and turns away from his own duty,

analyzed: tamasi majjeta yāvat indrāḥ caturddaśa
translated: He would be immersed in blind darkness for as long as fourteen Indras.

analyzed: upavāsa ādi karaṇam bhūbhujām nā uditam kvacid
translated: The performance of fasting etc. is not prescribed anywhere for kings.
Abandoning the protection of the people, which grants the fruits of the four goals of life,

analyzed: nārīṇām bhartṛ śūśrūṣā putrāṇām pitṛ sevanam
translated: Service to the husband for women, service to the father for sons,

analyzed: śūdrāṇām dvija sevā ca loka rakṣā mahībhṛtām
translated: Service to the twice-born for Shudras, and the protection of the world for kings.

original: svakaṃ karma parityajya yo 'nyatra kurute śramam /
analyzed: svakam karma parityajya yaḥ nyatra kurute śramam
translated: One who abandons his own duty and exerts himself in something else,

original: ajñānādvā pramādācca patitaḥ sa na saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ajñānāt vā pramādāt ca patitaḥ sa na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Whether out of ignorance or carelessness, he is undoubtedly fallen.

analyzed: saḥ yam adya mahīpālaḥ yati dharmme vyavasthitaḥ
translated: This king is now established in the duty of an ascetic,

analyzed: su buddhi ācāra śīlaḥ ca veda uktam tyajati dvijāḥ
translated: And with good understanding and conduct, he abandons what is stated in the Vedas, O Brahmins.

original: svecchācārā tu yā nārī yo 'vinītaḥ suto dvijāḥ /
analyzed: svecchā ācārā tu yā nārī yaḥ vinītaḥ sutaḥ dvijāḥ
translated: A woman who acts as she pleases, an ill-behaved son, O Brahmins,

analyzed: ekānta śīlaḥ nṛpatiḥ bhṛtyaḥ karma vivarjitaḥ
translated: A king who is devoted to one thing, a servant who is devoid of work,

original: sarve te narakaṃ yānti hyapratiṣṭhaśca yo dvijāḥ /
analyzed: sarve te narakam yānti hi apratiṣṭhaḥ ca yaḥ dvijāḥ
translated: All of them go to hell, O Brahmins, as well as one who is not established.

analyzed: ayam hi niyama upetaḥ hari pūjana tatparaḥ
translated: This one, who is endowed with self-control and is devoted to the worship of Hari,

original: ākrande varttamāne tu na yadyeṣa pradhāvati /
analyzed: ākrande varttamāne tu na yadi eṣa pradhāvati
translated: If he does not run when there is a cry,

original: vyapohya haripūjāṃ vai brahmahatyāṃ tu vindati // / / //
analyzed: vyapohya hari pūjām vai brahma hatyām tu vindati
translated: Having abandoned the worship of Hari, he incurs the sin of killing a Brahmin.

original: kṣīṇadehe haridine kathaṃ saṃyamayiṣyati /🔽annātprabhavati prāṇaḥ prāṇāddehaviceṣṭanam // / / //
analyzed: kṣīṇa dehe hari dine katham saṃyamayiṣyati  annāt prabhavati prāṇaḥ prāṇāt deha viceṣṭanam
translated: When the body is exhausted, how will he control himself on the day of Hari?🔽Life arises from food, and the movement of the body arises from life.

analyzed: ceṣṭayā ripu nāśaḥ ca tad hīnaḥ paribhūyate
translated: By movement, there is the destruction of enemies. He who is devoid of that is despised.

original: evaṃ jñātvā mayā rājā bodhyamāno na buddhyati // / / //
analyzed: evam jñātvā mayā rājā bodhyamānaḥ na buddhi ati
translated: Knowing this, I am trying to awaken the king, but he does not understand.

analyzed: etat eva vratam rājñaḥ yat prajā pālanam caret
translated: This alone is the vow of a king that he should protect his subjects.

analyzed: na vratam kiñcid asti anyat nṛpasya dvijasattamāḥ
translated: There is no other vow for a king, O best of Brahmins.

original: kiṃ deva kāryeṇa narādhipasya kṛtvā hi manyuṃ viṣayasthitānām /
analyzed: kim deva kāryeṇa narādhipasya kṛtvā hi manyum viṣaya sthitānām
translated: What is the purpose of a king? Having caused anger among those who dwell in the realm,

original: taddevakāryaṃ sa ca yajñahomo yadraktapāto na bhavet svarāṣṭre // / / //
analyzed: tat deva kāryam sa ca yajña homaḥ yat rakta pātaḥ na bhavet sva rāṣṭre
translated: That is the purpose of the king, and that is the sacrifice and oblation, that there be no shedding of blood in his own kingdom.

analyzed: iti śrī bṛhat nāradīyapurāṇa uttara bhāge mohinīpraśnaḥ nāma caturviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-fourth chapter in the Uttara-khanda of the Srimad-Bhagavata-Mahatmya, in which the questions of Mohini are described.

analyzed: vasiṣṭhaḥ uvāca
translated: Vasishtha said:

analyzed: tat vākyam brāhmaṇāḥ śrutvā mohinyā samudīritam
translated: Having heard those words spoken by Mohini, the Brahmanas

analyzed: tathyam iti evam uktvā tu rājānam vākyam abruvan
translated: said to the king, It is true.

analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The Brahmanas said:

original: yastvayā nṛpate puṇyaḥ kṛto 'yaṃ śapathaḥ kila /
analyzed: yaḥ tvayā nṛpate puṇyaḥ kṛtaḥ yam śapathaḥ kila
translated: O king, this vow of yours, which is indeed meritorious,

analyzed: ekādaśyām na bhoktavyam pakṣayoḥ ubhayoḥ api
translated: that one should not eat on the eleventh day of both fortnights,

original: na kṛtaḥ śāstradṛṣṭyā tu svabuddhyaiva prakalpitaḥ /🔽sāgrīnāṃ prāśanaṃ proktamubhayoḥ saṃdhyayoḥ kila // / / //
analyzed: na kṛtaḥ śāstra dṛṣṭyā tu sva buddhyā eva prakalpitaḥ  sa agrīnām prāśanam proktam ubhayoḥ saṃdhyayoḥ kila
translated: has not been seen in the scriptures, but has been devised by your own intellect.🔽It is said that the eating of raw meat is permitted at both twilights.

analyzed: homa ucchiṣṭa prabhoktāraḥ trayaḥ varṇāḥ prakīrtitāḥ
translated: The three varnas are declared to be the eaters of the remnants of the oblations.

analyzed: viśeṣāt bhūmipālānām katham yuktam upoṣaṇam
translated: How is fasting proper, especially for the lords of the earth?

analyzed: sarvadā udyata śastrāṇām duṣṭa saṃyaminām vibho
translated: O lord, for those who are always ready with weapons to restrain the wicked,

analyzed: śāstrataḥ śāstrataḥ vā api yaḥ tvayā śapathaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: whether the vow has been taken according to the scriptures or not,

analyzed: paripūrṇaḥ bhavati adya vākyena hi dvijanmanām
translated: it becomes complete today by the words of the twice-born.

analyzed: vrata bhaṅgaḥ na te sti iha bhukṣvam vipra samanvitaḥ
translated: You have not broken your vow. Eat with the Brahmins.

original: paritāpo na te kāryo vipravākyaṃ mahattaram /
analyzed: paritāpaḥ na te kāryaḥ vipra vākyam mahattaram
translated: You should not be tormented, the words of the Brahmins are very important.

analyzed: yaḥ nyathā manyate vākyam viprāṇām nṛpa sattama
translated: O best of kings, he who thinks otherwise about the words of the Brahmins,

original: sa yāti rākṣasīṃ yoniṃ janmāni daśa pañca ca /
analyzed: sa yāti rākṣasīm yonim janmāni daśa pañca ca
translated: he goes to the state of a Rakshasa for fifteen lives.

analyzed: tat śrutvā vacanam rodram rājā kopa samanvitaḥ
translated: Having heard those terrible words, the king, filled with anger,

analyzed: uvāca sphuramāṇa oṣṭaḥ tān viprān ślakṣṇayā girā
translated: spoke with trembling lips to those Brahmins in a soft voice.

analyzed: sarveṣām eva bhūtānām bhavantaḥ mārga darśinaḥ
translated: You are the guides for all beings.

original: yatīnāṃ vidhavānāṃ ca śloko 'yaṃ paṭhyate dvijāḥ /
analyzed: yatīnām vidhavānām ca ślokaḥ yam paṭhyate dvijāḥ
translated: O Brahmins, this verse is recited for ascetics and widows:

analyzed: vimārga gāminām ca etat matam na sātvatām kvacid
translated: This view is not at all accepted by the followers of Vishnu for those who go astray.

analyzed: yat bhavadbhiḥ samuddiṣṭam rājñām na upoṣaṇam smṛtam
translated: What has been declared by you that fasting is not remembered for kings,

original: tatra vākyāni śṛṇuta vaiṣṇavā cāralakṣaṇe // / / //🔽na śaṅkhena pibettoyaṃ na hanyātkūrmasūkarau /
analyzed: tatra vākyāni śṛṇuta vaiṣṇavāḥ cāra lakṣaṇe  na śaṅkhena pibet toyam na hanyāt kūrma sūkarau
translated: listen to those statements there regarding the characteristics of Vishnu's devotees:🔽One should not drink water with a conch, should not kill a tortoise or pig,

analyzed: ekā daśyām na bhoktavyam pakṣayoḥ ubhayoḥ api
translated: should not eat on the Ekadashi day in both fortnights.

original: na pātavyaṃ hi madya tu na hantavyo dvijaḥ kvacit /
analyzed: na pātavyam hi tu na hantavyaḥ dvijaḥ kvacid
translated: One should not drink liquor, nor should one ever kill a Brahmin.

analyzed: krīḍet na akṣaiḥ tu dharma jñaḥ na aśnīyāt harivāsare
translated: One who knows dharma should not play with dice, nor should one eat on the day of Hari (i.e. Ekadashi).

analyzed: a bhakṣya bhakṣaṇam pāpam paradāra abhimarśanam
translated: Eating forbidden food, touching another's wife,

analyzed: ekādaśyām bhojanam ca patanasya eva kāraṇam
translated: and eating on Ekadashi are the causes of downfall.

analyzed: akārya karaṇam kṛtvā kim jīvet śaradām śatam
translated: Having done what should not be done, what is the use of living for a hundred autumns?

analyzed: kaḥ hi saṃceṣṭamānaḥ tu bhunakti harivāsare
translated: For who, even if moving, enjoys on the day of Hari?

analyzed: catuṣpadebhyaḥ janaiḥ nā annam deyam hareḥ dine
translated: Even food should not be given to animals on the day of Hari by people residing in the northern direction,

analyzed: uttara āśā sthitaiḥ vipraiḥ viṣṇu dharma parāyaṇaiḥ
translated: by Brahmins devoted to the religion of Vishnu.

original: so 'haṃ kathaṃ karomyadya abhakṣyasya tu bhakṣaṇam /
analyzed: saḥ ham katham karomi adya abhakṣyasya tu bhakṣaṇam
translated: How can I now eat what is forbidden?

analyzed: na upakṣīṇa śarīraḥ ham na āmayāvī dvijottamāḥ
translated: My body is not emaciated, I am not a vegetarian, O best of Brahmins.

original: sa kathaṃ hi vrataṃ tyakṣe vimārgasthadvijoktitaḥ /
analyzed: sa katham hi vratam tyakṣe vimārga stha dvijoktitaḥ
translated: How can I abandon the vow due to the words of a Brahmin who is on a wrong path?

analyzed: dharmabhūṣaṇa saṃjñena rakṣyamāṇe dharā tale
translated: When the earth is being protected by one named Dharmabhusana.

original: na ca rakṣāvihīno 'haṃ śatruḥ ko 'pina me 'sti ca /
analyzed: na ca rakṣā vihīnaḥ ham śatruḥ me sti ca
translated: And I am not without protection, nor do I have any enemy.

analyzed: evam jñātvā dvijaśreṣṭhāḥ vaiṣṇava vrata śālinaḥ
translated: Knowing this, O best of Brahmins, endowed with the vow of Vishnu,

analyzed: bhavadbhiḥ nā ucitam vaktum pratikūlam vrata apaham
translated: It is not proper for you to speak against it, which destroys the vow.

analyzed: a saṃparīkṣya ye dadyuḥ prāyaścittam dvijātayaḥ
translated: Those Brahmins who would give expiation without proper examination,

original: teṣāmeva hi tatpāpaṃ smṛtivaikalyasambhavam /🔽devo vā dānavo vāpi gandharvo rākṣaso 'pi vā // / / //
analyzed: teṣām eva hi tat pāpam smṛti vaikalya sambhavam  devaḥ vā dānavaḥ vā api gandharvaḥ vā
translated: For them only that sin is possible due to lack of knowledge of the scriptures.

original: siddho vā brāhmaṇo vāpi pitāsmākaṃ svayaṃ vadet /
analyzed: siddhaḥ vā brāhmaṇaḥ vā api pitā asmākam svayam vadet
translated: Whether a god, a demon, a gandharva, a rakshasa, or a siddha, or a Brahmin, may my own father tell me,

analyzed: vā
translated: Or Hari, or Hara, or the creator of Mohini,

analyzed: dinakṛt lokapālaḥ vā naḥ bhokṣye harivāsare
translated: Or the sun, or the guardian of the world, I will not eat on Hari's day.

original: yo hi rukmāṅgado rājā vikhyāto bhūtale dvijāḥ // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ hi rukmāṅgadaḥ rājā vikhyātaḥ bhū tale dvijāḥ
translated: O Brahmins, that king Rukmangada, who is well-known on earth,

original: satyapratijñāṃ viphalāṃ na kadācitkaroti hi /🔽dyupateḥ kṣīyate tejo himavānparivarttate // / / //
analyzed: satya pratijñām viphalām na kadācid karoti hi  dyupateḥ kṣīyate tejaḥ himavān parivarttate
translated: Never makes his true promise futile.🔽The sun's luster diminishes, the Himalayas change,

original: jaladhiḥ śoṣamāyāti pāvakaścoṣṇatāṃ tyajet /🔽tathāpi na tyaje viprā vratamekādaśīdine // / / //
analyzed: jaladhiḥ śoṣam āyāti pāvakaḥ ca uṣṇa tām tyajet  tathā api na tyaje viprāḥ vratam ekādaśī dine
translated: The ocean dries up, and fire abandons its heat.🔽Still, O Brahmins, I will not abandon the vow on the eleventh day.

original: prasiddhireṣā bhuvanatraye 'pi āraṭyate me paṭahena viprāḥ /
analyzed: prasiddhiḥ eṣā bhuvanatraye āraṭyate me paṭahena viprāḥ
translated: This is well-known in the three worlds, O Brahmins, I proclaim with my drum,

original: grāmeṣu deśeṣu pareṣu vāpi ye bhuñjate rukmavibhūṣaṇasya // / / //
analyzed: grāmeṣu deśeṣu pareṣu vā api ye bhuñjate rukma vibhūṣaṇasya
translated: Those who eat in villages, countries, or foreign lands, of the one adorned with gold.

original: daṇḍyāśca vadhyāśca saputrakāste na cāpi vāso viṣaye hi teṣām /
analyzed: daṇḍyāḥ ca vadhyāḥ ca sa putrakāḥ te na ca api vāsaḥ viṣaye hi teṣām
translated: They and their sons should be punished and killed, and they should not live in his kingdom.

analyzed: hareḥ dine sarva makha pradhāne pāpa apahe dharma vivarddhane ca
translated: On the day of Hari, the foremost of all sacrifices, which removes sins and increases righteousness,

analyzed: mokṣa prade janma nikṛntana ākhye tejaḥ nidhau sarva jana prarūḍhe
translated: Which grants liberation and is known as the cutter of rebirth, the abode of brilliance, and well-known to all people,

original: eṃvavidhe prodgata eva śabde yadyasmi bhoktā vṛjinasya karttā // / / //
analyzed: eṃvavidhe prodgate eva śabde yadi asmi bhoktā vṛjinasya karttā
translated: If I, who am the enjoyer and the doer of evil, were to speak in such a way,

original: amedhyaliptaḥ paṭaho bhavettadā saṃchādito nīlamayena vāsasā /
analyzed: amedhya liptaḥ paṭahaḥ bhavet tadā saṃchāditaḥ nīla mayena vāsasā
translated: Then I would be smeared with impurity, covered with a blue garment.

original: utpādya kīrtiṃ svayameva jaturnikṛntati prāṇabhayācca pāpāt // / / //
analyzed: utpādya kīrtim svayam eva jatuḥ nikṛntati prāṇa bhayāt ca pāpāt
translated: Having produced fame, the fire burns the evil from fear of life.

original: yastasya vāso niraye yugānāṃ ṣaṣṭirbhavedvā krimidaṃśasaṃjñe /
analyzed: yaḥ tasya vāsaḥ niraye yugānām ṣaṣṭiḥ bhavet vā krimidaṃśa saṃjñe
translated: He who wears his garment in hell for sixty yugas, known as the worm and mosquito,

original: vṛthā hi sūtā mama sā janitrī bhavennirāśā dvijapitṛdevāḥ // / / //
analyzed: vṛthā hi sūtā mama sā janitrī bhavet nirāśāḥ dvija pitṛ devāḥ
translated: My mother would be in vain, and the Brahmins, ancestors and gods would be disappointed.

original: vaivasvato harṣamupāśrayecca salekhako me vratabhaṅga eva /🔽kiṃ tena jātena durātmanā hi dadāti harṣaṃ ripusuṃdarīṇām // / / //
analyzed: vaivasvataḥ harṣam upāśrayet ca sa lekhakaḥ me vrata bhaṅge eva  kim tena jātena durātmanā hi dadāti harṣam ripu suṃdarīṇām
translated: Yama would rejoice, and my vow would be broken by the scribe.🔽What is the use of such a wicked son being born, who gives joy to the wives of enemies?

original: kukarmaṇā pāparatiḥ kujātiḥ sarvasya nāśī tvaśucissa mūḍhaḥ /
analyzed: ku karmaṇā pāpa ratiḥ ku jātiḥ sarvasya nāśī tu aśuciḥ sa mūḍhaḥ
translated: He is of bad deeds, delights in sin, of low birth, destroys everything, is impure and foolish.

original: na manyate vedapurāṇaśāstrānante purīṃ yāti dineśasūnoḥ // / / //
analyzed: na manyate veda purāṇa śāstra anante purīm yāti dineśa sūnoḥ
translated: And does not consider the Vedas, Puranas and Shastras, he goes to the city of the Sun's son (Yama) on the day of death.

analyzed: kṛtvā eva vāntim punar atti tām yaḥ tadvat pratijñā vrata bhaṅga kārī
translated: Similarly, one who breaks the vow of his promise, eats again what he has vomited.

original: vedā na śāstraṃ na ca tatpurāṇaṃ na cāpi santaḥ smṛtayo na ca syuḥ // / / //
analyzed: vedāḥ na śāstram na ca tat purāṇam na ca api santaḥ smṛtayaḥ na ca syuḥ
translated: If the Vedas, Shastras, Puranas, and the wise are not remembered,

original: ye mādhavasya priyakṛtyayogye vadanti śuddhe 'hni bhujikriyāṃ tu /
analyzed: ye mādhavasya priya kṛtya yogye vadanti śuddhe hni bhuji kriyām tu
translated: Those who say that the ritual of eating should be done on a pure day, which is suitable for doing what is dear to Madhava,

original: śrāddhena tenāpi na cāsti tṛptiḥ pituśca cīrṇena harerdine tu // / / //
analyzed: śrāddhena tena api na ca asti tṛptiḥ pituḥ ca cīrṇena hareḥ dine tu
translated: Even by that Shraddha, there is no satisfaction to the father, if it is performed on the day of Hari (Vishnu).

original: vratena yadviṣṇupadapradena sākaṃ kṣayāhena vadantu mūḍhāḥ // / / //
analyzed: vratena yat viṣṇu pada pradena sākam kṣaya ahena vadantu mūḍhāḥ
translated: The fools say that the vow which grants Vishnu's feet, along with the day of destruction (Kshaya), is the same.

analyzed: etat śrutvā tu tad vākyam mohinī jvalita antarā
translated: Hearing these words, Mohini was inflamed within.

analyzed: kopa saṃrakta nayanā bhartāram paryabhāṣat
translated: With eyes red with anger, she spoke to her husband.

original: karoṣi cenna me vākyaṃ dharmabāhyo bhaviṣyasi /
analyzed: karoṣi ced na me vākyam dharma bāhyaḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: If you do not do as I say, you will be outside the bounds of dharma.

original: dharmabāhyo hi puruṣaḥ pāṃśunā tulyatāṃ vrajet // / / //
analyzed: dharma bāhyaḥ hi puruṣaḥ pāṃśunā tulya tām vrajet
translated: A man outside the bounds of dharma becomes equal to dust.

original: pāṃśunā pūryate gartaḥ sa gartakhanako bhavet /
analyzed: pāṃśunā pūryate gartaḥ sa garta khanakaḥ bhavet
translated: A pit is filled with dust, and he who digs the pit becomes its digger.

analyzed: tvayā mama arpitaḥ pāṇiḥ varāya pṛthivīpate
translated: O lord of the earth, you have offered me your hand in marriage.

original: tāmullaṅghya pratijñāṃ svāṃ pālayiṣyāsi no yadi /
analyzed: tām ullaṅghya pratijñām svām pālayiṣyāsi naḥ yadi
translated: If you do not keep your promise after transgressing it,

original: kṛtakṛtyā tadā yāsye prāpto dharmo mayā tava // / / //
analyzed: kṛtakṛtyā tadā yāsye prāptaḥ dharmaḥ mayā tava
translated: then I will have fulfilled my duty and attained your dharma.

original: na cāhaṃ te priyā bhāryā na ca tvaṃ me patirnṛpa /
analyzed: na ca aham te priyā bhāryā na ca tvam me patiḥ nṛpa
translated: I am not your beloved wife, nor are you my husband, O king.

original: upadhānaṃ kariṣyāmi svakaṃ bāhuṃ na te yudhi // / / //
analyzed: upadhānam kariṣyāmi svakam bāhum na te yudhi
translated: I will not place my head on your lap in battle.

analyzed: dhik tvām dharma kṣaya karam sva vacaḥ lopa kārakam
translated: Shame on you, the destroyer of dharma, the breaker of your own words.

analyzed: mleccheṣu api na dṛśyeta tvādṛśaḥ dharma lopakaḥ
translated: Even among barbarians, one who violates dharma like you is not seen.

analyzed: satyāt calita madya tvām parityakṣye su pāpinam
translated: I will abandon you, the great sinner, who has strayed from truth today.

analyzed: evam uktvā varārohā hi udatiṣṭhat tvarā anvitā
translated: Having said this, the beautiful one quickly got up.

analyzed: yathā satī haram tyaktvā divya ābharaṇa bhūṣitā
translated: Just as Sati left Shiva, adorned with divine ornaments,

original: prasthitā sā tadā tanvī bhūsuraiśca samanvitā // / / //🔽varaṃ madyasya saṃsparśo nāsya saṃgo nṛpasya vai /
analyzed: prasthitā sā tadā tanvī bhūsuraiḥ ca samanvitā  varam madyasya saṃsparśaḥ na asya saṃgaḥ nṛpasya vai
translated: the slender one, accompanied by the sages, set out then.🔽Better to touch wine than to associate with this king.

analyzed: varam nīla aṃbara sparśaḥ na asya dharma cyutasya hi
translated: Better to touch blue garments than to touch this one fallen from dharma.

original: evaṃ hi mohinī ruṣṭā pralapantī tadā bhṛśam /
analyzed: evam hi mohinī ruṣṭā pralapantī tadā bhṛśam
translated: Thus, Mohini, greatly enraged, was lamenting.

analyzed: gautama ādi samāyuktā nirjagāma gṛhāt brahis
translated: Along with Gautama and others, she left the house.

analyzed: hā tāta hā jagannātha sṛṣṭi sthitti anta kāraka
translated: Oh father! Oh Lord of the universe! Creator, preserver and destroyer of the world!

analyzed: iti eva śabdam krośantī
translated: Thus crying out, she, born from Brahma's mind,

original: etasminneva kāle tu vājirājaṃ samāsthitaḥ /🔽aṭitvā sakalāmurvīṃ saṃprāpto dharmabhūṣaṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: etasmin eva kāle tu vāji rājam samāsthitaḥ  aṭitvā sakalām urvīm saṃprāptaḥ dharmabhūṣaṇaḥ
translated: At that very moment, mounted on the king of horses,🔽Having wandered over the entire earth, Dharmabhushana arrived.

analyzed: saṃmukhaḥ bhūt jananyāḥ tu tvarā yuktaḥ vimatsaraḥ
translated: He faced his mother, free from jealousy and full of speed.

analyzed: karṇābhyām tasya sau viśrutaḥ pitṛ vatsalaḥ
translated: The sound from her ears was heard by him, devoted to his father.
Born from the mouth of Mohini, and nourished by the words of the Brahmanas,

analyzed: dharmāṅgadaḥ dharmamūrtiḥ rukmāgada sutaḥ tadā
translated: Dharmagupta, the embodiment of Dharma, the son of Rukmagada,

analyzed: avaruhya hayāt tūrṇam yayau tāta pada antike
translated: Quickly dismounted from the horse and went near his father.

analyzed: punar utthāya vipra indrān nanāma vihita añjaliḥ
translated: Rising again, he bowed to the best of Brahmanas with folded hands.

analyzed: tatas śīghragatim dṛṣṭvā mohinīm ruṣṭa mānasām
translated: Then, seeing Mohini angry and quick-paced,

original: ālakṣya tarasā mātaḥ prāha rājan kṛtāñjaliḥ // / / //
analyzed: ālakṣya tarasā mātar prāha rājan kṛtāñjaliḥ
translated: The son, seeing his mother angry, spoke with folded hands, O king.

original: kenāvamānitā devi kathaṃ ruṣṭā pituḥ priye /
analyzed: kena avamānitā devi katham ruṣṭā pituḥ priye
translated: By whom are you insulted, O Goddess? How are you angry, O beloved of your father?

analyzed: etaiḥ dvijendraiḥ sahitā kva tvam saṃprasthitā adhunā
translated: With these best of Brahmanas, where are you going now?

analyzed: dharmāṅgada vacaḥ śrutvā mohinī vākyam abravīt
translated: Having heard the words of Dharmagupta, Mohini spoke these words:

original: pitā tavānṛtī putra karo yena vṛthā kṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pitā tava anṛtī putra karaḥ yena vṛthā kṛtaḥ
translated: O son, your father has become false, by whom a vow was made in vain.

original: yaḥ karttā sukṛtaṃ bhūri raktāśokākṛtiḥ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ karttā sukṛtam bhūri rakta aśoka ākṛtiḥ sthitaḥ
translated: He who is the doer of much good deeds, stands in the form of a red Asoka tree.

analyzed: dhvaja aṅkuśa aṅkitaḥ śrīmān dakṣiṇaḥ kanaka aṅgadaḥ
translated: He is marked with a flag and goad, is prosperous, right-handed, and has golden bracelets.

original: rukmāṅgadena te pitrā na cāhaṃ vastumutsahe // / / //
analyzed: rukmāṅgadena te pitrā na ca aham vastum utsahe
translated: I do not desire to stay with your father Rukmangada.

analyzed: dharmāṅgadaḥ uvāca
translated: Dharmagupta said:

original: yadvavīṣi vaco devi tatkarttāhaṃ na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: yat vavīṣi vacaḥ devi tat karttā aham na saṃśayaḥ
translated: O Goddess, I will undoubtedly do what you say.

original: mā kopaṃ kuru mātastvaṃ nivarttatasva pituḥ priye // / / //
analyzed: mā kopam kuru mātar tvam pituḥ priye
translated: O Mother, do not be angry, turn back to your father's love.

analyzed: mohinī uvāca
translated: Mohini said:

analyzed: anena samayena aham tvad pitrā mandara acale
translated: By this agreement, I was made the wife of your father on Mandara mountain.

original: kṛtā bhāryā śivaḥ sākṣye sthito yatra surādhipaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kṛtā bhāryā śivaḥ sākṣye sthitaḥ yatra surādhipaḥ
translated: Shiva was the witness there, where the lord of gods stood.

analyzed: samayāt sa cyutaḥ samyak pitā te rukma bhūpaṇaḥ
translated: Your father Rukmabhupala has truly fallen from that agreement.

original: na prayacchati me deyaṃ tasya vṛddhiṃ vicintaye // / / //
analyzed: na prayacchati me deyam tasya vṛddhim vicintaye
translated: He does not give me what is to be given, I am thinking of his prosperity.

original: na yāce kāñcanaṃ dhānyaṃ hastyaśvaṃ grāmavāsasī /
analyzed: na yāce kāñcanam dhānyam hasti aśvam grāma vāsasī
translated: I do not beg for gold, grain, elephants, horses, or villages.

analyzed: yena tasya bhavet hāniḥ na yāce tat nṛpa ātmaja
translated: By which there would be loss for him, I do not beg that, O prince.

analyzed: yena asau prīṇayet deham svakīyam dehinām vara
translated: O best of embodied beings, by which he can please his own body.

original: tanmayā prārthitaṃ putra sa mohānna prayacchati // / / //
analyzed: tat mayā prārthitam putra sa mohāt na prayacchati
translated: O son, that has been requested by me, but out of delusion he does not give it.

analyzed: tasya eva ca upakārāya śarīrasya nṛpa ātmaja
translated: For the very benefit of that body, O prince,

analyzed: yācitaḥ sukha hetoḥ tu mayā nṛpati sattamaḥ
translated: the best of kings has been requested by me for the sake of happiness.

analyzed: sthitaḥ saḥ ghore surā pāna same vibhuḥ
translated: He, the lord, remains today in terrible untruth, equal to drinking liquor.

original: satyacyutaṃ niṣṭhuravākyabhāṣiṇaṃ vimuktadharmaṃ tvanṛtaṃ śaṭhaṃ ca /
analyzed: satya cyutam niṣṭhura vākya bhāṣiṇam vimukta dharmam tu anṛtam śaṭham ca
translated: I will abandon my father, who speaks harsh words, who has fallen from truth, who is devoid of dharma, who is false and deceitful.

original: parityajeyaṃ janakaṃ tavādhamaṃ naiva sthitirme bhavitā hi tena // / / //
analyzed: parityajeyam janakam tava adhamam nā eva sthitiḥ me bhavitā hi tena
translated: I will not remain with that lowest of men.

analyzed: tat śrutvā mohinī vākyam putraḥ dharmāṅgadaḥ bravīt
translated: Hearing Mohini's words, son Dharmagupta said:

original: mayi jīvati tāto me na bhavedanṛtī kvacit // / / //
analyzed: mayi jīvati tātaḥ me na bhavet anṛtī kvacid
translated: As long as I live, my father will never be false in any way.

analyzed: nivartasva varārohe kariṣye ham tava īpsitam
translated: Return, O beautiful one, I will do what you desire.

original: pitrā me nānṛtaṃ devi pūrvamuktaṃ kadācana // / / //
analyzed: pitrā me nā anṛtam devi pūrvam uktam kadācana
translated: O goddess, my father has never spoken a falsehood before.

original: sa kathaṃ mayi jāte tu vadiṣyati mahīpatiḥ /
analyzed: sa katham mayi jāte tu vadiṣyati mahīpatiḥ
translated: How will that lord of the earth speak when I am born?

analyzed: yasya satye sthitāḥ lokāḥ sa deva asura mānuṣāḥ
translated: By whose truth the worlds with gods, demons and humans abide.

original: vaivasvatagṛhaṃ yena kṛtaṃ śūnyaṃ hi pāpibhiḥ /
analyzed: vaivasvata gṛham yena kṛtam śūnyam hi pāpibhiḥ
translated: By whom the abode of Yama has been emptied of sinners,

analyzed: vijṛṃbhate yasya kīrtiḥ vyāptam brahmāṇḍa maṇḍalam
translated: Whose fame spreads and pervades the entire universe,

analyzed: sa katham jāyate bhūpaḥ mithyā vacana saṃsthitaḥ
translated: How can such a king be born, abiding by false words?

analyzed: aśrutam bhūpateḥ vākyam parokṣe śraddadhe katham
translated: How can one believe the words of a king heard in secret, without evidence?

analyzed: mama upari dayām kṛtvā nivartasva śubha ānane
translated: Having mercy on me, O fair-faced one, return.

analyzed: etat dharmāṅgadena uktam vākyam ākarṇya mohinī
translated: Having heard these words spoken by Dharmagupta, Mohini,

analyzed: nyavartata mahīpāla putra skandha avalaṃbinī
translated: Descended from the shoulders of the king's son and turned back.

analyzed: yatra rukma aṅgadaḥ śete mṛta kalpaḥ ravi prabhaḥ
translated: Where Rukmin, resembling the sun in radiance, lay as if dead,

original: tasminniveśayāmāsa śayane kāñcanānvite /🔽dīparatnaiḥ suprakāśe vidrumaiścitrite vare // / / //
analyzed: tasmin niveśayāmāsa śayane kāñcana anvite  dīpa ratnaiḥ su prakāśe vidrumaiḥ citrite vare
translated: She placed him on a bed adorned with gold,🔽Well-lit with gem-lamps, and beautifully decorated with corals,

analyzed: ākhaṇḍala astra maṇibhiḥ kṛta pāde su komale
translated: With soft feet made of Akhandala gems,

analyzed: dīrgha vistāra saṃyukte hi anaupamye manohare
translated: Long and wide, incomparable, and charming.

analyzed: tatas kṛtāñjaliḥ prāha pitaram ślakṣṇayā girā
translated: Then, with folded hands, she spoke to her father in soft words:

original: tātaiṣā jananī me 'dya tvāṃ vadatyanṛtī tviti // / / //
analyzed: tāta eṣā jananī me dya tvām vadati anṛtī tu iti
translated: Father, this is my mother, who tells you that you have spoken falsely.

analyzed: kasmāt tvam anṛtī bhūpa bhaviṣyasi mahī tale
translated: O king, why will you be false to your word on the earth?

analyzed: sa koṣa ratna nicaye gaja aśva ratha saṃyute
translated: With its treasure of jewels, its wealth of elephants, horses and chariots,

analyzed: rājye praśāsyamāne tu sapta udadhi samanvite
translated: When the kingdom, with its seven oceans, is being ruled,

original: pradehi sakalaṃ hyasyai yattyā śrāvitaṃ vibho // / / //
analyzed: pradehi sakalam hi asyai yattyā śrāvitam vibho
translated: Give everything to her, O lord, as promised.

original: mayi cāpadhare tāta ko vyalīkaṃ carettava /
analyzed: mayi cāpa dhare tāta kaḥ vyalīkam caret tava
translated: And, O father, who will do you wrong when I am the wielder of weapons?

original: dehi śakrapadaṃ devyai jitaṃ viddhi purandaram // / / //
analyzed: dehi śakra padam devyai jitam viddhi purandaram
translated: Give the position of Shakra to the goddess. Know that Purandara (Indra) is conquered.

analyzed: vairiñcyam durllabham yat ca yogi gamyam nirañjanam
translated: And that which is difficult to obtain even by Brahmā, which is untouched by the yogins,

analyzed: tat ca api aham pradāsyāmi tapasā toṣya padmajam
translated: I will also give that by propitiating the lotus-born one with austerities.

original: samīhate yajjananī madīyā rasātale vāpi dharātale vā /
analyzed: samīhate yat jananī madīyā rasātale vā api dharā tale vā
translated: Whatever my mother desires, whether on the surface of the earth or in the nether world,

original: triviṣṭape vāpi pare pade vā dāsyāmi jitvā naradevadānavān // / / //
analyzed: triviṣṭape vā api pare pade vā dāsyāmi jitvā naradeva dānavān
translated: In heaven or in the highest position, I will give by conquering the gods and demons.

original: ahaṃ hi dāsastava bhūpa yasmādvikrīyatāṃ māmathavā tṛṇāya /
analyzed: aham hi dāsaḥ tava bhūpa yasmāt vikrīyatām mām athavā tṛṇāya
translated: O king, since I am your slave, sell me or treat me like straw.

original: haste hi pāpasya divāprakīrtervatsyāmi tatkarmakaraḥ subhuktaḥ // / / //
analyzed: haste hi pāpasya divā aprakīrteḥ vatsyāmi tad karma karaḥ su bhuktaḥ
translated: In the hand of sin, proclaimed in the day, I will remain, well-fed, doing that work.

analyzed: yat duṣkaram bhūmipate trilokyām na ādeyam asti iha tad iṣṭaṃbhāvāt
translated: O lord of the earth, whatever is difficult to be done in the three worlds, that which is not to be given here, is desired by me.

original: taccāpi rājendra dadasva devyai majjīvitaṃ majjananībhavaṃ vā // / / //
analyzed: tat ca api rāja indra dadasva devyai mad jīvitam mad jananī bhavam vā
translated: And that also, O king of kings, give to the goddess, or my life, or what is born of my mother.

original: tenaiva sadyo nṛpanātha loke satkīrtiyukto bhava sarvadaiva /
analyzed: tena eva sadyas nṛpa nātha loke sat kīrti yuktaḥ bhava sarvadā eva
translated: By that alone, O lord of men, in this world, be always endowed with good fame,

analyzed: virājayitvā sva guṇaiḥ nṛpa oghān karaiḥ iva ātma prabhavaiḥ kha śobhaiḥ
translated: Having illuminated the multitude of kings with your own qualities, like the sky with its own rays.

original: kīrtiprabhaṅge vṛjinaṃ bhaviṣyati prajāvadhe yanmanurāha satyam /
analyzed: kīrti prabhaṅge vṛjinam bhaviṣyati prajā vadhe yat manuḥ āha satyam
translated: In the destruction of fame, there will be sin, as Manu truly said about the killing of subjects.

original: saṃmārjayitvā vimalaṃ yaśaḥ svaṃ kathaṃ sukhī syāṃ nṛpate tataḥ kṣamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: saṃmārjayitvā vimalam yaśaḥ svam katham sukhī syām nṛpate tatas kṣamaḥ
translated: Having cleansed your own pure fame, how can you be happy, O king, then you are capable.

analyzed: iti śrī bṛhat nāradīyapurāṇa uttara bhāge mohinīcarite pañcaviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-fifth chapter in the Uttaratapa of Sri Brihan-Narada-Purana, describing the deeds of Mohini.

analyzed: rājā uvāca
translated: The king said:

original: kīrtirnaśyatu me putra hyanṛtī vā bhavāmyaham /
analyzed: kīrtiḥ naśyatu me putra hi anṛtī vā bhavāmi aham
translated: Let my fame perish, O son, or let me become false to my promise.

original: gato vā narakaṃ ghoraṃ kathaṃ bhokṣye harerdine // / / //
analyzed: gataḥ vā narakam ghoram katham bhokṣye hareḥ dine
translated: Or having gone to terrible hell, how shall I enjoy on the day of Hari?

original: brahmaṇo nilayaṃ yātu devīyaṃ mohinī suta /
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ nilayam yātu devī iyam mohinī suta
translated: Let this goddess Mohini go to the abode of Brahma, O son.

original: bhūyo bhūyo vadati māṃ durmedhāśca subāliśā // / / //
analyzed: bhūyas bhūyas vadati mām durmedhāḥ ca su bāliśā
translated: Again and again she speaks to me, being of evil intellect and very foolish.

original: nāparaṃ kāmaye rājyaṃ vasudhāṃ vasu kiñcana /
analyzed: na aparam kāmaye rājyam vasudhām vasu kiñcana
translated: I do not desire any other kingdom, or the earth, or any wealth.

analyzed: muktvā evam vāsare viṣṇoḥ bhojanam pāpa nāśane
translated: Having thus spoken, one should refrain from eating on the day of Vishnu, which destroys sins.

analyzed: yadi aham kutsitām yonim vrajeyam krimi saṃjñitām
translated: Even if I were to go to a despicable birth known as an insect,

analyzed: tathā api nā eva kartāham bhojanam harivāsare
translated: I would still not eat on the day of Hari.

analyzed: eṣā gurutarā bhūtvā lokānām śikṣayā anvitā
translated: This (cow) has become very heavy, endowed with the instruction of the people.

original: dundubhī kurvatī nādaṃ sā kathaṃ vitathā bhavet // / / //
analyzed: dundubhī kurvatī nādam sā katham vitathā bhavet
translated: How can she, who is making a sound like a drum, be false?

analyzed: abhakṣya bhakṣaṇam kṛtvā agamyā gamanam tathā
translated: Having eaten what should not be eaten, having had intercourse with what should not be approached,

original: apeyaṃ caiva pītvā tu kiṃ jīveccharadaḥ śatam // / / //
analyzed: apeyam ca eva pītvā tu kim jīvet śaradaḥ śatam
translated: and having drunk what should not be drunk, can one live for a hundred autumns?

analyzed: asatyam vā api kṛtvā aham tyakta rājya nayaḥ kṣitau
translated: Having told a lie, having abandoned the duties of a king on earth,

analyzed: dhikkṛtaḥ janaiḥ sarvaiḥ na bhokṣye hari vāsare
translated: even if I am censured by all the people, I will not eat on the day of Hari.

analyzed: viyoge capala apāṅgyāḥ yadi ced maraṇam mama
translated: If I were to die due to separation from the fickle-eyed one,

analyzed: tat ca api varam evā atra na bhokṣye harivāsare
translated: that too would be better for me here; I will not eat on the day of Hari.

analyzed: katham harṣam aham kartā mārtaṇḍa tanayasya vai
translated: How can I rejoice in the son of Martanda,

analyzed: vrajadbhiḥ manujaiḥ mārge nirayasya ati duḥkhitaiḥ

analyzed: pṛcchāmi pati kāmā aham rākṣasī hṛcchaya āturā

analyzed: uvāca vacanam prājñaḥ dhairyam ālaṃbya tām śubhe
