original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā khaṅgahastaṃ tu pitaraṃ dharmmaṃbhūṣaṇaḥ // / / //🔽praṇamya mātāpitarau devaṃ cakradharaṃ tathā /
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā khaṅga hastam tu pitaram dharmmaṃbhūṣaṇaḥ  praṇamya mātā pitarau devam cakradharam tathā
translated: Seeing his father with a sword in his hand, Dharmam-bhusana (Dharma-adorned one),🔽bowed to his parents and also to the god Chakra-dhara (the wielder of the discus, i.e. Vishnu).

analyzed: vadanam prekṣya ca adīnam jananyāḥ nṛpa puṅgavaḥ
translated: Seeing the distressed face of his mother, the best of kings (Dharmagupta),

analyzed: vṛṣāṅgadena tu tadā sva grīvā ūrvī tale kṛtā
translated: was made by Vrisha-Angada (Dharmagupta) on his own neck and on the ground.

analyzed: kaṃbu grīvām samānām tu suvarṇā su komalām
translated: The neck, which was like a conch, even, golden, and very tender,

analyzed: bahu rekham atha sthūlām khaṅga mārge
translated: he showed the path of the sword, which was thick and had many lines.

analyzed: pitṛ bhaktyā yutena eva mātṛ bhaktyā adhikena vai
translated: By him who was endowed with devotion to his father and with even greater devotion to his mother,

original: grīvāpradāne tanayasya bhūpa harṣākule cārusudhāṃśuvaktre /🔽gṛhītakhaṅge jagadīśanāthe cacāla pṛthvīṃ sanagā samagrā // / / //
analyzed: grīvā pradāne tanayasya bhūpa harṣa ākule cāru sudhāṃśu vaktre  gṛhīta khaṅge jagadīśa nāthe cacāla pṛthvīm sa nagā samagrā
translated: when the son offered his neck, on the face of the king, which was beautiful like the moon and full of joy,🔽when the lord of the lord of the world (Vishnu) took up the sword, the entire earth with its mountains trembled.

original: siṃdhuḥ pravṛddhaśca babhūva sadyo nimajja nārthaṃ bhuvanatrayasya /
analyzed: siṃdhuḥ pravṛddhaḥ ca babhūva sadyas nimajja na artham bhuvanatrayasya
translated: The ocean immediately became swollen, for the submergence of the three worlds.

analyzed: nipetuḥ ulkāḥ śataśas dharāyām nirghāta yuktāḥ sa taḍit kha madhyāt
translated: Meteors fell by hundreds on the earth, accompanied by thunder, from the midst of the sky with lightning.

original: vivarṇarūpā ca babhūva mohinī na devakāryaṃ hi kṛtaṃ mayeti /
analyzed: vivarṇa rūpā ca babhūva mohinī na deva kāryam hi kṛtam mayā iti
translated: And Mohini became pale in color, thinking, I have not accomplished the work of the gods.

original: nirarthakaṃ janma mamādhunābhūtkṛtaṃ tu daivena dajagadvidhāyinā // / / //
analyzed: nirarthakam janma mama adhunā abhūt kṛtam tu daivena
translated: My birth has now become meaningless. But it was done by fate, the creator of the world.

original: vimohanaṃ rūpamidaṃ viḍaṃbanaṃ yadbhūmipālena na bhuktamannam /
analyzed: vimohanam rūpam idam viḍaṃbanam yat bhūmipālena na bhuktam annam
translated: This form of delusion and mockery, that food was not eaten by the king,

original: harerdine pāpabhayāpahe tu tṛṇaiḥ samāhaṃ bhavitā triviṣṭape // / / //
analyzed: hareḥ dine pāpa bhaya apahe tu tṛṇaiḥ samā aham bhavitā triviṣṭape
translated: On the day of Hari, the remover of the fear of sin, I will be like grass in heaven.

original: satvādhiko yāsyati mokṣamārgaṃ gantāsmi pāpa narakaṃ sudāruṇam // / / //
analyzed: satva adhikaḥ yāsyati mokṣa mārgam gantāsmi pāpa narakam su dāruṇam
translated: One with superior goodness will go on the path of liberation, I will go to a very terrible hell, O sin.

analyzed: samudyate tadā khaṅge nṛpeṇa nṛpa puṅgava
translated: When the sword was raised by the king, the best of kings,

analyzed: mohinī moha saṃyuktā papāta dharaṇī tale
translated: Mohini, full of delusion, fell down on the ground.

analyzed: rājā api tena khaṅgena bhrājamānaḥ samudyataḥ
translated: The king, shining with that sword, was ready

analyzed: grīvāyāḥ chedana arthāya vṛṣāṅgada sutasya tu
translated: to cut off the neck of Vrisha Angada's son.

original: sakuṇḍalaṃ cāru śaśiprakāśaṃ bhrājiṣṇu vaktraṃ tanayasya bhūpaḥ /
analyzed: sa kuṇḍalam cāru śaśi prakāśam bhrājiṣṇu vaktram tanayasya bhūpaḥ
translated: The king, with earrings, a beautiful moon-like face, shining, of his son,

analyzed: pracicchide yāvat atīva harṣāt dhairya anvitaḥ rukma vibhūṣaṇaḥ sau
translated: And was about to cut it off with great joy, while endowed with patience, adorned with gold,

analyzed: tāvat gṛhītaḥ sva kareṇa bhūpaḥ kṣīrābdhi kanyāpatinā mahīpaḥ
translated: Just then the king was seized by the hand by the lord of the daughter of the milk ocean.

original: tuṣṭo 'smi tuṣṭo 'smi na saṃśayo 'tra gacchasva lokaṃ mama lokanātha // / / //
analyzed: tuṣṭaḥ smi tuṣṭaḥ smi na gacchasva lokam mama loka nātha
translated: I am pleased, I am pleased, there is no doubt here, go to my world, O Lord of the world.

analyzed: priya anvitaḥ ca ātmaja saṃyutaḥ ca kīrtim samādhāya mahī tale tu
translated: And being accompanied by his beloved and his son, having established his fame on earth,

original: trailokyapūjyāṃ vimalāṃ ca śuklāṃ kṛtvā padaṃ mūrdhni yamasya bhūpa // / / //
analyzed: trailokya pūjyām vimalām ca śuklām kṛtvā padam mūrdhni yamasya bhūpa
translated: And having made his pure and white fame, worshipped in the three worlds, on the head of Yama, O king,

original: prayāhi vāsaṃ mama dehasaṃjñaṃ sa cakriṇo bhūmipatiḥ kareṇa /
analyzed: prayāhi vāsam mama deha saṃjñam sa cakriṇaḥ bhūmipatiḥ kareṇa
translated: Go to my abode, known as my body, and the lord of the earth, the discus-holder, with his hand,

analyzed: saṃspṛṣṭa mātraḥ virajāḥ babhūva priyā sametaḥ tanayena yuktaḥ
translated: As soon as he was touched, he became free from impurities, accompanied by his beloved and his son.

original: upetya vegena jagāma dehaṃ devasya divyaṃ sa nṛpo mahātmā /🔽vihāya lakṣmīmavanīprasūtāṃ vihāya dāsīḥsudhanaṃ sa kośam // / / //
analyzed: upetya vegena jagāma deham devasya divyam sa nṛpaḥ mahātmā  vihāya lakṣmīm avanī prasūtām vihāya dāsīḥ su dhanam sa kośam
translated: The great king approached with speed and went to the divine body of the god.🔽Abandoning the wealth born from the earth, abandoning the maidservants, the good wealth, the treasury,

analyzed: vihāya nāgān turagān rathān ca sva dāra vargam sva jana ādikān ca
translated: Abandoning the elephants, horses, chariots, his own wife and children, and his own people and others,

original: jagāma dehaṃ madhusūdanasya tatoṃ'barātpuṣpacayaḥ papāta // / / //🔽saṃhṛṣṭasiddhaiḥ suralokapālaiḥ saṃtāḍitā dundubhayo vineduḥ /🔽rājan jagurgītamatīva ramyaṃ devāṅganāḥ saṃnanṛturmudānvitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: jagāma deham madhusūdanasya tatas uṃbarāt puṣpa cayaḥ papāta  saṃhṛṣṭa siddhaiḥ sura lokapālaiḥ saṃtāḍitāḥ dundubhayaḥ vineduḥ  rājan jaguḥ gītam atīva ramyam deva aṅganāḥ saṃnanṛtuḥ mudā anvitāḥ
translated: And a shower of flowers fell from the sky.🔽The delighted Siddhas and the guardians of the world of gods beat the drums and they sounded.🔽O king, the celestial women sang extremely beautiful songs and danced with joy.

analyzed: gandharva kanyāḥ nṛpa karma tuṣṭāḥ tat adbhutam prekṣya dineśa sūnuḥ
translated: The daughters of the Gandharvas, pleased with the deeds of the king, having seen that wonder, the son of the sun god,

original: harestanau bhūmipatiṃ praviṣṭaṃ sadāraputraṃ svalipiṃ pramārjya // / / //
analyzed: hareḥ tanau bhūmipatim praviṣṭam sa dāra putram sva lipim pramārjya
translated: Having erased his own record, with the king and his wife and son entered into the body of Madhusudana,

analyzed: lokān ca sarvān nṛpa diṣṭa mārge kṛtvā kṛtajñān hari loka mārgān
translated: And having made all the people follow the path indicated by the king, and having made them know the path to Hari's world,

original: bhītaḥ punaḥ prāpya pitāmahāntikaṃ provāca devaṃ caturānanaṃ rudan // / / //
analyzed: bhītaḥ punar prāpya pitāmaha antikam provāca devam caturānanam rudan
translated: Frightened, he again reached the vicinity of the grandfather and wept, speaking to the four-faced god:

original: nāhaṃ niyogī bhavitā hi deva ājñāvihīnaḥ suralokanātha /
analyzed: na aham niyogī bhavitā hi devaḥ ājñā vihīnaḥ sura loka nātha
translated: O god, I will not be your agent, O lord of the world of gods, without your command.

original: vidhehi cānyatprakaromi tāta nideśanaṃ māstu madīya daṇḍam // / / //
analyzed: vidhehi ca anyat prakaromi tāta nideśanam mā astu daṇḍam
translated: Do something else, O father, let there be no punishment from me.

original: iti śrībṛhannāradīyapurāṇottarabhāge mohinīcarite sutavadhodyatasya rukmāṅgadasya bhagavaddarśanaṃ nāma catustriṃśattamo 'dhyāyaḥ🔽yama uvāca
analyzed: iti śrī bṛhat nāradīya purāṇa uttara bhāge mohinīcarite suta vadha udyatasya rukmāṅgadasya bhagavaddarśanam nāma catustriṃśattamaḥ dhyāyaḥ  yamaḥ uvāca
translated: Thus ends the Thirty-fourth Chapter in the Vamana Purana—34🔽Yama said:🔽

original: vibudheśa jagannātha carācaraguro prabho /🔽mohinī niṣphalā jātā vandhyā strī janane yathā // / / //🔽rukmāṅgadapraṇītena mārgeṇa kuśalāñchana /🔽lokaḥ prayāti vaikuṃṇṭhaṃ na māṃ kaścitprapadyate // / / //🔽gate 'pi bhūminātheśe dehaṃ devasya cakriṇaḥ /🔽tathāpi sarvabhūtānāṃ na buddhiḥ parivartate // / / //🔽upoṣya vāsaraṃ viṣṇorākumārāttu mānavāḥ /🔽prayānti paramaṃ lokaṃ luptapāpāḥ pitāmaha // / / //🔽putrī te vrīḍitā devī mohinī mohamāgatā /🔽nāyāti tava sāmīpyaṃ na bhuṅkte lokagarhitā // / / //🔽nirvyāpārastvahaṃ jātaḥ kiṃ karomi praśādhi mām /
analyzed: vibudha īśa jagannātha carācara guro prabho 🔽mohinī niṣphalā jātā vandhyā strī janane yathā 🔽rukma aṅgada praṇītena mārgeṇa kuśa lāñchana 🔽lokaḥ prayāti vaikuṃṇṭham na mām kaścid prapadyate 🔽gate pi bhūminātha īśe deham devasya cakriṇaḥ 🔽tathā api sarva bhūtānām na buddhiḥ parivartate 🔽upoṣya vāsaram viṣṇoḥ ā kumārāt tu mānavāḥ 🔽prayānti paramam lokam lupta pāpāḥ pitāmaha 🔽putrī te vrīḍitā devī mohinī moham āgatā 🔽na āyāti tava sāmīpyam na bhuṅkte loka garhitā 🔽nirvyāpāraḥ tu aham jātaḥ kim karomi praśādhi mām
translated: Thus ends the Thirty-fourth Chapter, in the Uttar-khanda of the Brhat-Purana, called Brahma-Vaivarta.

analyzed: ravi putra vacaḥ śrutvā provāca kamalāsanaḥ
translated: Having heard the words of the Sun's son, the Lotus-seated One said:

analyzed: gacchāmaḥ sahitāḥ sarve mohinīm pratibodhitum
translated: All of us together should go to awaken Mohini.

analyzed: mohinyām pratibuddhāyām kariṣyāmaḥ divākare
translated: When Mohini is awakened, we will perform the rites for the Sun.

analyzed: tava kāryam na saṃdehaḥ saṃbhramaḥ tyajyatām ayam
translated: There is no doubt about accomplishing your task. Let this confusion be abandoned.

analyzed: tatas deva gaṇāḥ sarve śatakratu purogamāḥ
translated: Then all the groups of gods, led by Indra,

analyzed: brahmaṇā sahitāḥ pṛthvīm vimānaiḥ sūrya saprabhaiḥ
translated: along with Brahma, came to the earth in celestial vehicles shining like the sun,

analyzed: samāyātāḥ mahīpāla nārīm tām pratibodhitum
translated: O king, to awaken that woman.

analyzed: te vimānaiḥ samantāt tu parivārya śubha ānanām
translated: They surrounded the beautiful-faced one on all sides with the vehicles.

analyzed: tejaḥ hīnām nirānandām śuṣka toyām nadīm iva
translated: She was devoid of radiance, joyless, like a river with dried-up water,

original: śaśihīnāṃ niśāṃ bhūpa ṛtvigghīnāṃ kriyāmiva /🔽parājito yathā martyaḥ pralmānakusumaṃ yathā // / / //
analyzed: śaśi hīnām niśām bhūpaḥ ṛtvij hīnām kriyām iva  parājitaḥ yathā martyaḥ pralmāna kusumam yathā
translated: like the night without the moon, O king, like a rite without the officiating priests,🔽like a defeated man, like a withered flower,

original: nivṛttotsavavedīva vidrumaṃ dhavalaṃ yathā /🔽gataśālistu kedāro niṣpra yathā // / / //🔽maṇḍa vā gatodvā yathā saraḥ /
analyzed: nivṛtta utsava vedī iva vidrumam dhavalam yathā  gataśāliḥ tu kedāraḥ yathā  maṇḍa vā gata ud vā yathā saraḥ
translated: like a sacrificial altar from which the festivities have ceased, like coral turned white,🔽like a field without harvested rice, like a pond without lotuses,

analyzed: manthānam navanīte vai uddhṛte dharaṇī pate
translated: like a churning rod after butter has been churned out, O lord of the earth,

original: asaṃskṛtā yathā vāṇī marditā ca yathā camūm /
analyzed: asaṃskṛtā yathā vāṇī marditā ca yathā camūm
translated: Like an unsung song, a defeated army,

original: hata nāthāṃ tu yuvatīṃ dhānyahīnāṃ prajāṃ yathā // / / //🔽mantrahīnavidhiṃ yuddhaṃ dharmaṃ ca dayayā vinā /
analyzed: hata nāthām tu yuvatīm dhānya hīnām prajām yathā  mantra hīna vidhim yuddham dharmam ca dayayā vinā
translated: A widowed woman, a crop-less land,🔽A ritual without mantras, a battle without dharma, a king without compassion,

original: pṛthvīṃ bhūpālahīnā vā mantrahī yathā nṛpa // / / //
analyzed: pṛthvīm bhūpāla hīnā vā mantra hī yathā nṛpa
translated: A kingdom without a king, a sacrifice without mantras,

analyzed: dhana dhānya vihīnam vā gṛham nṛpa vara uttama
translated: A house without wealth and grain, O best of kings,

original: jalahīnaṃ yathā kuṃbhaṃ paṅkasthaṃ gopatiṃ yathā // / / //
analyzed: jala hīnam yathā kuṃbham paṅka stham gopatim yathā
translated: Like a pot without water, a bull stuck in mud,

original: gṛhasthaṃ bhāryayā hīnaṃ rāṣṭrabhraṣṭaṃ ca bhūpatim /🔽bhagnakriyaṃ yathā vaidyaṃ bhagnaśākhaṃ yathā drumam // / / //🔽tejohīnaṃ yathāgāraṃ nirjalaṃ vā ghanaṃ yathā /
analyzed: gṛhastham bhāryayā hīnam rāṣṭra bhraṣṭam ca bhūpatim  bhagna kriyam yathā vaidyam bhagna śākham yathā drumam  tejaḥ hīnam yathā āgāram nirjalam vā ghanam yathā
translated: A householder without a wife, a king fallen from his kingdom,🔽Like a doctor whose treatment fails, a tree with broken branches,🔽A house without splendor, a cloud without water,

analyzed: vidhūmaḥ iva saptārciḥ viraśmiḥ iva bhāskaraḥ
translated: Like a fire without smoke, the sun without rays,

original: matibhraṣṭo yathā martyaḥ parvasaṃgī yathā naraḥ /
analyzed: mati bhraṣṭaḥ yathā martyaḥ parva saṃgī yathā naraḥ
translated: Like a man devoid of intelligence, a man without festive gatherings,

analyzed: atṛptaḥ kāntayā kāntaḥ pannagaḥ ca viṣa ujjhitaḥ
translated: A lover unsatisfied with his beloved, a snake devoid of venom,

original: lūnapakṣo yathā pakṣī vṛttihīno yathā dvijaḥ /
analyzed: lūna pakṣaḥ yathā pakṣī vṛtti hīnaḥ yathā dvijaḥ
translated: Like a bird with clipped wings, a Brahmin without means of livelihood,

analyzed: śiraḥ bhraṣṭā yathā mālā parvataḥ dhātu varjitaḥ
translated: Like a garland fallen from the head, like a mountain devoid of minerals,

analyzed: prabhraṣṭa lipi śāstram vā ṛk yajuḥ visvaram yathā
translated: Like a treatise with lost letters, like the Rig and Yajur Vedas with wrong tones,

original: svarahīnaṃ yathā sāma padmahīnaṃ yathā saraḥ // / / //
analyzed: svara hīnam yathā sāma padma hīnam yathā saraḥ
translated: Like a Saman devoid of tones, like a lake devoid of lotuses,

original: yathā mārgaṃ tṛṇai ruddhaṃ padmaṃ patravivarjitam /
analyzed: yathā mārgam tṛṇaiḥ ruddham padmam patra vivarjitam
translated: Like a path obstructed by grass, like a lotus devoid of petals,

analyzed: jñānam mamatva saṃyuktam pumāṃsam prakṛtim vinā
translated: Knowledge associated with possessiveness, a person without Prakriti,

analyzed: sāṃkhyāni tattva hīnāni dharmam daṃbha anvitam yathā
translated: Like Sankhya doctrines devoid of truth, like Dharma associated with hypocrisy,

analyzed: tejaḥ hīnām tathā apaśyan mohinīm te divaukasaḥ
translated: So the dwellers of heaven saw Mohini, devoid of radiance,

analyzed: dhyāyamānām nirutsāhām dṛśyamānām janaiḥ prabho
translated: Meditating, dispirited, being seen by people, O lord,

analyzed: ākrośa vacanaiḥ krūraiḥ putra hatyā samanvitām
translated: With harsh words of reproach, accompanied by the murder of a son,

analyzed: duḥśīlām dharma saṃtyaktām tad vākya parimoṣitām
translated: Immoral, abandoned by Dharma, deceived by her words,

analyzed: sva vākya pālanām caṇḍām ucuḥ devāḥ samāgatāḥ
translated: And adhering to her own words, the assembled gods said to Chandama,

original: māṃ śokaṃ kuru vāmoru pauruṣaṃ hi tvayā kṛtam /
analyzed: mām śokam kuru vāma ūru pauruṣam hi tvayā kṛtam
translated: O beautiful-thighed one, make me sorrowful, for you have shown manliness.

analyzed: nahi mādhava bhaktānām vidyate māna khaṇḍanam
translated: For those who are devotees of Madhava, there is no lack of respect.

analyzed: sā tvam hariṇaśāvākṣi deva kārya artham āgatā
translated: You, O deer-eyed one, have come here for the sake of the gods' work,

analyzed: tat na siddham varārohe sa prayātaḥ dhunā abhavam
translated: O beautiful lady, that is not accomplished. He has now gone to you.

analyzed: vighna vidhvaṃsinīm pūrvam kṛtā rukmāṅgadena hi
translated: In the past, Rukmāṅgada had created the destroyer of obstacles.

analyzed: ekādaśī mahā puṇyā mohinī mādhave site
translated: On the bright fortnight of Mādhava, Ekādaśī is greatly meritorious, Mohinī.

analyzed: saṃvatsaram viśāla akṣi kṛcchra pāda prapūjitā
translated: For a year, O large-eyed one, worshipped with the quarter of Kṛcchra,

analyzed: tasya evā adhyuṣṭiḥ atulā yat satyā ācat calitaḥ na hi
translated: His prosperity is incomparable, as he has not deviated from the truth.

original: vighnarājñī tu vai nārī lokeṣu parigīyate /
analyzed: vighna rājñī tu vai nārī lokeṣu parigīyate
translated: The queen of obstacles is sung about in the worlds.

analyzed: karmaṇā manasā vācā putra vyāpādane matim
translated: Having made up her mind to kill her son in thought, word, and deed,

original: kṛtvā coddhṛtya khaṅgaṃ ca tyaktvā snehaṃ sudūrurataḥ /
analyzed: kṛtvā ca uddhṛtya khaṅgam ca tyaktvā sneham
translated: Having drawn out a sword and cast off affection far away,

analyzed: tādṛśam nikaṣam prokṣya bhagavān madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Having tested such a person, the Lord Madhusūdana,

original: haniṣyati priyaṃ putraṃ na bhuṅkte harivāsare /
analyzed: haniṣyati priyam putram na bhuṅkte harivāsare
translated: Will kill his beloved son, who does not eat on Hari's day.

original: putrasya ca priyāyāśca bhāvaṃ prekṣya nṛpasya ca // / / //
analyzed: putrasya ca priyāyāḥ ca bhāvam prekṣya nṛpasya ca
translated: Seeing the state of the son, the beloved, and the king,

analyzed: viṣṇunā paretuṣṭena nītāḥ sva bhavane trayaḥ
translated: By Viṣṇu, greatly pleased, the three were taken to his abode.

analyzed: sa dehāḥ kṣīṇa karmāṇaḥ hi aṅgāraḥ gniḥ iva āhitaḥ
translated: With bodies, their deeds exhausted, like a fire without fuel.

original: phalaṃ karmaṇi cārabdhe yadi devī na siddhyati /
analyzed: phalam karmaṇi ca ārabdhe yadi devī na siddhi ati
translated: If the goddess is not accomplished when the deed is begun,

analyzed: sarva yatnena subhage doṣaḥ kaḥ tra tava adhunā
translated: What is your fault now, O beautiful one, with all your efforts?

original: etasmād varadāḥ sarve saṃprāptā vibudhāḥ śubhe /
analyzed: etasmāt vara dāḥ sarve saṃprāptāḥ vibudhāḥ śubhe
translated: From this, O auspicious one, all the boon-giving gods have come.

original: siddhau vāpyatha vāsiddhau karmakṛtsyāddṛthā na hi // / / //
analyzed: siddhau vā api atha vā asiddhau karma kṛt syāt dṛthā na hi
translated: Whether successful or not, the performer of the rite is not in vain.

analyzed: bhartavyaḥ bhṛtya vargaḥ ca bhūbhujā dharmam icchatā
translated: The group of servants should be supported by the king who desires dharma.

original: sadbhāve ghaṭamānasya yadi karma na siddhyati // / / //
analyzed: sadbhāve ghaṭamānasya yadi karma na siddhyati
translated: If the work of one who is striving with good intentions does not succeed,

original: deyaṃ vetanamātraṃ tu na ca tuṣṭiphalaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: deyam vetana mātram tu na ca tuṣṭi phalam bhavet
translated: only the wages should be given, and there will be no fruit of satisfaction.

original: yo na tasmai prayaccheta jīvanaṃ jīvanāya vai // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ na tasmai prayaccheta jīvanam jīvanāya vai
translated: He who does not give life to one who lives for life,

original: govadhaṃ samavāpnoti sa naro nātra saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: go vadham samavāpnoti sa naraḥ na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: that man undoubtedly incurs the sin of killing a cow.

analyzed: tasmāt deyam varārohe abhīṣṭam vara sundari
translated: Therefore, O beautiful one, O most excellent of beautiful women, the desired thing should be given.

analyzed: sadbhāvena kṛte samyak vighnam kāryam divaukasām
translated: When done with good intentions, obstacles should be created by the dwellers of heaven.

original: kiṃ na kurvanti vibudhās tvayā saha varānane // / / //
analyzed: kim na kurvanti vibudhāḥ tvayā saha varānane
translated: O beautiful one, why do not the gods do it with you?

original: dvādaśyās tejasā bhagnā yām āhur vighranāśinīm /
analyzed: dvādaśyāḥ tejasā bhagnā yām āhuḥ vighra nāśinīm
translated: They call her the destroyer of obstacles, who is broken by the brilliance of Dvādaśī.

original: vibudhair evam uktā tu mohinī lokamohinī // / / //
analyzed: vibudhaiḥ evam uktā tu mohinī loka mohinī
translated: Thus addressed by the gods, Mohinī, the enchantress of the world,

analyzed: uvāca sā nirānandā pati hīnā ati duḥkhitā
translated: spoke, unhappy, widowed, and extremely sorrowful.

original: dhigidaṃ jīvitaṃ mahyaṃ yena kāryaṃ na sādhitam // / / //
analyzed: dhik idam jīvitam mahyam yena kāryam na sādhitam
translated: Fie on this life of mine, by which the task has not been accomplished.

analyzed: na kṛtaḥ jana saṃbādhaḥ yama mārgaḥ mara adhipāḥ
translated: O Lords of the Immortals, the path of Yama has not been crowded by people.

original: na tu luptaṃ haridinaṃ na bhuktaṃ harivāsare // / / //
analyzed: na tu luptam hari dinam na bhuktam harivāsare
translated: The day of Hari has not been missed, nor has it been spent in eating on Hari's day.

original: bhūbhujā tena vīreṇa kṛtaḥ putravadho mudā /
analyzed: bhūbhujā tena vīreṇa kṛtaḥ putra vadhaḥ mudā
translated: By that heroic king, the killing of his son was joyfully done.

original: gato mūrdhni padaṃ datvā mama rukmāṅgado harim // / / //🔽aprameyaguṇaṃ viṣṇuṃ nirmalaṃ nirmalāśrayam /
analyzed: gataḥ mūrdhni padam da tvā mama rukma aṅgadaḥ harim  aprameya guṇam viṣṇum nirmalam nirmala āśrayam
translated: Having placed his foot on my head, Rukmin's son went to Hari.🔽Vishnu of immeasurable qualities, pure, the abode of purity,

analyzed: haṃsam śucipadam vyoma praṇavam bījam avyayam
translated: The swan, the pure-footed one, the sky, the syllable Om, the imperishable seed.

analyzed: nirākāram nirābhāsam niṣprapañcam nirañjanam
translated: Formless, without appearance, free from conceptual elaboration, stainless,

analyzed: śūnyam viyat svarūpam ca dhyeya dhyāna vivarjitam
translated: Empty, of the nature of space, devoid of meditation and the object of meditation.

original: asti nāstīti yaṃ prāhurna dūre nāpi cāntike /
analyzed: asti na asti iti yam prāhuḥ na dūre na api ca antike
translated: They say that he exists and does not exist, neither far away nor near,

analyzed: param dhāma manaḥ grāhyam puruṣa ākhyam jagat mayam
translated: The supreme abode, to be grasped by the mind, called the Purusha, full of the universe.

analyzed: hṛd paṅkaja samāsīnam tejaḥ rūpam sanātanam
translated: Seated in the lotus of the heart, of the form of light, eternal,

original: tasmiṃl layam anuprāpte kiṃ nu me jīvite phalam // / / //
analyzed: tasmin layam anuprāpte kim nu me jīvite phalam
translated: When he has attained absorption in that, what is the purpose of my life?

original: asādhite tu yaḥ kārye naro gṛhṇāti vetanam /
analyzed: asādhite tu yaḥ kārye naraḥ gṛhṇāti vetanam
translated: But a man who takes wages for a task not accomplished,

original: svāminaṃ tu parityajya prayāti narakaṃ dhruvam // / / //
analyzed: svāminam tu parityajya prayāti narakam dhruvam
translated: But abandoning the master, he certainly goes to hell.

original: na sādhayanti ye kāryaṃ svāmināṃ tu divaukasaḥ /
analyzed: na sādhayanti ye kāryam svāminām tu divaukasaḥ
translated: Those who do not accomplish the tasks of their masters, the gods,

analyzed: bhṛtyāḥ vetana bhoktāraḥ jāyante bhū tale hayāḥ
translated: the servants who enjoy wages are born on earth as horses.

analyzed: asādhinī iyam kāryasya bhartṛ putra vināśinī
translated: This is an unaccomplishable task, destructive of the master and son.

original: kathaṃ varaṃ tu gṛhṇāmi bhavatāṃ nākavāsinām // / / //
analyzed: katham varam tu gṛhṇāmi bhavatām nāka vāsinām
translated: How can I accept the boon of you dwellers of heaven?

original: devā ūcuḥ🔽brūhi mohini dāsyāmi yatte hṛdi samīhitam /
analyzed: devāḥ ūcuḥ  brūhi mohini dāsyāmi yat te hṛdi samīhitam
translated: The gods said:🔽Speak, O Mohini, I will give you what is desired in your heart.

analyzed: anṛṇāḥ tu bhaviṣyāmaḥ kṛtvā ca upakṛtim tava
translated: By doing you a favor, we will be free from debt.

analyzed: pariśramaḥ kṛtaḥ devi tvayā rāja prayojane
translated: O Goddess, you have made an effort for the king's purpose.

original: tasya tvaṃ phalabhāgdevi tādṛśārthe kṛtasya tu // / / //
analyzed: tasya tvam phala bhāj devi tādṛśa arthe kṛtasya tu
translated: You are entitled to a share of the fruit of that task, O Goddess.

analyzed: evam uccaramāṇānām devatānām mahīpate
translated: Thus spoke the deities, O lord of the earth.

analyzed: nṛpateḥ ājagāma atha purodhāḥ pāvaka prabhaḥ
translated: Then the priest of the king, radiant like fire, came before the king.

analyzed: uṣitaḥ jala madhye tu prāṇāyāma rataḥ muniḥ
translated: The sage, engaged in breath control, dwelt in the water.

analyzed: dvādaśa abde tatas pūrṇe nirgataḥ jala madhyataḥ
translated: After twelve years had passed, he emerged from the water.

analyzed: nirgatena śrutam tena mohinī ceṣṭitam nṛpa
translated: Having emerged, O king, he heard about Mohini's actions.

analyzed: sa krodhaḥ muni śārdūlaḥ deva vṛndam upāgataḥ
translated: The enraged tiger among sages approached the assembly of gods.

analyzed: uvāca vibudhān sarvān mohinī vara dāyinaḥ
translated: He spoke to all the gods who had granted the boon of Mohini:

analyzed: dhik imām dhik deva saṃgham karma dhik pāpa saṃjñitam
translated: Shame on this, shame on the assembly of gods, shame on the act called sin,

analyzed: bhavatām bhāva nāśāya puruṣa arthe prarohakam
translated: Which is for the destruction of your existence and the growth of human goals.

original: bhavanto yacca dātāro mohinyā vāñchitaṃ varam // / / //
analyzed: bhavantaḥ yat ca dātāraḥ mohinyāḥ vāñchitam varam
translated: You who are the givers of the desired boon to Mohini,

analyzed: hatyā yutā bhartṛ suta upaghātinī vihina vṛttiḥ ca
translated: Which is full of ten thousand murders, harmful to husband and son, of bad conduct, and of the form of death,

original: nāsmā hi loke bhavatīha śuddhiḥ samiddhavahnau patane 'pi devāḥ // / / //
analyzed: na asmai hi loke bhavati iha śuddhiḥ samiddha vahnau patane devāḥ
translated: There is no purification for her in this world, O gods, even if she falls into the well-kindled fire.

analyzed: hatyā ayutam bhartṛ vadhaḥ nirarthakam etat samam vipra varaiḥ purā kṛtam
translated: Ten thousand murders, the useless killing of her husband - this was done by the best of Brahmins in the past.

original: na cāpi cāsyā bhavatīha śuddhiḥ samidbhavahnau patane 'pi devāḥ // / / //
analyzed: na ca api ca asyāḥ bhavati iha śuddhiḥ devāḥ
translated: And there is no purification for her in this world, O gods, even if she falls into the well-kindled fire.

analyzed: vacanaiḥ sudhā mayaiḥ ukma aṅgadam dharmam vibhūṣaṇam ca
translated: Having deluded them with nectar-like words, he killed Ugra, Angada, Dharma, Vibhishana,

original: priyāyutaṃ mokṣapadaṃ nihatya cakāra bhūmiṃ nṛpavarjitāṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: priyā ayutam mokṣa padam nihatya cakāra bhūmim nṛpa varjitām ca
translated: And a multitude of beloveds, and made the earth devoid of kings.

original: na cāpi vāso narakeṣu devā asyāḥ sthitiḥ kka tridive 'lpabuddheḥ /
analyzed: na ca api vāsaḥ narakeṣu devāḥ asyāḥ sthitiḥ kka tridive lpabuddheḥ
translated: And there is no dwelling for her in the hells, O gods, nor any abode for this one of little intelligence in heaven.

original: na cāpi rājño nikaṭe ca devā nāpyetu viṣṇoḥ padamavyayaṃ yat // / / //
analyzed: na ca api rājñaḥ nikaṭe ca devāḥ na api etu viṣṇoḥ padam avyayam yat
translated: Nor can they approach the king, nor can they attain the imperishable abode of Vishnu.

original: na lokavādena vidūṣitāyā lokeṣu kutrāpi bhavecca vāsaḥ /
analyzed: na lokavādena vidūṣitāyāḥ lokeṣu kutra api bhavet ca vāsaḥ
translated: For one defiled by worldly talk, there is no dwelling anywhere in the worlds.

analyzed: dhira jīvanam kargma vigarhitāyāḥ devāḥ sadā pāpa samāra tāyāḥ
translated: For one always engaged in sinful acts, condemned by the learned, O gods, life is indeed miserable.

original: patiṃ hatvā sutaṃ hatvā sapatnīṃ jananīsamām /
analyzed: patim hatvā sutam hatvā sapatnīm jananī samām
translated: Having killed her husband, having killed her son, having killed her co-wife equal to her mother,

original: hatvā dharāṃ samastāṃ vā kāṃ gatiṃ yāsyate surāḥ // / / //
analyzed: hatvā dharām samastām vā kām gatim yāsyate surāḥ
translated: having killed the entire earth, to what end will she go, O gods?

analyzed: iyam pāpatarā devāḥ dharma vidhvaṃsinī hareḥ
translated: O gods, this one is more sinful, destroying the dharma of Hari.

analyzed: sarvadā api anayā proktam bhujyatām harivāsare
translated: By her, it is always said, Eat on Hari's day.

analyzed: prāṇa saṃvarddhana arthāya teṣām eva api adhogatiḥ
translated: For the sake of nourishing their lives, they go to lower realms.

analyzed: bhujyatām vāsare viṣṇoḥ hanyatām gauḥ dvija anvitā
translated: Eat on Vishnu's day, kill the cow along with the Brahmins.

original: apeyaṃ pīyatā muktvā kathaṃ vāsaṃ labheddivi /
analyzed: apeyam pīyatā muktvā katham vāsam labhet divi
translated: Having drunk what should not be drunk, how can one obtain dwelling in heaven?

original: etadajñānināṃ proktaṃ jñānanāṃ tu na nirṇayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: etat ajñāninām proktam jñānanām tu na nirṇayaḥ
translated: This is said for the ignorant, but for the wise there is no certainty.

analyzed: ajñāna avdyāhṛte vākye bhujyatām harivāsare
translated: In the words uttered out of ignorance, Eat on Hari's day,

analyzed: tasya api śuddhiḥ gaditā prāṇāyāma śatena hi
translated: his purification is also said to be by a hundred prāṇāyāmas.

analyzed: athavā api upavāsena ekādaśyā divaukasaḥ
translated: Or by fasting on Ekadashi, the dwellers of heaven,

analyzed: ṛkṣeṇa saṃyutāyāḥ tu jyeṣṭhakuṇḍa āplavena vā
translated: Or by the Jyeshtha Kundaplava in conjunction with the lunar mansion,

analyzed: śaukara sparśanāḥ naraḥ deva arcanena vā
translated: Or by the touch of a pig, or by the worship of gods,

analyzed: vyāhṛte kathitam vipraiḥ sā iyam adya su niṣṭhurā
translated: This has been declared by the Brahmins as the Vyahrti. Today it is very cruel.

original: bhojane pāpaniratā dine viṣṇordurāsade /🔽bharturvākyaṃ vyapohyaiva ghātayitvā sutaṃ priyam // / / //
analyzed: bhojane pāpa niratāḥ dine viṣṇoḥ durāsade  bhartuḥ vākyam vyapohya eva ghātayitvā sutam priyam
translated: Engaged in sinful eating on the difficult day of Vishnu,🔽Having disregarded the words of her husband, having caused the death of her beloved son,

original: vākyajñaṃ vākyanirataṃ mātṝṇāṃ tu hite ratam /
analyzed: vākya jñam vākya niratam mātṝṇām tu hite ratam
translated: Skilled in speech, devoted to speech, engaged in the welfare of her mothers,

analyzed: viṣṇudharma praloptrī iyam bahu pāpa samanvitā
translated: This one is full of many sins, destroying the religion of Vishnu.

analyzed: na eṣā spṛśyā asti deva īśāḥ katham asyāḥ vara pradāḥ
translated: O lords of gods, she is not to be touched. How can you grant her a boon?

analyzed: bhavantaḥ nyāya yukteṣu dharma yukteṣu tatparāḥ
translated: You are devoted to those who are righteous and virtuous.

original: pālanaṃ pāpayuktasya na kurvanti divaukasaḥ /🔽dharmādhārāḥ smṛtā devā dharmo vedesamāsthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pālanam pāpa yuktasya na kurvanti divaukasaḥ  dharma ādhārāḥ smṛtāḥ devāḥ dharmaḥ vede samāsthitaḥ
translated: The dwellers of heaven do not protect one who is sinful.🔽The gods are known to be the supporters of dharma, and dharma is based in the Vedas.

original: vedaiḥ śuśrūṣaṇaṃ bhartuḥ strīṇāṃ dharmaḥ prakīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: vedaiḥ śuśrūṣaṇam bhartuḥ strīṇām dharmaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: The service to the husband is declared to be the dharma of women.

analyzed: yat bravīti patiḥ kiñcid tat kāryam ā viśaṅkayā
translated: Whatever the husband says, that should be done without hesitation.

analyzed: śuklam śuklam iti brūyāt kṛṣṇam kṛṣṇa iti ca amarāḥ
translated: O immortals, one should say white for white and black for black.

original: śuśrūṣā sā hi vijñeyā na śuśrūṣā hi sevanam // / / //
analyzed: śuśrūṣā sā hi vijñeyā na śuśrūṣā hi sevanam
translated: That is to be known as service, not service is mere attendance.

analyzed: bhartuḥ ājñā hatāḥ devāḥ ātma ājñā sthāpana icchayā
translated: O gods, the king's command was destroyed by the desire to establish his own command.

analyzed: tasmāt pāpā na saṃdehaḥ mohinī sarva yoṣitām
translated: Therefore, she is undoubtedly sinful, the most deceptive of all women.

analyzed: satyasya sādhana arthāya śapathaiḥ yantritaḥ nṛpaḥ
translated: The king, restrained by oaths for the sake of establishing the truth,

analyzed: uvāca vividham vākyam sā na aicchat putra ghātinī
translated: spoke various words, but she, the slayer of her son, did not agree.

original: tena mokṣaṃ gato rājā pāpamasyāṃ visṛjya ca // / / //
analyzed: tena mokṣam gataḥ rājā pāpam asyām visṛjya ca
translated: Therefore, the king, having transferred his sin to her, went to liberation.

analyzed: sā iyam pāpa śarīrā hi hatyā ayuta samanvitā
translated: She has a sinful body, endowed with ten thousand killings.

analyzed: dātāram sarva dānānām brahmaṇyam hari daivatam
translated: He was the giver of all gifts, devoted to Brahman and Hari,

original: prajārañjanaśīlaṃ ca harivāsarasevinam // / / //🔽paradāreṣu niḥsnehaṃ viṣaye vigataspṛham /
analyzed: prajā rañjana śīlam ca hari vāsara sevinam  para dāreṣu niḥsneham viṣaye vigata spṛham
translated: fond of delighting the people, and a follower of Hari's day.🔽He was indifferent to others' wives, free from desire for objects,

analyzed: parārtha tyakta kāmam ca sadā makha niṣeviṇam
translated: renouncing desire for others' sake, always performing sacrifices,

analyzed: sadā eva duṣṭadamane vartamānam dharā tale
translated: always engaged in punishing the wicked on earth,

analyzed: vyasanaiḥ saptabhiḥ ghoraiḥ an ākrāntam mahīpatim
translated: the king was not afflicted by the seven terrible vices.

analyzed: saṃnirasya durācārā vara yogyā katham bhavet
translated: How can she, of evil conduct, be fit for a good union?

original: yo 'syāḥ pakṣetu varteta devo vā dānavo 'pi vā // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ syāḥ varteta devaḥ vā dānavaḥ vā
translated: O best of gods, if any god or demon were to side with her,

analyzed: tam ca api bhasmasātkuryām kṣaṇena sura sattamāḥ
translated: I would reduce him to ashes in an instant.

original: mohinyā rakṣaṇe yastu prayatnaṃ kurute surāḥ // / / //
analyzed: mohinyāḥ rakṣaṇe yaḥ tu prayatnam kurute surāḥ
translated: O gods, if anyone makes an effort to protect Mohini,

original: tasya tajjāyate pāpaṃ yanmohinyāṃ vyavasthitam // / / //🔽sa evamuktvā nṛpate dvijendraḥ saṃgṛhya pāṇau salilaṃ ca tīvram /
analyzed: tasya tat jāyate pāpam yat mohinyām vyavasthitam  saḥ evam uktvā nṛpate dvijendraḥ saṃgṛhya pāṇau salilam ca tīvram
translated: he will incur the same sin that is inherent in Mohini.🔽Having said this, O king, the best of the Brahmins,🔽holding the water in his hand, looked angrily at the one born from Brahma,

analyzed: krodhena saṃvīkṣya vidhi prasūtām cikṣepa tad mūrghni anala prakāśam
translated: and threw it on her head, which was shining like fire.

original: nikṣiptamātre salile mahīpa sadyaḥ prajajvāla ca taccharīram /🔽saṃpaśyatāṃ nākanivāsināṃ tu tṛṇyā yathā vahniśikhāvalīḍhā // / / //🔽kopaṃ vibho saṃhara saṃhareti yāvadgiraḥ khe marutāṃ babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: nikṣipta mātre salile mahīpa sadyas prajajvāla ca tat śarīram  saṃpaśyatām nāka nivāsinām tu tṛṇyā yathā vahni śikhā avalīḍhā  kopam vibho saṃhara saṃhara iti yāvat giraḥ khe marutām babhūvuḥ
translated: As soon as the water was sprinkled, O king, her body immediately caught fire,🔽as if a straw were seized by the flames, while the dwellers of heaven were looking on.🔽While the voices in the sky were saying, O Lord, withdraw your anger, withdraw it,

analyzed: tāvat sa vahniḥ dvija vākya mṛṣṭaḥ bhasma avaśeṣām pramadām cakāra
translated: the fire, sharpened by the words of the Brahmin, reduced the woman to ashes.

original: iti śrībṛhannāradīyapurāṇottarabhāge mohinī carite śāpaprāptirnāma pañcatriṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī bṛhat nāradīyapurāṇa uttara bhāge mohinī carite śāpaprāptiḥ nāma pañcatriṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirty-fifth chapter in the Uttara-khanda of the Brhat-Purana narrated by Narada, on the attainment of the curse by Mohini.

analyzed: vasiṣṭhaḥ uvāca
translated: Vasishtha said:

analyzed: mohinī moham utsṛjya gatā vibudha mandiram
translated: Mohini, having cast off her delusion, went to the abode of the gods.

analyzed: bhartsitāḥ deva dūtena sthitiḥ te tra na pāpinī
translated: Reproached by the messenger of the gods, Your stay here is not proper, O sinful one!

analyzed: pāpa śīle su durmedhe bhartṛ nindā parāyaṇe
translated: O sinful one of very wicked understanding, ever intent on censuring your husband,

analyzed: harivāsara lopinyām vāsaḥ te na triviṣṭape
translated: you who have neglected the observance of Hari's day, you have no place in heaven!

original: dharmato vimukhānāṃ ca narake vāsa iṣyate /
analyzed: dharmataḥ vimukhānām ca narake vāsaḥ iṣyate
translated: It is ordained that those who turn away from righteousness should dwell in hell.

original: evamuktvā tu tāṃ vāyuḥ krūraṃ vacanapadbhutam // / / //
analyzed: evam uktvā tu tām vāyuḥ krūram vacana padbhutam
translated: Having thus spoken to her, the wind, with words of terrible import,

analyzed: tāḍayitvā ca daṇḍena prerayāmāsa yātanām
translated: having struck her with his staff, sent her to the place of torment.

analyzed: evam saṃtāḍitā rājan deva dūtena mohinī
translated: Thus struck, O king, by the messenger of the gods, Mohini,

analyzed: brahmadaṇḍa parābhūtā saṃprāptā narakam nṛpa
translated: overwhelmed by the curse of Brahma, reached hell, O king.

original: tatra dharmājñayā sā tu dūtaiḥ saṃtāḍitā ciram // / / //
analyzed: tatra dharma ājñayā sā tu dūtaiḥ saṃtāḍitā ciram
translated: There, by the order of Dharma, she was long struck by his messengers,

analyzed: sarveṣu kramaśas gatvā narakeṣu nipātitā
translated: and was cast down into all the hells in turn.

analyzed: pāpe dharmāṅgadaḥ putraḥ ghātitaḥ pati pāṇinā
translated: O sinful one, your son Dharmaranga was killed by his father's hand.

translated: Or the food offering to Hari is said to be one-fourth of one's own food.

analyzed: svātī sūrya udaye tyajantī akādaśīm sati
translated: If the Dasa-Ekadashi is pierced by Swati at sunrise, one should give it up.

original: niṣkāmā madhyarātre ca viddhāṃ muñcanti yāmyayā // / / //
analyzed: niṣkāmāḥ madhyarātre ca viddhām muñcanti yāmyayā
translated: Those without desire should give up the Dasa-Ekadashi pierced by Yama at midnight.

original: sarveṣvapi tu lokeṣu viditā daśamī tithiḥ /
analyzed: sarveṣu api tu lokeṣu viditā daśamī tithiḥ
translated: But in all the worlds, the tenth lunar day is known as the day of Yama.

analyzed: yamasya tasyāḥ prānti tu sthitiḥ kāryā tvayā anaghe

analyzed: etena deva kāryam ca siddham bhavati śobhane

analyzed: sūrya indu cārā tithyāḥ tu daśamyāḥ prānta gāminī
translated: The course of the sun and moon is such that the tenth lunar day ends at the end of the day.

original: bhuvi tīrthāni caiva tvaṃ svāghanāśāya saṃcara /
analyzed: bhuvi tīrthāni ca eva tvam sva agha nāśāya saṃcara
translated: For the destruction of your own sins, you should move on the earth to the holy places.

analyzed: aruṇa udayam ārabhya yāvat sūrya udayaḥ bhavet
translated: From the time of sunrise to the time of sunrise,

analyzed: tad antar tvam vrate prāptā labhasva ekādaśī phalam
translated: you have reached the end of the vow. Obtain the fruit of Ekadashi.

analyzed: yaḥ kaścid kurute viddham tvayā hi ekādaśīvratam
translated: Whoever observes the Ekadashi vow pierced by you,

analyzed: sa tīpa kārakaḥ tubhyam bhaviṣyati sura priye
translated: he will be a great benefactor to you, O beloved of the gods.

analyzed: muhūrta dvaya mātram tu jñeyam ca atra aruṇa udayam
translated: The time of sunrise should be known here as just two muhurtas.

analyzed: mūhūrtāḥ pañcadaśa ca smṛtāḥ rātreḥ dinasya ca
translated: Fifteen muhurtas are considered to be a night and a day.

analyzed: jñeyāḥ te hrasva dīrgha tve trairāśika vidhānataḥ
translated: They should be known as short and long according to the rule of the three periods of time.

analyzed: trayodaśāt muhūrtāt tu rātraiḥ ūrddhvā samāgatā
translated: The night is divided into thirteen muhurtas, with the last two and a half muhurtas being the end of the night.

analyzed: sabdhvā upavāsinām puṇyam svasthā bhava śuci smite
translated: The merit of those who fast during the day, O you of pure smiles, be well and happy.

analyzed: yama saṃsthāpana arthāya vaikuṇṭha dhvaṃsanāya ca
translated: For the establishment of Yama, for the destruction of Vaikuntha,

analyzed: pākhaṇḍānām vivṛddhi artham pāpa saṃcanāya ca
translated: For the increase of heretics, for the accumulation of sin,

analyzed: dattam te mohini sthānam pratyūṣa samaya aṅkitam
translated: The place marked by the dawn has been given to you, O Mohini.

original: viddhaṃ tvayaikādaśikāvrataṃ ye kurvanti kartāra iha prayatnāt /

translated: Those who observe the Ekadashi vow with effort,

analyzed: teṣām bhavet yat su kṛtam śubhe phalam bhuṅkṣva prasannā bhava bhūsure tvam
translated: May they enjoy the auspicious fruits of their good deeds, be pleased and be happy, O Brahmin lady.

original: evaṃ pradiṣṭā kamalāsanādyaiḥ sā mohinī hṛṣṭatarā babhūva /🔽mene kṛtārthaṃ nijajīvitaṃ ca svapāpatīrthābhiniṣevaṇena // / / //
analyzed: evam pradiṣṭā kamalāsana ādyaiḥ sā mohinī hṛṣṭatarā babhūva  mene kṛtārtham nija jīvitam ca sva pāpa tīrtha abhiniṣevaṇena
translated: Thus instructed by Kamalasana and others, Mohini became very joyful.🔽She considered her life to be fulfilled by serving her own sinful holy places.

analyzed: saṃsādhitam kāryam idam surāṇām bhasma avaśeṣam hi gate dehe

analyzed: caitanya mātre pavana ātmake smin saṃmārjitaḥ bhūpa kṛtaḥ tu panthāḥ
translated: The path made by the king has been wiped out in this mere consciousness, which is of the nature of wind.

analyzed: nītam mayā ca ātma kṛtam hi vākyam prahṛṣṭayā vai yat udāhṛtam hi
translated: The words spoken by me, which have been uttered with joy, have been accomplished by me.

analyzed: evam vimṛśya kṣiptipāla de vān praṇamya hṛṣṭā ca purodhasam svam

analyzed: prānta sthitām tām ravijaḥ nirīkṣya prahṛṣṭa vaktraḥ vacanam jagāda
translated: Seeing her standing at the end, the son of the sun, with a delighted face, spoke these words:

analyzed: a spṛṣṭam udayam nṝṇām mohanāya bhaviṣyati

translated: When the gods had departed, that Mohini, having approached Brahma, the lord of gods and demons,

analyzed: vijñāpayāmāsa pitar purodhāḥ mama ayam ati ugrataraḥ ca kopāt  dagdham śarīram mama lokanātha punar prapatsye tha tathā kuruṣva

translated: And this world is deluded by me, having resorted to the end of the lunar fortnight, on the day of Yama.

analyzed: jitaḥ hi rājñā śamanaḥ purā adya kṛtaḥ jayī tāta tava prabhāvāt

analyzed: bhūyām aham jagannātha bhoḥ

analyzed: tat śrutvā mohinī vākyam brahmā loka vidhāna kṛt

analyzed: tvayā mayā ca sa pālyā kṛta kāryā tapasvinī

translated: If you inform me with a pure mind, O giver of honor,

analyzed: kintu viṣṇu dinasya eṣā vairiṇī pāpa kāriṇī

analyzed: yathā śuddhyā iti vipra indra tathā evā āśu vidhīyatām

analyzed: tat śrutvā vacanam tasya brahmaṇaḥ sa purohitaḥ

analyzed: vipra vākyam samākarṇya brahmā

analyzed: samukṣite brahmaṇā loka kartrā sā mohinī deha yutā babhūva  praṇamya tātam ca vasoḥ purodhasaḥ jagrāha pādau vinayena natvā
translated: When sprinkled by Brahma, the creator of the worlds, that Mohini, along with her body,🔽bowed to her father and then respectfully touched the feet of Vasu's priest.

analyzed: na tasyāḥ sadṛśam kiñcid vidyate pāpa nāśanam

analyzed: tat śrutvā mohinī vākyam vasuḥ sarva purāṇa vid
translated: Having heard Mohini's words, Vasu, who knew all the Puranas,

translated: narrated the greatness of Ganga, which destroys sins.

analyzed: vasuḥ uvāca
translated: Vasishtha said:

translated: where the sacred Ganga always flows nearby,

translated: Those men who commit sins in their youth but later serve Ganga,

analyzed: gatim anveṣamāṇānām na gaṅgā sadṛśī gatiḥ  prakṛṣṭaiḥ pātakaiḥ ghoraiḥ pāpinaḥ puruṣa adhamān
translated: seeking a refuge, there is no refuge like the Ganges.🔽The Ganges forcibly delivers the worst of sinners, those who are bound by terrible and grave sins,

translated: as they go to the impure hell.

analyzed: te samānāḥ tu munibhiḥ nūnam devaiḥ sa vāsavaiḥ
translated: They are certainly equal to the sages and the gods along with Indra,

analyzed: ye bhigacchanti satatam gaṅgām abhimatām suraiḥ
translated: those who always approach the Ganges, which is desired by the gods.

translated: having enjoyed many pleasures with those divine-formed beloveds,🔽and having become endowed with lordship for an infinite time, one then takes birth on earth,

analyzed: jāyate sa mahīpālaḥ kīrti aiśvarya samanvitaḥ
translated: as a king endowed with fame and prosperity.

analyzed: eka chatreṇa sa mahīm pālayati ājñayā saha
translated: He rules the earth with a single umbrella, by his command.

original: ante vairāgyasaṃpanno gaṅgāṃ sa labhate punaḥ /
analyzed: ante vairāgya saṃpannaḥ gaṅgām sa labhate punar
translated: At the end, endowed with detachment, he again obtains the Ganges.

original: sa tayā śraddhayā yukto gaṅgāyāṃ maraṇaṃ labhet // / / //
analyzed: sa tayā śraddhayā yuktaḥ gaṅgāyām maraṇam labhet
translated: Endowed with that faith, he would obtain death in the Ganges.

original: tathā tatra smṛtiṃ labdhvā mokṣamāpnoti sa dhruvam /
analyzed: tathā tatra smṛtim labdhvā mokṣam āpnoti sa dhruvam
translated: Thus, having regained memory there, he certainly attains liberation.

original: jyeṣṭhe māsi site pakṣe daśamyāṃ hastasaṃyute // / / //
analyzed: jyeṣṭhe māsi site pakṣe daśamyām hasta saṃyute
translated: In the month of Jyeshtha, on the tenth day in the bright fortnight, when the constellation Hasta is present,

original: gaṅgātīre tu puruṣo nārī vā bhaktibhāvataḥ /
analyzed: gaṅgā tīre tu puruṣaḥ nārī vā bhakti bhāvataḥ
translated: a man or woman, with a devotional attitude,

analyzed: niśāyām jāgaram kṛtvā gaṅgām daśavidhaiḥ tatas
translated: having kept awake at night on the bank of the Ganges, should then worship the Ganges with ten kinds of offerings,

analyzed: puṣpaiḥ gandhaiḥ ca naivedyaiḥ phalaiḥ ca daśa saṃkhyāyāḥ
translated: with flowers, fragrances, food offerings, and fruits in sets of ten,

analyzed: tathā eva dīpaiḥ tāṃbūlaiḥ pūjayet śraddhayā anvitaḥ
translated: and likewise with lamps and betel leaves, endowed with faith.

original: snātvā bhaktyā tu jāhnavyāṃ daśakṛtvo vidhānataḥ /🔽daśaprasṛti kṛṣṇaṃśca tilānsarpiśca vai jale // / / //
analyzed: snātvā bhaktyā tu jāhnavyām daśa kṛtvas vidhānataḥ  daśa prasṛti kṛṣṇan ca tilān sarpiḥ ca vai jale
translated: Having bathed in the Ganges with devotion ten times according to the rules,🔽and having offered ten handfuls of black sesame seeds and ghee in the water,

original: saktupiṇḍānguḍapiṇḍāndadyācca daśasaṃkhyayā /🔽tato gaṅgātaṭe ramye hemnā rūpyeṇa vā tathā // / / //
analyzed: saktu piṇḍān guḍa piṇḍān dadyāt ca daśa saṃkhyayā  tatas gaṅgā taṭe ramye hemnā rūpyeṇa vā tathā
translated: he should also offer ten lumps of flour and jaggery.🔽Then, on the beautiful bank of the Ganges, with gold or silver,

analyzed: gaṅgāyāḥ pratimām kṛtvā vakṣyamāṇa svarūpiṇīm
translated: having made an image of the Ganges with the described form,

analyzed: padma svastika cihnasya saṃsthitasya tathā upari
translated: And above that, the sign of a lotus and svastika,

original: vastrasragdāmakaṇṭhasya pūrṇakuṃbhasya copari /🔽saṃsthāpya pūjayeddevīṃ tadalābhe mṛdādi vā // / / //
analyzed: vastra sraj dāma kaṇṭhasya pūrṇa kuṃbhasya ca upari  saṃsthāpya pūjayet devīm tad alābhe mṛd ādi vā
translated: And above that, a full pot with a neck adorned with cloth, garlands, and wreaths.🔽Having installed it, one should worship the Goddess. If that is not available, one should use clay or something else.

analyzed: atha tatra api aśaktaḥ ced likhet piṣṭena vai bhuvi
translated: If one is still unable to do that, one should draw it with flour on the ground.

analyzed: catur bhujām su netrām ca candra ayuta sama prabhām
translated: Four-armed, with beautiful eyes, having the radiance of ten thousand moons,

analyzed: cāmaraiḥ vījyamānām ca śveta chatra upaśibhitām
translated: Being fanned with yak-tail whisks, adorned with a white parasol,

analyzed: su prasannām ca vara dām karuṇā ārdra nija antarām  sudhā plāvita bhū pṛṣṭhām deva ādibhiḥ abhiṣṭutām
translated: Extremely delighted, granting boons, with one's own heart moist with compassion,🔽With the ground flooded with nectar, being praised by gods and others,

analyzed: divya ratna parītām ca diṃvya mālya anulepanām
translated: Surrounded by divine jewels, anointed with divine garlands and unguents,

original: dhyātvā jale yathāproktāṃ tatrārcāyāṃ tu pūjayet /
analyzed: dhyātvā jale yathā proktām tatra arcāyām tu pūjayet
translated: Having meditated on it in the water as described, one should worship it in the image.

analyzed: vakṣyamāṇena mantreṇa kuryāt pūjām viśeṣataḥ
translated: One should perform the worship especially with the mantra to be mentioned.

analyzed: pañcāmṛtena ca snānam arcāyām tu viśiṣyate
translated: The bathing with the five sweet substances is especially excellent in the case of an image.

analyzed: pratimā agre sthaṇḍile tu gomayena upalepayet
translated: In front of the image, on the ground, one should smear it with cow dung.

original: nārāyaṇaṃ maheśaṃ ca brahmāṇaṃ bhāskaraṃ tathā /
analyzed: nārāyaṇam maheśam ca brahmāṇam bhāskaram tathā
translated: One should worship Narayana, Mahesha, Brahma, and the Sun,

analyzed: bhagīratham ca nṛpatim himavantam naga īśvaram
translated: And King Bhagiratha, and the lord of mountains, the Himalayas,

analyzed: gandha puṣpa ādibhiḥ ca eva yathāśakti prapūjayet  daśa prasthān stilān dadyāt daśa viprebhyaḥ eva ca
translated: And with incense, flowers, etc., one should worship according to one's ability.🔽One should give ten prasthas of sesame seeds to ten Brahmins.

analyzed: daśa prasthān yavān dadyāt daśa gavyaiḥ yathāhitān
translated: One should give ten prasthas of barley and ten cows as desired.

analyzed: matsya kacchapa maṇḍūka mara ādi jalecarān
translated: Fish, tortoises, frogs, and other aquatic creatures,

analyzed: kāritān vai yathāśakti svarṇena rajatena vā
translated: One should have them made according to one's ability, either with gold or silver.

analyzed: tad alābhe piṣṭa mayān abhyarcya kusuma ādibhiḥ
translated: If those are not available, one should worship them with flowers etc. made of flour.

analyzed: gaṅgāyām prakṣipet pūrvvam mantreṇa eva tu mantra vid
translated: The one who knows the mantra should first cast them into the Ganges with the mantra.

analyzed: ratha yātrā dine tasmin vibhave sati kārayet
translated: On that day of the chariot procession, if one has the means, one should have it done.

analyzed: ratha ārūḍha pratikṛtim gaṅgāyāḥ tu uttarā mukhām
translated: The image of the Ganges mounted on a chariot facing north,

analyzed: bhramantyāḥ darśanam loke durlabham pāpa karmaṇām
translated: While wandering, it is difficult for people of sinful deeds to see.

analyzed: durgāyāḥ ratha yātrā asti tathā eva atra api kārayet
translated: There is also the chariot procession of Durga, and one should have it done here too.

analyzed: evam kṛtvā vidhānena vitta śāṭhya vivarjitaḥ
translated: Having done this in accordance with the rules, without being stingy with money,

analyzed: daśa pāpaiḥ vakṣyamāṇaiḥ sadyas eva vimucyate
translated: One is immediately freed from the ten sins that will be mentioned.

analyzed: adattānām upādānam hiṃsā ca eva avidhānataḥ
translated: Taking what is not given, violence without justification,

analyzed: paradāra upasevā ca kāyikam tribidham smṛtam
translated: and serving another's wife - these are considered the three types of bodily [misdeeds].

analyzed: pāṃruṣyam anṛtam vā api paiśunyam ca api sarvaśas
translated: Harsh speech, falsehood, and also slander in every way,

analyzed: asaṃbaddha pralāpaḥ ca vācikam syāt caturvidham  para dravyeṣu abhidhyānam manasā aniṣṭa cintanam
translated: and irrelevant chatter - these are the four types of verbal [misdeeds].🔽Covetousness towards others' possessions, mental brooding, and false resolve -

analyzed: vitatha abhiniveśaḥ ca mānasam trividham smṛtam
translated: these are considered the three types of mental [misdeeds].

analyzed: etaiḥ daśavidhaiḥ pāpaiḥ koṭi janma samudbhavaiḥ
translated: By these ten kinds of sins arising from millions of births,

original: mucyate nātra saṃdeho brahmaṇo vacanaṃ yathā // / / //🔽daśa triṃśacca tānpūrvānpitṝneva tathāparān /
analyzed: mucyate na atra saṃdehaḥ brahmaṇaḥ vacanam yathā  daśa triṃśat ca tān pūrvān pitṝn eva tathā aparān
translated: one is freed, there is no doubt, just as in the words of Brahma.

analyzed: uddharati eva saṃsārāt mantreṇa anena pūjitā
translated: By this mantra, when worshipped, one elevates ten generations of ancestors and ten generations of descendants,🔽and frees them from the cycle of birth and death.

original: oṃ namo daśaharāyai nārāyaṇyai gaṅgāyai namaḥ /
analyzed: om namaḥ daśa harāyai nārāyaṇyai gaṅgāyai namaḥ
translated: Om, salutations to the remover of the ten sins, to Narayana, to Ganga.

original: iti mantreṇa yo martyo dine tasmindivāniśam // / / //
analyzed: iti mantreṇa yaḥ martyaḥ dine tasmin divāniśam
translated: A mortal who recites this mantra day and night on that day,

analyzed: japet paca sahasrāṇi daśa dharma phalam labhet
translated: reciting it ten thousand times, obtains the fruits of ten virtues.

analyzed: uddaret daśa pūrvāṇi parāṇi ca bhava arṇavāt
translated: He would elevate ten generations of ancestors and ten generations of descendants from the ocean of worldly existence.

analyzed: vakṣyamāṇam idam stotram vidhinā pratigṛhya ca
translated: Having accepted this hymn to be recited,

analyzed: gaṅgā agre tad dine japyam viṣṇu pūjām pravartayet
translated: One should recite it in front of the Ganges on that day and perform the worship of Vishnu.

original: oṃ namaḥ śivāyai gaṅgāyai śivadāyai namo 'stu te /
analyzed: om namaḥ śivāyai gaṅgāyai śiva dāyai namaḥ stu te
translated: Om, salutations to the auspicious Ganga, the bestower of auspiciousness, salutations to you.

original: namo 'stu viṣṇurūpiṇyai gaṅgāyai te namo namaḥ // / / //🔽sarvadevasvarūpiṇyai namo bheṣajamūrtaye /
analyzed: namaḥ stu viṣṇu rūpiṇyai gaṅgāyai te namaḥ namaḥ  sarva deva svarūpiṇyai namaḥ bheṣaja mūrtaye
translated: Salutations to you who are in the form of Vishnu, salutations to Ganga, again and again.🔽Salutations to you who are in the form of all gods, to the embodiment of medicine.

analyzed: sarvasya sarva vyādhīnām bhiṣaj śreṣṭhe namaḥ stu te
translated: Salutations to you, the best of physicians, for all diseases of all.

analyzed: sthāṇu jaṅgama saṃbhūta viṣa hantri namaḥ stu te  saṃsāra viṣa nāśinyai jīvanāyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you who destroy poison arising from immobile and mobile beings.🔽Salutations again and again to the destroyer of the poison of worldly existence, to the bestower of life.

analyzed: tāpa tritaya hantryai ca prāṇeśvaryai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations again and again to the destroyer of the three kinds of heat, to the goddess of life.

analyzed: śāntyai saṃtāpa hāriṇyai namaḥ te sarvamūrtaye
translated: Salutations to you, the embodiment of peace, the remover of distress, to you who are the embodiment of all.

analyzed: sarva saṃśuddhi kāriṇyai namaḥ pāpa vimuktaye
translated: Salutations for the purification of all, for the liberation from sin.

analyzed: bhukti mukti pradāyinyai bhogavatyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations again and again to the bestower of enjoyment and emancipation, to the prosperous one.

analyzed: mandākinyai namaḥ te stu svarga dāyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, Mandakini, the bestower of heaven, again and again.

analyzed: namaḥ trailokya mūrtāyai tridaśāyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the embodiment of the three worlds, to the thirty gods, again and again.

analyzed: namaḥ te śuklasaṃsthāyai kṣemavatyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you who are established in purity, to Kshemavati, salutations again and again.

analyzed: tridaśa āsana saṃsthāyai tejovatyai namaḥ stu te
translated: Salutations to you who are established on the seat of the thirty gods, to Tejovati, salutations to you.

original: mandāyai liṅgadhāriṇyai nārāyaṇyai namonamaḥ /🔽namaste viśvamitrāyai revatyai te namonamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mandāyai liṅga dhāriṇyai nārāyaṇyai namaḥ namaḥ  namaḥ te viśvamitrāyai revatyai te namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Mandā, to the bearer of the liṅga, to Nārāyaṇī, salutations again and again.🔽Salutations to you, the friend of the universe, to Revatī, salutations again and again to you.

original: bṛhatyai te namo nityaṃ lokadhātryai namonamaḥ /
analyzed: bṛhatyai te namaḥ nityam loka dhātryai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, the great one, to the nurse of the world, salutations again and again.

analyzed: namaḥ te viśvamukhyāyai nandinyai te namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, the chief of the universe, to Nandini, salutations again and again to you.

analyzed: pṛthvyai śiva amṛtāyai ca virajāyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Pṛthvī, to Śivāmṛtā, to Virajā, salutations again and again.

analyzed: tārāyai te namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, the one who has gone to the highest and the lowest, to Tārā, salutations again and again to you.

analyzed: namaḥ te svarga saṃsthāyai abhinnāyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you who are established in heaven, to the unbroken one, salutations again and again.

analyzed: śāntāyai te pratiṣṭhāyai vara dāyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, the peaceful one, to the established one, to the bestower of boons, salutations again and again.

original: ugrāyai nukhajalpāyai saṃjīvinyai namonamaḥ /🔽brahmagāyai brahmadāyai duritaghnyai namonamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ugrāyai saṃjīvinyai namaḥ namaḥ  brahma gāyai brahma dāyai durita ghnyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the fierce one, to the one who speaks with a gruff voice, to the reviver, salutations again and again.🔽Salutations to the one who sings the Vedas, to the one who bestows the Vedas, to the destroyer of sins, salutations again and again.

analyzed: praṇata ārti prabhañjinyai jaganmātre namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the one who destroys the affliction of the humble, to the mother of the world, salutations again and again.

analyzed: viluṣāyai durga hantryai dakṣāyai te namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the one who is delighted, to the destroyer of Durga, to the skillful one, salutations again and again to you.

analyzed: sarva āpad pratipakṣāyai maṅgalāyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations again and again to the auspicious one, the antidote to all calamities.

original: parāpare pare tubhya namo mokṣaprade sadā /
analyzed: parāpare pare namaḥ mokṣa prade sadā
translated: Salutations to you, the supreme, the transcendent, the highest, the bestower of liberation always.

analyzed: gaṅgā mama agratas bhūyāt gaṅgā me pārśvayoḥ tathā
translated: May Ganga be in front of me, may Ganga be on both sides of me,

original: gaṅgā me sarvato bhūyāttvayi gaṅge 'stu me sthitiḥ /
analyzed: gaṅgā me sarvatas bhūyāt tvayi gaṅge stu me sthitiḥ
translated: May Ganga be all around me, may I be established in you, O Ganga.

original: ādau tvamante madhye ca sarvā tvaṃ gāṅgate śive // / / //
analyzed: ādau tvam ante madhye ca sarvā tvam śive
translated: In the beginning, in the end, and in the middle, you are all, O auspicious one born from Shiva's matted hair.

analyzed: tvam eva mūlaprakṛtiḥ tvam hi nārāyaṇaḥ prabhuḥ
translated: You are the original Prakruti (primordial matter), you are the lord Narayana.

original: gaṅge tvaṃ paramātmā ca śivastubhyaṃ namonamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: gaṅge tvam paramātmā ca śivaḥ tubhyam namaḥ namaḥ
translated: O Ganga, you are the supreme Self, salutations again and again to Shiva in you.

original: itīdaṃ paṭhati stotraṃ nityaṃ bhaktiparastu yaḥ /
analyzed: iti idam paṭhati stotram nityam bhakti paraḥ tu yaḥ
translated: One who recites this hymn daily with great devotion,

analyzed: śṛṇoti śraddhayā vā api kāya vācika saṃbhavaiḥ
translated: Or listens to it with faith, whether born from body or speech,

analyzed: daśadhā saṃsthitaiḥ deṣaiḥ sarvaiḥ eva pramucyate
translated: Is freed from all the ten kinds of faults that exist.

analyzed: rogī pramucyate rogāt mucyeta āpannaḥ āpadaḥ
translated: A sick person is freed from diseases, one in danger is freed from danger,

analyzed: bandhanāt ca api bhayebhyaḥ ca vimucyate
translated: One in enmity is freed from bondage, and from all fears.

analyzed: sarvān kāmān avāpnoti pretya brahmaṇi līyate
translated: One attains all desires and after death merges into Brahman.

original: idaṃ stotraṃ gṛhe yasya likhitaṃ paripūjyate /
analyzed: idam stotram gṛhe yasya likhitam paripūjyate
translated: In the house of one where this hymn is written and worshipped,

analyzed: na agni caura bhayam tatra pāpebhyaḥ bhayam nahi
translated: There is no fear of fire or thieves, nor even of sins.

analyzed: tasyām daśamyām etat ca stotram gaṅgā jale sthitaḥ
translated: On that tenth day, while standing in the water of the Ganges,

analyzed: japan tu daśa kṛtvas ca daridraḥ vā api ca akṣamaḥ
translated: One should recite this hymn ten times, even if one is poor or incapable.

analyzed: saḥ u pi tad phalam āpnoti gaṅgām saṃpūjya bhaktitaḥ
translated: By worshipping the Ganges with devotion, he too attains that fruit.

analyzed: pūrva uktena vidhānena phalam yat parikīrtitam
translated: The fruit that has been proclaimed according to the previously mentioned method,

original: yathā gaurī tathā gaṅgā tasmādgauryāstu pūjane /
analyzed: yathā gaurī tathā gaṅgā tasmāt gauryāḥ tu pūjane
translated: Just as Gouri, so is Ganga. Therefore, in the worship of Gouri,

analyzed: yathā śivaḥ tathā viṣṇuḥ yathā viṣṇuḥ tathā hi umā
translated: Just as Shiva, so is Vishnu. Just as Vishnu, so is Uma.

analyzed: umā yathā tathā gaṅgā ca atra bhedaḥ na vidyate
translated: Just as Uma, so is Ganga. There is no difference here.

analyzed: viṣṇu rudra antaram yaḥ ca gagā gaurī antaram tathā
translated: One who speaks of the difference between Vishnu and Rudra, between Ganga and Gouri,

analyzed: lakṣmīgauryataram yaḥ ca prabrūte mūḍha dhīḥ tu saḥ
translated: And between Lakshmi and Gouri, is indeed one of deluded intellect.

analyzed: śuklapakṣe divā bhūmau gaṅgāyām uttarāyaṇe

analyzed: dhanyāḥ deham vimuñcanti hṛdaya sthe janārdane
translated: With Janardana residing in their hearts.

original: ye muñcanti narāprāṇān gaṅgāyāṃ vidhinaṃ dini /
analyzed: ye muñcanti gaṅgāyām
translated: Those men who give up their lives in the Ganges during the day, according to the rules,

analyzed: te viṣṇu lokam gacchanti stūyamānāḥ divisthitaiḥ
translated: They go to Vishnu's world, being praised by those who dwell in heaven.

analyzed: arddha udakena jāhnavyām mniyate naśanena yaḥ
translated: One who dies by half-immersion in the Ganges or by fasting,

analyzed: sa yāti na punarjanma brahma sāyujyam eti ca
translated: attains birth no more and becomes one with Brahman.

analyzed: yā gatiḥ yoga yuktasya sātvikasya manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: The state of a wise person who is devoted to yoga and is of the sattva quality,

original: sā getistyajataḥ prāṇān gaṅgāyāṃ tu śarīriṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sā getiḥ tyajataḥ prāṇān gaṅgāyām tu śarīriṇaḥ
translated: that is the state of one who gives up his life in the Ganges while still embodied.

original: anaśanaṃ gṛhītvā yo gaṅgātīre mṛto naraḥ /
analyzed: anaśanam gṛhītvā yaḥ gaṅgā tīre mṛtaḥ naraḥ
translated: A man who takes up fasting and dies on the banks of the Ganges,

analyzed: satyam eva param lokam āpnoti pitṛbhiḥ saha
translated: attains the highest world along with his ancestors.

analyzed: gaṅgāyām maraṇāt prāṇān yoḥ prājñaḥ tyaktum icchati
translated: A wise person who wishes to give up his life by dying in the Ganges,

original: gatāni bahujanmāni yatra yatra mṛtāni ca // / / //
analyzed: gatāni bahu janmāni yatra yatra mṛtāni ca
translated: many births have passed where he has died,

original: mahāṃścāpi gataḥ kālo yatra tatrāpi gacchataḥ /
analyzed: mahān ca api gataḥ kālaḥ yatra tatra api gacchataḥ
translated: and much time has passed for one who goes there and there,

analyzed: atra dūre samīpe ca sadṛśam yojana dvayam
translated: here the distance is the same, two yojanas near or far.

analyzed: gaṅgāyām maraṇena iha na atra kāryā vicāraṇā
translated: There is no doubt that by dying in the Ganges here,

analyzed: jñānataḥ jñānataḥ vā api kāmataḥ vā
translated: whether knowingly or unknowingly, or even out of desire,

original: gaṅgāyāṃ tu mṛto martyaḥ svargaṃ mokṣaṃ ca vindati /
analyzed: gaṅgāyām tu mṛtaḥ martyaḥ svargam mokṣam ca vindati
translated: a mortal who dies in the Ganges attains heaven and liberation.

analyzed: prāṇeṣu utsṛjyamāneṣu yaḥ gaṅgām saṃsmaret naraḥ
translated: If a person, while giving up his life, remembers the Ganges,

original: spṛśedvā pāpaśīlo 'pi sa vai yāti parāṃ gatim // / / //
analyzed: spṛśet vā pāpa śīlaḥ u pi sa vai yāti parām gatim
translated: Even a sinner who touches it, attains the highest state.

original: gaṅgāṃ gatvā yaiḥ śarīraṃ visṛṣṭaṃ prāptā dhīrāste tu devaiḥ samatvam /
analyzed: gaṅgām gatvā yaiḥ śarīram visṛṣṭam prāptāḥ dhīrāḥ te tu devaiḥ sama tvam
translated: Those who have given up their bodies after going to the Ganges, those wise ones have attained equality with the gods.

analyzed: tasmāt survān prohya mukti pradān vai sevet gaṅgām ā śarīrasya pātam
translated: Therefore, one should serve the Ganges, the bestower of liberation, until the fall of the body.

original: antarikṣe kṣitau toye pāpīyānapi yo mṛtaḥ /
analyzed: antarikṣe kṣitau toye pāpīyān api yaḥ mṛtaḥ
translated: Even a sinner who dies in the sky, on the earth, or in water,

analyzed: brahma viṣṇu śivaiḥ pūjyam padam akṣayyam aśnute
translated: Attains the imperishable state worshipped by Brahma, Vishnu, and Shiva.

analyzed: yaḥ sa prāṇaḥ prayataḥ śiṣṭa saṃmataḥ
translated: One who is established in dharma, with life, restrained, and approved by the virtuous,

original: cintayenmanasā gaṅgāṃ sa gatiṃ paramāṃ labhet // / / //
analyzed: cintayet manasā gaṅgām sa gatim paramām labhet
translated: If he contemplates the Ganges with his mind, he will attain the highest state.

original: yatra tatra mṛto vāpi maraṇe samupasthite /
analyzed: yatra tatra mṛtaḥ vā api maraṇe samupasthite
translated: Wherever he dies, or when death is imminent,

original: bhaktyā gaṅgāṃ smaranyāti śaivaṃ vā vaiṣṇavaṃ puram // / / //
analyzed: bhaktyā gaṅgām smaran yāti śaivam vā vaiṣṇavam puram
translated: By remembering the Ganges with devotion, he goes to Shiva's or Vishnu's abode.

analyzed: śaṃbhoḥ jaṭā kalāpāt tu viniṣkrāntā ati karkaśāt
translated: From the matted locks of Shiva, which are extremely rough,

analyzed: plāvayitvā divam ninye yā pāpān yagara ātmajān
translated: She emerged and, after flooding heaven, took those sons of Agira to heaven.

analyzed: yāvanti asthīni gaṅgāyām tiṣṭhanti puruṣasya vai
translated: As many bones of a person remain in the Ganges,

analyzed: tāvat varṣa sahasrāṇi svarga loke mahīyate
translated: He is honored in the heavenly world for as many thousands of years as there are particles of dust touched by the water of the Ganges on his bones.

original: gagātoye tu yasyāsthi nītvā prakṣipyate naraiḥ /
analyzed: gagā toye tu yasya asthi nītvā prakṣipyate naraiḥ
translated: If the bones of a person are taken and thrown into the water of the Ganges,

analyzed: tad kālam āditas kṛtvā svarga loke bhavet sthitiḥ
translated: his stay in the heavenly world will be from that moment onwards.

analyzed: gaṅgā toye tu yasya asthi prāpyate śubha karmaṇaḥ
translated: If the bones of a person of auspicious deeds are found in the water of the Ganges,

analyzed: na tasya punarāvṛttiḥ brahma lokāt kathañcana
translated: he will never return from the world of Brahma.

analyzed: daśa aha abhyantare yasya gaṅgā toye sthi saṃgatam
translated: If the bones of a person come in contact with the water of the Ganges within ten days,

analyzed: gaṅgāyām maraṇe yādṛś tādṛś phalam avāpnuyāt
translated: he will attain the same fruit as one who dies in the Ganges.

analyzed: snātvā tatas pañcagavyena siktvā hiraṇya madhu ājya tilaiḥ niyojya
translated: Having bathed, sprinkled with the five products of the cow, and placed gold, honey, ghee, and sesame seeds,

original: tadasthipiṇḍaṃ puṭake nidhāya paśyan diśaṃ pretagaṇopagūḍhām // / / //
analyzed: tad asthi piṇḍam puṭake nidhāya paśyan diśam preta gaṇa upagūḍhām
translated: placing the lump of his bones in a bag, seeing the direction covered with the multitude of ghosts,

original: namo 'stu dharmāya vadanpraviśya jalaṃ sa me prīta iti kṣipecca /
analyzed: namaḥ stu dharmāya vadan praviśya jalam sa me prītaḥ iti kṣipet ca
translated: saying Salutations to Dharma, having entered the water, he should throw it, thinking May he be pleased with me.

original: snātvā tatastīrthavaṭākṣayaṃ ca dṛṣṭvā pradadyādatha dakṣiṇāṃ tu // / / //
analyzed: snātvā tatas tīrtha vaṭā kṣayam ca dṛṣṭvā pradadyāt atha dakṣiṇām tu
translated: Having bathed, then having seen the imperishable sacred tree, and having given dakshina,

original: evaṃ kṛtvā pretapure sthitasya svarge gatiḥ syātta mahendratulyā // / / //
analyzed: evam kṛtvā pretapure sthitasya svarge gatiḥ mahendra tulyā
translated: having done this, the one who is staying in the city of the departed spirits will have a heavenly journey equal to that of Indra.

analyzed: pravāham avadhim kṛtvā yāvat hasta catuṣṭayam
translated: The current should be taken as the limit up to a distance of four cubits.

original: tatra nārāyaṇaḥ svāmī nānyaḥ svāmī kadācana // / / //
analyzed: tatra nārāyaṇaḥ svāmī na anyaḥ svāmī kadācana
translated: There, Narayana is the Lord, and never any other Lord.

analyzed: na tatra pratigṛhṇīyāt prāṇaiḥ kaṇṭha gataiḥ api
translated: One should not accept anything there, even if one's life is at stake.

analyzed: bhādra śukla caturdaśyām yāvat ākramate jalam
translated: From the fourteenth day of the bright fortnight of Bhadra up to the time the water recedes,

analyzed: tāvat gabham vijānīyāt tat dūram tīram ucyate
translated: one should know that distance as the womb, and that is said to be the far shore.

analyzed: sārddha hasta śatam yāvat garbhaḥ tīram tatas param
translated: Up to a distance of one hundred and fifty cubits, it is the womb, and beyond that is the shore.

original: iti keṣāṃ mataṃ devi śrutismṛtiṣu saṃmatam /
analyzed: iti keṣām matam devi śruti smṛtiṣu saṃmatam
translated: O Goddess, this is the opinion of some, approved in the Vedas and Smritis.

analyzed: tīrāt gavyūti mātram tu paritas kṣetram ucyate
translated: The area around is said to be one gavyuti (about 3 kms) from the shore.

original: tīraṃ tyaktvā vasetkṣetre tīre vāso na ceṣyate /
analyzed: tīram tyaktvā vaset kṣetre tīre vāsaḥ na ca iṣyate
translated: Abandoning the shore, one should dwell in the field, dwelling on the shore is not desired.

analyzed: eka yojana vistīrṇā kṣetra sīmā taṭa dvayāt
translated: The boundary of the field extends for one yojana on both sides of the river.

analyzed: gaṅgā sīmām na laghanti pāpāni api akhilāni api
translated: All sins do not touch the boundary of the Ganges.

original: tāṃ tu dṛṣṭvā palāyante yathā siṃhaṃ vanaukasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tām tu dṛṣṭvā palāyante yathā siṃham vanaukasaḥ
translated: Seeing it, they flee like forest animals seeing a lion.

analyzed: yatra gaṅgā mahābhāge rāma śaṃbhu tapaḥ vanam
translated: O greatly fortunate one, where the Ganges is, there is the penance grove of Rama and Shiva.

analyzed: siddha kṣetram tu tat jñeyam samantāt tu tri yojanam
translated: That should be known as a sacred place for spiritual attainment, extending for three yojanas all around.

analyzed: tīrthe na pratigṛhṇīyāt puṇyeṣu āyataneṣu ca
translated: One should not accept gifts at a sacred place or in holy shrines.

analyzed: nimitteṣu ca sarveṣu tad nivṛttaḥ bhavet naraḥ
translated: A man should turn away from all occasions for accepting gifts.

analyzed: tīrthe yaḥ pratigṛhṇāti puṇyeṣu āyataneṣu ca
translated: One who accepts gifts at a sacred place or in holy shrines,

analyzed: niṣphalam tasya tat tīrtham yāvat tat dhanam ucyate
translated: that sacred place is fruitless for him as long as that wealth is mentioned.

analyzed: gaṅgā vikrayāṇāt devi viṣṇoḥ vikrayaṇam bhavet
translated: O Goddess, by selling the Ganges, Vishnu would be sold.

analyzed: janārdane tu vikrīte vikrītam bhuvanatrayam
translated: When Janardana is sold, the three worlds are sold.

original: gaṅgā tīrasamudbhūtāṃ madaṃ mūrghnā bibharti yaḥ /
analyzed: gaṅgā tīra samudbhūtām madam mūrghnā bibharti yaḥ
translated: He who bears on his head the dust arising from the banks of the Ganges,

analyzed: bibharti rūpam sa ūrkasya tamaḥ nāśāya kevalam
translated: he alone bears the form of the sun for the sole purpose of destroying darkness.

analyzed: gaṅgā pulina jām dhūlim āstīrya atha nijān pitṝn
translated: Having covered his own ancestors with the dust arising from the banks of the Ganges,

analyzed: prīṇayan yaḥ naraḥ piṇḍān dadyāt tān svar nayet api
translated: a man who offers them funeral cakes and even leads them to heaven.

analyzed: idam te bhihitam bhadre gaṅgāmāhātmyam uttamam
translated: This excellent greatness of the Ganges has been told to you, O good lady.

original: paṭhan śṛṇvannaro hyeti tadviṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padam // / / //
analyzed: paṭhan śṛṇvan naraḥ hi eti tat viṣṇoḥ paramam padam
translated: A man who reads or listens to this goes to that supreme abode of Vishnu.

analyzed: nityam japyam idam bhaktyā prayataiḥ śraddhayā anvitaiḥ
translated: This should always be recited with devotion by those who are pure and endowed with faith.

analyzed: vaiṣṇavīm gatim icchadbhiḥ śaivīm vā vidhinandini
translated: O daughter of the mountain, by those desiring the state of Vishnu or Shiva.

original: iti śrībṛhannāradīyapurāṇottarabhāge mohinīvasusaṃvāde gaṅgāmāhātmye pūjādikathaṃ nāma tricatvāriṃśattamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī bṛhat nāradīya purāṇa uttara bhāge mohinīvasu saṃvāde gaṅgāmāhātmye pūjādikatham nāma tricatvāriṃśattamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirty-fourth chapter in the Uttaratapa section of the Bṛhannāradīya Purāṇa, describing the greatness of Gaṅgā and the performance of worship etc.
